MasterClauseData.IOBH_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program.
MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Updates_Section_4.3: Updates. Provider may update the information in Exhibit A or Exhibit B by providing written notice to BCBST, as provided in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Other_Termination_Section_11.6: Other Termination.  In addition to the termination rights under the “Term; Termination” provisions, either Party may terminate this Agreement in accordance with the terms of the “Right of Termination” or the “Severability” provisions in this Agreement. BCBST may also terminate this Agreement in accordance with the terms of the “Assignment”, “Change of Control”, “Provider Manual”, or “Amendments”  provisions in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Per_Visit_Section_1.18: “Per Visit” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member on a one (1) calendar day period, for each type of service for which a Per Visit payment is indicated in this Attachment. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Visit payment is payment in full for all services provided to the Member.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Long_Term_Acute_Care_Services_Secti: Long Term Acute Care Services.  Payment for long-term acute care Covered Services is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="LTAC_Covered_Services_Per_Diem" Title="LTAC_Covered_Services_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XX<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> Per Diem.
MasterClauseData.ORE_OM_Section_1.2: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Transfer_Payments_Section_3.2_a: Transfer Payments. Transfers are considered normal admissions for the Receiving Hospital and are reimbursable as an Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Receiving Hospital's contract. BCBST will pay Transferring Hospital the Transfer Per Diem in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Category Table above, not to exceed the total DRG Base Rate payment inclusive of outlier, had the Transfer not occurred.
MasterClauseData.OTB_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual. Presence of a fee is not a guarantee the service will be eligible for reimbursement. Final reimbursement determination include, but are not limited to, Member eligibility on the date of the service, Medical Necessity, Medical Appropriateness, applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, benefit plan exclusions/limitations, authorization/referral requirement, and applicable medical policies and guidelines.
MasterClauseData.DME_Generally_Section_3.1_a_p2: All references in this Attachment to the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule mean the fee schedule described in this ‘Generally' subsection in this Attachment.
MasterClauseData.HITMA_Injectables_Drugs_Section_3.3_p2: Due to the frequent changes in ASP/WAC, BCBST reserves the right to update the established rate without prior notification.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Transfer_Payments_Section_3.2_a: Transfer Payments. Transfers are considered normal admissions for the Receiving Hospital and are reimbursable as an Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Receiving Hospital's contract. The Transferring Hospital will receive the Transfer Per Diem in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Category Table above.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Rate_Codes_Section_2.4_p2: BCBST will not conduct any settlement or retroactive pricing or payment adjustments with Provider based on any changes, rebasing, adjustments, or outcomes of appeals related to any of Provider’s Medicare cost reports that impact or would have impacted the rates set by CMS for Provider.

MasterClauseData.ACAM_Acute_Care_Inpatient_and_Outpatient: Acute Care Inpatient and Outpatient Services. With the exception of those services specifically enumerated below, the established fee will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACAM_Network_MA_PPO_Acute_Care_Inpatient_Percent" Title="ACAM_Network_MA_PPO_Acute_Care_Inpatient_Percent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XXX%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule for acute care inpatient services and <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACAM_Network_MA_PPO_Acute_Care_Outpatient_Percent" Title="ACAM_Network_MA_PPO_Acute_Care_Outpatient_Percent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XXX%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule for acute care outpatient services. The payment noted above does not include payment for capital indirect medical education ("IME"), disproportionate share hospital ("DSH") payments, or any uncompensated care payments ("UCP"). Provider understands and agrees that: (1) there will be no payment for such capital IME, DSH or UCP costs from BCBST; and (2) operating IME is specifically excluded from payments from Medicare Advantage Organizations, and it is Provider's responsibility to seek reimbursement for operating IME directly from CMS.

MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Service_Area_Section_4.2: Service Area. Provider's service area is as shown on the attached Exhibit B Home Infusion Therapy Service Area (“Exhibit B”).
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: When multiple surgical procedures are performed on the same day, the payment for the first procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACR_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Title="ACR_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment, the payment for the second procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACR_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Title="ACR_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>50%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment and the payment for the third procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACR_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Title="ACR_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>50%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>  of the Per Case payment. No additional payments will be made for procedures beyond the third procedure. When a procedure is repeated on the same day there will be no additional payment for the second procedure. Bilateral procedures will be paid in accordance with the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.MABH_Original_Medicare_Section_1.2: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use Codes.  The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.

MasterClauseData.DME_Generally_Section_3.1_a_p1: Generally. Unless otherwise provided for below and subject to the Rate Updates section in this Attachment, payment for DME Covered Services
MasterClauseData.ASUM_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p1: Rate Updates. Rates under the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule are equivalent to amounts that would have been payable under Original Medicare to Provider for the same services; provided however, that BCBST updates its BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule in the timeframes described in the Provider Manual. No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS's release of a rate and BCBST's implementation of such rate in accordance with the Provider Manual or due to CMS's retroactive implementation of an amended rate.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Rate_Codes_Section_2.4_p1: Rate Updates. Rates under the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule are equivalent to amounts that would have been payable under Original Medicare to Provider for the same services; provided however, that BCBST updates its BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule in the timeframes described in the Provider Manual.  No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS’s release of a rate and BCBST’s implementation of such rate in accordance with the Provider Manual or due to CMS’s retroactive implementation of an amended rate.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Covered_Services_for_Inpatient_Secti: Outlier. When the Length of Stay during a single Inpatient Stay exceeds the BCBST Outlier Day Threshold per DRG as indicated in Schedule 1-A, the Payment Rate will be calculated using the following formula: DRG Base Rate + [(70% ( DRG Base Rate / ALOS)) * (LOS – BCBST Outlier Day Threshold)]. This applies to all services in the Inpatient Payment Category Table except [Short Term Stay], [Heart Assist], [Spina Bifida], [Obstetrics], [NICU], [Ultra High Cost Therapy Admission], [Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule], [Swing Bed], [Rehabilitation], and [Transfer.]

MasterClauseData.ODI_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.HITMA_Injectables_Drugs_Section_3.3_p1: Injectables Drugs.  Payment for injectable drugs related to home infusion therapy Covered Services is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Injectable_Drugs_Percent_of_Average_Sales_Price" Title="HITMA_Injectable_Drugs_Percent_of_Average_Sales_Price" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>106%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> percent of Average Sales Price (ASP) or, if there is no published ASP, a percentage of Wholesale Acquisition Cost (WAC) or Average Wholesale Price (AWP) as defined in the Provider Manual.

MasterClauseData.IPE_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_m: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Services_Section_4.1: Services. The specific home infusion therapy Covered Services provided by Provider are indicated in the attached Exhibit A - Home Infusion Therapy Services (“Exhibit A”).
MasterClauseData.HHPDN_Updates_Section_4.3: Updates. Provider may update the information in Exhibit A - Home Health Service Availability Checklist or Exhibit B - Home Health Service Area by providing written notice to BCBST, as provided in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.OTB_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="OTB_Maximum_Allowable" Title="OTB_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>, as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: Surgical Covered Services that are paid with the Outpatient Surgery Groups but that have not yet been assigned an Outpatient Surgery Group will appear on the Attachment 2-A and pay at the “Unlisted” rate until the annual recalibration process referenced in the Billing and Reimbursement Section of the Provider Manual, at which time the code will be moved to the appropriate Outpatient Surgery Group. These new assignments will automatically be made a part of Attachment 2-A, without any formal amendments thereto.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Transferring_Hospital_Section_1.17: “Transferring Hospital” means the hospital that initially admits and subsequently transfers a Member to a Receiving Hospital.

Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, the Payment Rate for an Inpatient Stay is the Payment Rate in effect on the date the Inpatient Stay begins.

MasterClauseData.IRL_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_lab_p2: For new codes or codes for which CMS does not publish a fee or methodology (i.e., codes other than those with status code “A”), reimbursement will be based on a reasonable allowable determined by BCBST, as described in the Provider Manual. In the event that CMS publishes a fee for a code for which it did not previously publish a fee, BCBST will implement such fee within a reasonable amount of time after publication.

Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, the Payment Rate for an Inpatient Stay is the Payment Rate in effect on the date the Inpatient Stay begins.

If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provider_Immediate_Termination_Secti: A judgment of civil liability or a criminal conviction (including a plea of nolo contendere) for Medicare or Medicaid fraud or similar offense involving health insurance fraud, revocation or suspension of participation in Medicare and/or Medicaid, or conviction (including a plea of nolo contendere) of a felony or of a misdemeanor involving fraud or moral turpitude is rendered against BCBST.

Surgical procedures will be paid according to the Outpatient Surgery Group to which BCBST assigns the procedure contained in Attachment 2-A.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1_p2: Reimbursement for behavioral health services is based on the level of care provided and the age of the Member. Definitions of the age ranges included herein are included in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.OTB_Original_Medicare_Section_1.2: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.HITMA_Total_Parenteral_Nutrition_Solutio: Total Parenteral Nutrition Solutions.  Payment for total parenteral nutrition solutions Covered Services is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Total_Parenteral_Nutrition_Solutions_Percent_of_Medicare_Region_C_DMEPOS_Fee_Schedule" Title="HITMA_Total_Parenteral_Nutrition_Solutions_Percent_of_Medicare_Region_C_DMEPOS_Fee_Schedule" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Medicare Region C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee (“DMEPOS Schedule”) published as of January 1 of each year. BCBST implements updates to the DMEPOS Schedule on April 1 of each year. Covered Services provided between January 1 and March 31 will be reimbursed based on the previous year's DMEPOS Schedule.
MasterClauseData.BFS_Reimbursement_Policy_p1: The table above, in conjunction with BCBST’s reimbursement policies, as fully detailed in the Provider Manual, sets forth the basis for calculating the established fee for Covered Services provided to BCBST <# <Conditional Test=“//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Chiropractic’]” /> #>FEP<# <EndConditional/> #> Members who receive benefits through <# <Content Select="//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Network_Name" Optional="true"/> #>. Any updates and/or changes to BCBST’s reimbursement policies will be communicated no later than sixty (60) days  prior to implementation thereof via BCBST’s standard method of notice.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_m: Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Injectables_Drugs_Section_3.3_p3: Reimbursement for medications is limited to that amount actually prescribed and administered to the Member. Provider is responsible for using the most economical packaging of medication to achieve the required dosage for the Member with the least amount of medication wastage.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Hospice_Services_Section_3.1_p3: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies, used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.HHPDN_Service_Area_Section_4.2: Service Area. Provider's service area is as shown on the attached Exhibit B - Home Health Service Area.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Term_Termination_Termination_or_E: Termination or Exclusion of Associated Provider. In the event that BCBST excludes an Associated Provider from participation under this Agreement for cause or terminates a direct contract between BCBST and an Associated Provider for cause, such Associated Provider will no longer be permitted to participate under this Agreement. Provider will be responsible for notifying Members who present to Provider for treatment that the affected Associated Provider is not participating with BCBST. Provider will submit any claims for such Associated Provider with the Associated Provider’s NPI number. If BCBST determines that Provider has been submitting claims for services rendered by the terminated or excluded Associated Provider in such a way that it appears such services were rendered by a Network Provider, BCBST may terminate this Agreement for cause.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Term_Termination_Cooperation_Upon: Cooperation Upon Termination; No Interference; Non-Disparagement.  The Parties agree to cooperate with each other to resolve promptly any outstanding financial, administrative, or patient care issues upon the termination of this Agreement. The Parties further agree to work together in good faith to provide timely and appropriate notice to Members of the anticipated termination date of this Agreement. Provider agrees to assist Members who are under the care of Provider or who have scheduled Covered Services to be provided after the anticipated termination date, in transitioning to another Network Provider.  Provider further agrees to promptly supply all records and documents necessary for the settlement of outstanding claims for Covered Services upon the termination of the Agreement. Provider also agrees to refrain in every instance from interfering with the contractual relationship between BCBST and its Members or to discourage any person from doing business with BCBST. Finally, both Parties agree not to make any statements, written or verbal, or cause or encourage others to make any statements, written or verbal, that defame, disparage, or in any way criticize the personal or business reputation, practices, or conduct of the other party, its employees, directors, and officers. The Parties acknowledge and agree that this prohibition extends to statements, written or verbal, made to anyone, including but not limited to, the news media, investors, potential investors, any board of directors or advisory board or directors, industry analysts, competitors, strategic partners, vendors, employees (past and present), and clients.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Services_and_Responsibilities_Mem: Open Communication. BCBST encourages open provider-patient communication regarding appropriate treatment alternatives. BCBST will not penalize Provider for discussing Medically Necessary care with Members.

Member Relations. Each Party to this Agreement, their staff, personnel, and agents will treat Members promptly, fairly and courteously, whether by phone, in person, or in writing.  Both Parties, and their respective employees, will endeavor to maintain a high level of customer service and satisfaction.

Maximization of Benefits. Provider acknowledges that BCBST may assist Members from time to time in maximizing their benefits, including through the use of care coordination activities, transparency tools and Member education.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Services_and_Responsibilities_Ide: Identification Cards. BCBST agrees to provide appropriate identification cards for BCBST Members, which may be in electronic, digital, or physical form.  In order to ensure proper identification of each Member, Provider agrees to use reasonable efforts to verify the identity of the BCBST identification card-holder, including, but not necessarily limited to, checking a valid state-issued identification card, a validly-issued driver’s license, or any other appropriate picture ID.
MasterClauseData.UNI_Services_and_Responsibilities_Accept: Acceptance of Assignments. Provider will accept assignments for the payment of services provided to Members. Provider will acquire and maintain all necessary evidence of assignments
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Relationship_Between_The_Parties_: Limitation on Provider and Third Parties. Provider is entering into this Agreement for itself and on behalf of the Entities listed on Exhibit 1A.  This Agreement is entered into by Provider with the understanding that this Agreement will not constitute an agreement between Provider and other third parties that are parties to similar agreements or contracts.  Provider agrees that this Agreement does not constitute an agreement that Provider may act as agent for any third party that becomes party to a similar agreement or impose any liability upon any third party by reason of any act or acts of omission or commission on its part.  If Provider desires to add a new Entity to this Agreement, both Parties agree that Exhibit 1A must be amended in a writing signed by both Parties.

Independence of the Parties. Provider expressly acknowledges its understanding that this Agreement constitutes a legally binding agreement between Provider and BCBST.  BCBST and Provider are independent legal entities contracting with each other solely to carry out the terms of this Agreement for the purposes stated herein.  Nothing in this Agreement will be construed or be deemed to create a relationship other than that of independent parties. BCBST is an independent corporation operating under a license from the BCBSA, permitting BCBST to use the BCBS Marks, and BCBST is not contracting as the agent of the BCBSA.  Provider acknowledges and agrees that it has not entered into this Agreement based upon representations by any Person other than BCBST, and that no Person other than BCBST will be held accountable or liable to Provider for any of BCBST’s obligations to Provider created under this Agreement.

Associated Providers and Entities. If Provider desires to provide professional services at a new practice location or add a new Associated Provider to this Agreement, then such a change requires only advance notice and does not require an amendment signed by both parties. If Provider provides or arranges for Covered Services through Associated Providers and/or Entities, then any obligations under this Agreement applicable to Provider will apply equally to such Associated Providers and Entities, as applicable.  Provider will bind all Associated Providers and Entities to the terms of this Agreement and Provider is responsible for ensuring Associated Providers’ and Entities’ compliance with this Agreement. In the event an Associated Provider or Entity is not credentialed until after the Effective Date, such Associated Provider or Entity will not be a participating provider and will not be permitted to perform services under this Agreement until they are credentialed. Provider represents that they have obtained each Associated Provider’s acknowledgement and consent that this Agreement supersedes the terms of any individual agreement such Associated Provider has with BCBST for purposes of such Associated Provider’s participation with Provider under this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Records_Access_Inspection_and_Con: Processing of Claims. Provider will furnish to BCBST, without charge, all information reasonably required by BCBST for the proper processing and adjudication of claims, including complete and accurate descriptions of the services performed and charges made. Provider will furnish such data in an electronic format and provide all encounter data as requested by BCBST.
MasterClauseData.UNI_Recitals_Now_Therefore: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants hereinafter contained, the Parties agree as follows:
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Liability_and_Indemnification_Thi: Third Party Acts and Omissions. Neither BCBST, Provider, nor any of their respective agents or employees will be liable to third parties for any act or omission of the other Party.
MasterClauseData.UNI_General_Provisions_Waiver_of_Breach: Waiver of Breach. Neither the waiver by either of the Parties of a breach of, or a default under, any of the provisions of this Agreement, nor the failure of either of the Parties, on one or more occasions, to enforce any of the provisions of this Agreement, or to exercise any right or privilege hereunder, will be construed as a waiver of any subsequent breach or default of a similar nature, or as a waiver of any such provisions, rights, or privileges hereunder.
MasterClauseData.UNI_General_Provisions_Headings: Headings. The headings of articles and sections contained in this Agreement are for reference purposes only, will not be deemed to be a part of this Agreement for any purpose, and will not in any way define or affect the meaning, interpretation, construction, or scope of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_General_Provisions_Execution_of_A: Execution of Agreement. Each Party represents and warrants that it may lawfully execute this Agreement and perform the obligations described herein, and that the execution of this Agreement and compliance with its provisions will not in any material respect conflict with or constitute a default (immediately, with due notice, with the passage of time, or otherwise) under any agreement or instrument to which it is a party, or to the best of its knowledge, under any applicable law, rule, regulation, court order, or decree.  Provider will immediately notify BCBST in the event of a change in the individuals authorized to act on behalf of Provider with regard to this Agreement, and will, from time to time upon BCBST’s reasonable request, provide documentation confirming authorized signatories for purposes of this Agreement. To facilitate execution, this Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which will be considered an original, and which collectively will constitute the Agreement. A scanned, imaged, electronic, photocopy or stamp of the signatures hereunder will have the same force and effect as an originally executed signature.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_General_Provisions_Entire_Agreeme: Entire Agreement. This Agreement, together with the applicable Provider Manual, other manuals provided to Provider via the BCBST website or in hard copy format, and exhibits, schedules, and attachments, constitutes the entire Agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements and undertakings, whether oral or written. In the event that an earlier executed agreement exists between the Parties regarding Provider’s participation in the Networks included in this Agreement for the items and services eligible for payment under this Agreement, this Agreement will supersede such earlier agreement with regard to such Networks and such items and services as of the first day of the Fixed Term, or, if different, the first day of the Network-specific Fixed Term. This Agreement will remain in full force and effect with respect to all Members, unless otherwise expressly stated.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Definitions_Payor: “Payor” means a person or entity that is responsible for paying for Covered Services in accordance with the terms of the Blue Cross Benefit Plan under which the Member being treated is covered.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Definitions_Network_Provider: “Network Provider” means a healthcare provider contracted to provide Covered Services to Members enrolled in a Blue Cross Benefit Plan.
MasterClauseData.UNI_Definitions_Network_Participation_Cr: “Network Participation Criteria” means the minimum qualifications and standards required in order to be considered and selected to participate in a Network, as described in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Definitions_Network_Attachment: “Network Attachment” means an attachment or exhibit to this Agreement that describes the rates to be paid to Provider for provision of certain services to BCBST Members accessing a particular Network.  Network Attachments may also include specific terms or conditions applicable only to Provider’s participation in that Network.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Definitions_Member_Obligations: “Member Obligation(s)” means any and all charges that a Network Provider may collect directly from a Member as the Member’s portion of payment for Covered Services, including the copayments, deductibles and coinsurance amounts described in the Member’s Blue Cross Benefit Plan.
MasterClauseData.BHABA_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BHABA_Maximum_Allowable" Title="BHABA_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Definitions_Members: “Member(s)” means an individual eligible to receive Covered Services under a Blue Cross Benefit Plan.
MasterClauseData.UNI_Definitions_Maximum_Allowable: “Maximum Allowable” means the amount that the Payor has determined to be the maximum amount payable for a Covered Service, which will be the lesser of billed charges or the established fee for the services performed as set forth in the applicable Network Attachment.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Definitions_Contract_Addresses: “Contract Address(es)” means the current email address(es) specified for notifications between the Parties related to this Agreement. The Parties acknowledge that BCBST may specify different email address(es) for different purposes under this Agreement. Please see the Provider Manual for details on the current BCBST Contract Addresses and where to create and update your Contract Addresses.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Definitions_Clean_Claim: “Clean Claim” means a claim for payment of Covered Services provided to a Member by a Network Provider that requires no further information, adjustment, or alteration in order to be processed and paid by BCBST or the responsible Payor.
MasterClauseData.UNI_Definitions_Change_of_Control: “Change of Control” means the occurrence of any of the following: (a) direct or indirect sale, transfer, conveyance or other disposition (other than by way of merger, consolidation, reorganization or conversion), in one or a series of related transactions, of all or a majority of the properties or assets of Provider; (b) the consummation of any transaction (including, without limitation, any merger, consolidation, reorganization or conversion) the result of which is that a Person that is not an Affiliate prior to the transaction becomes the beneficial owner, directly or indirectly, of more than 25% of the then-outstanding number of units, interests, or shares of the Provider's voting stock (or membership interests or other equity); (c) a Person that is not an Affiliate prior to the transaction assumes substantial operational control of Provider or one or more service lines, departments, or ancillary services provided by Provider, including but not limited to operational control exercised through the entry into, or change in, an agreement for a Person that is not an Affiliate prior to the transaction to provide management or outsourcing services to Provider; or (d) there is a change to a Person that has the authority to appoint individuals to Provider's Board of Directors or equivalent governing board.
MasterClauseData.UNI_Definitions_BCBSA: “BCBSA” means the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association, an association of independent Blue Cross and Blue Shield licensees.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Definitions_BCBS_Marks: “BCBS Marks” means the trademarks, names, logos, symbols and service marks owned by the BCBSA.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Compensation_Subrogation_and_Righ: Provider’s Obligation. Provider acknowledges and agrees that it will have no right of subrogation or recovery from the Member or a third party for Covered Services rendered to a Member pursuant to this Agreement. Payment of the applicable Maximum Allowable will be payment in full for such Covered Services.

BCBST’s Right to Subrogation and Recovery. Provider acknowledges and agrees that BCBST will be subrogated to and have the right to recover amounts paid for Covered Services whenever a Member receives such Covered Services to treat illnesses or injuries caused by the Member or a third party. In such circumstances, BCBST will have the right to recover amounts paid for Covered Services for the Member’s illness or injury on a first-dollar basis, regardless of whether the Member has been made whole for his or her injuries. Provider agrees that BCBST’s right to reimbursement or subrogation are net of reasonable costs and attorney’s fees, such costs and fees not to exceed 30% of the gross amount owed to BCBST.
MasterClauseData.UNI_Compensation_Submission_of_Charges_A: Administrative, Clinical, and Support Services. Provider agrees to provide all administrative, clinical and support services necessary to deliver the services it is licensed, credentialed and qualified to provide. Provider also agrees that it will not engage in the unbundling of such services or permit other providers to bill for such administrative, clinical and support services.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Compensation_Payment_Dispute_Reso: Payment Dispute Resolution. Both Parties agree that it is the intent of this Agreement that all payments and dispute resolutions will be resolved pursuant to the terms of this Agreement and the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Compensation_Overpayments_or_Unde: Recoupment Limitations. For all Networks, other than those requiring a longer period by regulation or statute, BCBST’s request for recoupments will be made no later than 18 months after the date that BCBST paid the claim submitted by Provider that has been paid in error, except in the case of Provider’s fraud, in which case no time limit will apply.

Payment Correction. Provider agrees that BCBST will not be required to correct a payment error to Provider if the request for payment correction is made more than 18 months from the date Provider received payment or notice of non-payment for the specific claim in issue.
MasterClauseData.CMDNPA_Compensation_Coordination_Mainten: Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits. When a Member is eligible for benefits under more than one health insurance program, policy, or other form of governmental or non-governmental health insurance coverage, the determination of primary and secondary liability (“Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits”) will be made in accordance with applicable rules and established guidelines. Provider will make a good faith effort to determine if a Member is eligible for Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits. If Provider becomes aware of the availability of other health insurance coverage, it will promptly notify BCBST of that fact. Provider may seek payment for the provision of services rendered by Provider from multiple health benefit plans when a Member is eligible to receive benefits from other health insurers. If BCBST is the secondary Payor, then BCBST will coordinate with the primary insurance carrier or Payor and pay up to the Maximum Allowable or will pay as set forth in the Member’s Blue Cross Benefit Plan. When Provider seeks payment from another insurer, Provider is not obligated to seek payment from such insurer based on the rates in the applicable Network Attachment. BCBST and Provider will cooperate and exchange information regarding alternative health coverage of Members and other information relative to Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Section_4_Tiered_Facility_Drug_Fee_S: The Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule will be updated in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for the Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule.
Drug codes submitted for consideration, but not shown on the Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule are not eligible for payment and will be denied as non-contracted.

Drugs shown on the Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule and associated with Not Otherwise Classified (“NOC”) or Unlisted/Miscellaneous/Non-Specific HCPCS Codes or with no established fee shown will be manually priced in accordance with BCBST’s policy for Unlisted, Miscellaneous, Non-Specific and Not Otherwise Classified Procedures/Services, but may not be eligible for payment. Such drugs must be billed with a unit of one (1) and require submission of: (i) drug name; (ii) National Drug Code (“NDC”) in field 43 “Revenue Description/ IDE/ Medicaid Drug Rebate” on the CMS-1450 claim form; and (iii) dosage administered. Failure to submit this information will result in delay of reimbursement.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p5: Notwithstanding the DRG Payment Rate set forth in the Inpatient Payment Category Table above for a covered Inpatient Stay, when Provider submits a claim for payment of a drug listed on the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule, then Provider will be paid the Per Diem listed in the Inpatient Payment Category Table above for the Ultra High Cost Admission and the applicable Payment Rate for the drug set forth on the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule instead of the applicable DRG Payment Rate.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p4: The Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule will be updated in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p3: Drug codes submitted for consideration, but not shown on the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule are included in the Inpatient Payment and are not eligible for additional payment.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p2: Drugs shown on the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule and associated with Not Otherwise Classified (“NOC”) or Unlisted/Miscellaneous/Non-Specific HCPCS Codes or with no established fee shown will be manually priced in accordance with BCBST’s policy for Unlisted, Miscellaneous, Non-Specific and Not Otherwise Classified Procedures/Services, but may not be eligible for payment. Such drugs must be billed with a unit of one (1) and require submission of: (i) drug name; (ii) National Drug Code (“NDC”) in field 43 “Revenue Description/ IDE/ Medicaid Drug Rebate” on the CMS-1450 claim form; and (iii) dosage administered. Failure to submit this information will result in delayed reimbursement.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p1: Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule. BCBST will pay for inpatient drugs listed in the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule, in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule contained in the Provider Manual. Eligible drugs will be reimbursed in addition to the Ultra High Cost Therapy Admission filed on the CMS-1450 (UB-04 or successor) claim form.
MasterClauseData.ACA_CMS_Section_1.3: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.IRL_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_lab_p1: Rate Updates. Fee amounts set forth in the BCBST Base Independent Laboratory Fee Schedule are based on current year Medicare rates. BCBST implements updates to Medicare-based rates on April 1 of each year. Services provided between January 1 and March 31 will be reimbursed based on the previous year's Medicare rates.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Exclusions_Section_3.2_P2: Services that are not covered by CMS under Original Medicare for inpatient rehabilitation services.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Transplant_Services_Section_3: Transplant Services. Payment for transplants is as follows.
Subject to the Maximum Allowable where applicable, Provider agrees to accept as payment in full and BCBST, or the applicable Payor, agrees to pay Provider for:
Hospice services
Transplants not otherwise specifically identified in the Billing and Reimbursement Guidelines Section above
Outpatient dialysis services
Outpatient pharmacy services (except for outpatient infusion therapy services related to the underlying organ failure or a complication of the transplant)
Outpatient durable medical equipment and home health services
Mental health and substance abuse services
MasterClauseData.ACR_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p5: Notwithstanding the DRG Payment Rate set forth in the Inpatient Payment Category Table above for a covered Inpatient Stay, when Provider submits a claim for payment of a drug listed on the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule, then Provider will be paid the Per Diem listed in the Inpatient Payment Category Table above for the Ultra High Cost Admission and the applicable Payment Rate for the drug set forth on the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule instead of the applicable DRG Payment Rate.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p4: The Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule will be updated in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p3: Drug codes submitted for consideration, but not shown on the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule are included in the Inpatient Payment and are not eligible for additional payment.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p2: Drugs shown on the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule and associated with Not Otherwise Classified (“NOC”) or Unlisted/Miscellaneous/Non-Specific HCPCS Codes or with no established fee shown will be manually priced in accordance with BCBST’s policy for Unlisted, Miscellaneous, Non-Specific and Not Otherwise Classified Procedures/Services, but may not be eligible for payment. Such drugs must be billed with a unit of one (1) and require submission of: (i) drug name; (ii) National Drug Code (“NDC”) in field 43 “Revenue Description/ IDE/ Medicaid Drug Rebate” on the CMS-1450 claim form; and (iii) dosage administered. Failure to submit this information will result in delayed reimbursement.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p1: Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule. BCBST will pay for inpatient drugs listed in the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule, in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule contained in the Provider Manual. Eligible drugs will be reimbursed in addition to the Ultra High Cost Therapy Admission filed on the CMS-1450 (UB-04 or successor) claim form.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Section_4_Tiered_Facility_Drug_Fee_S: The Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule will be updated in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for the Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule.
Drug codes submitted for consideration, but not shown on the Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule are not eligible for payment and will be denied as non-contracted.

Drugs shown on the Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule and associated with Not Otherwise Classified (“NOC”) or Unlisted/Miscellaneous/Non-Specific HCPCS Codes or with no established fee shown will be manually priced in accordance with BCBST’s policy for Unlisted, Miscellaneous, Non-Specific and Not Otherwise Classified Procedures/Services, but may not be eligible for payment. Such drugs must be billed with a unit of one (1) and require submission of: (i) drug name; (ii) National Drug Code (“NDC”) in field 43 “Revenue Description/ IDE/ Medicaid Drug Rebate” on the CMS-1450 claim form; and (iii) dosage administered. Failure to submit this information will result in delay of reimbursement.

Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule. BCBST will pay for outpatient drugs listed in the Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule, in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule contained in the Provider Manual. Eligible drugs will be reimbursed in addition to other outpatient services filed on the CMS-1450 (UB-04 or successor) claim form.
MasterClauseData.ASU_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: When multiple surgical procedures are performed on the same day, the payment for the first procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ASU_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Title="ASU_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<#<EndTrackedContent/>#> of the Per Case payment, the payment for the second procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ASU_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Title="ASU_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>50%<#<EndTrackedContent/>#> of the Per Case payment, and the payment for the third procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ASU_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Title="ASU_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>0%<#<EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment. No additional payments will be made for procedures beyond the third procedure. When a procedure is repeated on the same day there will be no additional payment for the second procedure. Bilateral procedures will be paid in accordance with the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Transplant_Services_Section_3: The Parties agree that regardless of whether Provider includes and/or otherwise manages or operates any of the below listed types of facilities and/or has available the below types of services, these are not included in this Attachment, or the Agreement unless otherwise specifically agreed to by the Parties in writing and/or included in a separate Network Attachment included in the Agreement.
Professional Covered Services are excluded from the Global Rate and will be paid separately to the Healthcare Professional who renders the services to the Member.

Professional Covered Services are excluded from the Global Rate and/or the BMT/Stem Cell Transplant Global Rate, respectively, and will be paid separately to the Healthcare Professional who renders the services to the Member.

Where applicable and only to the extent not covered by the health benefits or health coverage of the donor, Covered Services for the donor are limited to those services and supplies directly related to the transplant itself, such as testing for the donor’s compatibility, removal of the organ or tissue from the donor’s body, preservation of the organ or tissue and transportation of the organ or tissue to the site of the transplant.  For clarification, no payment will be made nor is it due to Provider, or any organ or tissue donor or the donor’s family or legal representative(s) as compensation for the donation of the organ or tissue or the organ or tissue itself or obtaining consent to donate an organ or tissue or other donor services or screening or assessment procedures not specifically authorized by and covered under the Member’s Benefit Plan. For purposes of this paragraph, references to ‘tissue’ include bone marrow and/or stem cells.

Where applicable and only to the extent not covered by the health benefits or health coverage of the donor, Covered Services for the donor are limited to those services and supplies directly related to the transplant itself, such as testing for the donor’s compatibility, removal of the organ or tissue from the donor’s body, preservation of the organ or tissue and transportation of the organ or tissue to the site of the transplant, and harvest and preparation of donor cells for bone marrow/stem cell transplants.  For clarification, no payment will be made nor is it due to Provider, or any organ or tissue donor or the donor’s family or legal representative(s) as compensation for the donation of the organ or tissue or the organ or tissue itself or obtaining consent to donate an organ or tissue or other donor services or screening or assessment procedures not specifically authorized by and covered under the Member’s Benefit Plan. For purposes of this paragraph, references to ‘tissue’ include bone marrow and/or stem cells.

Prior Authorization Transplants rendered to a Member who expires or dies within 48 hours after the transplant: <# <TrackedContent TrackName="TRANS_Member_Expires_Within_48_hours" Title="TRANS_Member_Expires_Within_48_hours" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>90%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Global Rate.

Prior Authorization Transplants and BMT/Stem Cell Transplants rendered to a Member who expires or dies within 48 hours after the transplant: <# <TrackedContent TrackName="TRANS_Member_Expires_Within_48_hours" Title="TRANS_Member_Expires_Within_48_hours" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>90%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Global Rate.

Prior Authorization Covered Services rendered to a Member following inpatient admission but who expires or dies prior to the transplant and following inpatient admission in anticipation of a transplant that does not occur and/or is aborted or cancelled, regardless of the cause: Payment for Covered Services pursuant to the terms and rates set out in the Acute Care Network Attachment.
Provider will not be paid for any travel expenses (e.g., transportation, meals, lodging, etc.) incurred by the Member or the Member’s family.

Retransplant Services with Prior Authorization by BCBST, or the applicable Payor, rendered by the Provider within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="TRANS_Retransplant_Services_within" Title="TRANS_Retransplant_Services_within" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>60<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> days after the date of the original transplant: <# <TrackedContent TrackName="TRANS_Retransplant_Services_Global_Rate" Title="TRANS_Retransplant_Services_Global_Rate" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>90%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Global Rate.
Transplants rendered by the Provider during the Global Period will be paid the Global Rate.
Transplants and BMT/Stem Cell Transplants rendered by the Provider during the Global Period will be paid the Global Rate.
Payment for outpatient Covered Services rendered to Members outside of the Global Period will be pursuant to the terms and rates set out in the Acute Care Network Attachment.

Pre-transplant services rendered by the Provider during the period of consecutive inpatient days immediately prior to the first day of the Global Period during which the Member is admitted to the Provider in anticipation of the transplant and/or post-transplant services rendered by the Provider during the period of approved consecutive inpatient days following the end of the Global Period during which the Member remains inpatient: the Outlier Per Diem.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.5: Use of Codes. The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual.  If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Additional_Policies_Section_2: Some Revenue Codes are not eligible for payment by BCBST, and some other Revenue Codes may only be eligible for payment when billed with a specific CPT® Code.

Bone marrow/stem cell acquisition costs not otherwise covered by the donor’s insurance or health benefits and are Covered Services under the Member’s Benefit Plan, including without limitation the following, are included in the BMT/Stem Cell Transplant Global Payment set out in the Transplant Table: (i) recipient registration or listing fees; (ii) laboratory tests (including tissue typing of recipient and donor); (iii) Transplant Center services related to the harvest and preparation of the donor cells; (iv) operating room services; (v) intensive care costs; (vi) preservation supplies; (vii) preservation technician services; (viii) where applicable, cord blood acquisition and storage costs, if any; and (ix) transportation of donor cells; and

Solid organ acquisition costs not otherwise covered by the donor’s insurance or health benefits and are Covered Services under the Member’s Benefit Plan, including without limitation the following, are included in the Global Rate(s) set out in the Transplant Table: (i) solid organ recipient registration or listing fees; (ii) laboratory tests (including tissue typing of recipient and donor); (iii) Provider services that are directly related to the excision of the donor solid organ; (iv) operating room services; (v) intensive care costs; (vi) preservation supplies (perfusion materials and equipment); (vii) preservation technician services; (viii) transportation of cadaver organ; and (ix) tissue typing of the cadaver organ; and

All Transplants and BMT/Stem Cell Transplants are subject to Prior Authorization, Utilization Management Program, ongoing case management, and any other conditions or terms contained in the applicable Benefit Plan;
MasterClauseData.DME_Generally_Section_3.1_a_i: is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="DME_Generally_Commercial_fee_schedule_Percentage" Title="DME_Generally_Commercial_fee_schedule_Percentage" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule, which is based on the current year Medicare DME MAC Jurisdiction C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee under Original Medicare; or
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Additional_Policies_Section_2: All Transplants are subject to Prior Authorization, Utilization Management Program, ongoing case management, and any other conditions or terms contained in the applicable Benefit Plan;
Provider must obtain Prior Authorization from BCBST, or the applicable Payor, for all Transplants and BMT/Stem Cell Transplants;
Provider must obtain Prior Authorization from BCBST, or the applicable Payor, for all Transplants;
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Reimbursement_Policies_Sectio: Presence of a fee is not a guarantee the service will be eligible for reimbursement. Final reimbursement determinations include, but are not limited to, Member eligibility on the date of service, Medical Necessity, Medical Appropriateness, applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, benefit plan exclusions/limitations, authorization/referral requirement, and applicable medical policies and guidelines.
Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Billing_Requirements_Section_: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="TRANS_Billing_Requirements" Title="TRANS_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/>#>CMS 1450 form<#<EndTrackedContent/>#> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable. The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="TRANS_Maximum_Allowable" Title="TRANS_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/>#>claim level<#<EndTrackedContent/>#> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Retransplant_Services_Section: “Retransplant Services” means the services related to retransplant of the organ originally transplanted within 60 days of the original transplant surgery.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Per_Diems_Section_1.8: “Per Diem(s)” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member for each day of an Inpatient Stay. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Diem payment, less any applicable Member Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member during each day of an Inpatient Stay including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Payment_Rates_Section_1.7: “Payment Rate(s)” means Maximum Allowable as defined in the Billing and Reimbursement Guidelines section below.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Payment_Methodology_Section_1: “Payment Methodology” means a methodology for determining Payment Rates in this attachment.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_MCC_Section_1.5: “MCC”, as defined by CMS, means major complication or comorbidity.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Global_Period_Section_1.4: “Global Period” (GP) means the period of time beginning 1 day before the transplant itself and ending on the last day of the identified number of consecutive days shown in the Transplant Table. This definition does not apply to bone marrow or stem cell transplants.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Global_Rate_Section_1.3_bmt: “Global Rate” means the dollar amount designated in the Transplant Table, included below, as payment for all transplant Covered Services rendered for a particular Transplant or BMT/Stem Cell Transplant, respectively, and organ and/or tissue acquisition costs attributed (and otherwise detailed in the Billing and Reimbursement Guidelines Section below) during the applicable Global Period or BMT/Stem Cell Global Period, respectively.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Global_Rate_Section_1.3: “Global Rate” means the dollar amount designated in the Transplant Table, included below, as payment for all transplant Covered Services rendered for a particular Transplant and organ and/or tissue acquisition costs attributed (and otherwise detailed in the Billing and Reimbursement Guidelines Section below) during the applicable Global Period.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Transplants_Section_1.11: “Transplant(s)” means: (a) those specific non-investigational/non-experimental solid organ transplants identified in the Billing and Reimbursement Guidelines Section below and transplant related services and for which: (i) the Member is otherwise eligible under their Benefit Plan; (ii) for which Provider has obtained Prior Authorization from BCBST, or the applicable Payor; (iii) are Medically Necessary and Medically Appropriate as defined in the applicable Member’s Benefit Plan; and (iv) are Covered Services as defined in the Agreement; and (b) unless otherwise excluded elsewhere in this Attachment, those inpatient and outpatient Covered Services related to the transplant and occurring during the Global Period, including without limitation: (i) donor related services described in the Reimbursement Section below and not otherwise covered by the donor’s insurance or health benefits and that are Covered Services under the Member’s Benefit Plan; (ii) the transplant itself; and (iii) inpatient and/or outpatient Covered Services during the Global Period for which Provider provides, arranges and/or refers the Member. This definition does not apply to bone marrow or stem cell transplants.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_Revenue_Code_Section_1.10: “Revenue Code” means a hospital Revenue Code as adopted by CMS.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_CPT_Code_Section_1.2: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_BMT_Stem_Cell_Transplants_Sec: “BMT/Stem Cell Transplant(s)” means those specific non-investigational/non-experimental bone marrow and/or stem cell transplants identified in the Reimbursement Section below and transplant related services and for which: (i) the Member is otherwise eligible under their  Benefit Plan; (ii) for which Provider has obtained Prior Authorization from BCBST, or the applicable Payor; (iii) are Medically Necessary and Medically Appropriate as defined in the applicable Member’s BCBST Benefit Plan; and (iv) are Covered Services as defined in the Agreement.  For purposes of this Attachment and unless otherwise excluded elsewhere in this Attachment, ‘transplant related services’ means inpatient and outpatient Covered Services related to the bone marrow or stem cell transplant and occurring during the BMT/Stem Cell Transplant Global Period, including without limitation: (A) mobilization and suppression, including without limitation chemotherapy and/or radiation treatment as the first step in the transplant process itself; (B) donor related services described in the Reimbursement Section below and not otherwise covered by the donor’s insurance or health benefits and that are Covered Services under the Member’s Benefit Plan; (C) the transplant itself (the infusion); and (D) inpatient and/or outpatient services during the BMT/Stem Cell Transplant Global Period for which Provider provides, arranges and/or refers the Member.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="LTAC_Maximum_Allowable" Title="LTAC_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Per_Unit_Section_1.17: “Per Unit” means a Payment Methodology based on CPT® Code/HCPCS Code in the applicable fee schedules for each unit of service. Provider must bill the appropriate Revenue Code and CPT® Code/HCPCS Code to receive payment.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.TRANS_Comm_BMT_SCT_Global_Period_Section: “BMT/Stem Cell Transplant Global Period” (BSCT-GP) means: (i) for inpatient bone marrow/stem cell transplants,  the global period for bone marrow transplants begins 1 day prior to the date marrow ablative therapy began and ending on the last day of the identified number of consecutive days shown in Transplant Table; or (ii) for outpatient bone marrow/stem cell transplants, the period of time beginning on the day of the outpatient bone marrow or stem cell transplant and ending on the last day of the identified number of consecutive days shown in Transplant Table.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Per_Visit_Section_1: “Per Visit” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member on a one (1) calendar day period, for each type of service for which a Per Visit payment is indicated in this Attachment. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Visit payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and institution and ancillary services. Provider is required to identify each date of service when submitting claims that span multiple dates of service.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Per_Visit_Section_1: “Per Visit” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member on a one (1) calendar day period, for each type of service for which a Per Visit payment is indicated in this Attachment. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Visit payment is payment in full for all services provided to the Member.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Section_4_Tiered_Facility_Drug_Fee_S: The Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule will be updated in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for the Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule.
Drug codes submitted for consideration, but not shown on the Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule are not eligible for payment and will be denied as non-contracted.

Drugs shown on the Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule and associated with Not Otherwise Classified (“NOC”) or Unlisted/Miscellaneous/Non-Specific HCPCS Codes or with no established fee shown will be manually priced in accordance with BCBST’s policy for Unlisted, Miscellaneous, Non-Specific and Not Otherwise Classified Procedures/Services, but may not be eligible for payment. Such drugs must be billed with a unit of one (1) and require submission of: (i) drug name; (ii) National Drug Code (“NDC”) in field 43 “Revenue Description/ IDE/ Medicaid Drug Rebate” on the CMS-1450 claim form; and (iii) dosage administered. Failure to submit this information will result in delay of reimbursement.

Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule. BCBST will pay for outpatient drugs listed in the Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule, in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for Tiered Facility Drug Fee Schedule contained in the Provider Manual. Eligible drugs will be reimbursed in addition to other outpatient services filed on the CMS-1450 (UB-04 or successor) claim form.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p5: Notwithstanding the DRG Payment Rate set forth in the Inpatient Payment Category Table above for a covered Inpatient Stay, when Provider submits a claim for payment of a drug listed on the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule, then Provider will be paid the Per Diem listed in the Inpatient Payment Category Table above for the Ultra High Cost Therapy Admission and the applicable Payment Rate for the drug set forth on the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule instead of the applicable DRG Payment Rate.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p4: The Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule will be updated in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p3: Drug codes submitted for consideration, but not shown on the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule are included in the Inpatient Payment and are not eligible for additional payment.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p2: Drugs shown on the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule and associated with Not Otherwise Classified (“NOC”) or Unlisted/Miscellaneous/Non-Specific HCPCS Codes or with no established fee shown will be manually priced in accordance with BCBST’s policy for Unlisted, Miscellaneous, Non-Specific and Not Otherwise Classified Procedures/Services, but may not be eligible for payment. Such drugs must be billed with a unit of one (1) and require submission of: (i) drug name; (ii) National Drug Code (“NDC”) in field 43 “Revenue Description/ IDE/ Medicaid Drug Rebate” on the CMS-1450 claim form; and (iii) dosage administered. Failure to submit this information will result in delayed reimbursement.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Ultra_High_Cost_Therapy_Schedule_p1: Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule. BCBST will pay for inpatient drugs listed in the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule, in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for the Ultra High Cost Fee Schedule contained in the Provider Manual. Eligible drugs will be reimbursed in addition to the Ultra High Cost Therapy Admission filed on the CMS-1450 (UB-04 or successor) claim form.

MasterClauseData.HITMA_Home_Infusion_Therapy_Section_3.1_: Notwithstanding the foregoing, when multiple Covered Services reimbursable at a per diem under this Attachment are provided on the same day, the primary therapy will be reimbursed at <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Primary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Primary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the per diem rate, the secondary therapy will be reimbursed at <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Secondary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Secondary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>50%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the per diem rate, and all subsequent therapies will be reimbursed at <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Subsequent_Therapies_Percent_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Subsequent_Therapies_Percent_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>25%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the per diem rate. MasterClauseData.ACR_Exclusions_Section_4.2_p1: Exclusions. The following are specifically excluded from payment under this Attachment:
DME that is classified by CMS as a capped rental will be considered purchased after the equipment has been rented for a period of 10 months. If the Member changes to different but similar piece of equipment or DME (e.g. from a non-heated humidifier to a heated humidifier) when the equipment is medically needed (i.e. the Member's medical needs have substantially changed and the new equipment is necessary), a new 10-month rental period begins with the new equipment or DME. Otherwise, BCBST will reimburse the least expensive piece of equipment or DME (continuing to count against the current 10-month period). If the 10-month rental period has already expired, then no additional rental payments will be made.

MasterClauseData.IRL_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p1: Rate Updates. Rates under the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule are equivalent to amounts that would have been payable under Original Medicare to Provider for the same services; provided however, that BCBST updates the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule in the timeframes described in the Provider Manual. No retroactive adjustment will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS's release of a rate and BCBST's implementation of such rate in accordance with the Provider Manual or due to CMS's retroactive implementation of an amended rate.

MasterClauseData.ACA_Chargemaster_Protection_Section_2.5: Chargemaster Protection. For those services paid at a POC, BCBST acknowledges that Provider may increase the charge values within its Chargemaster. Provider must provide BCBST with written notice of any changes to its Chargemaster sixty (60) days prior to the effective date of such change(s). BCBST may, as appropriate, make adjustments to POC Payments to ensure the overall payment remains equivalent to the payments prior to the increase. BCBST will provide written notification to Provider of the adjustment to the rates paid at POC, and such adjustment will take effect in accordance with the written notification without a formal amendment to the Attachment. Without limiting any other audit rights of BCBST, BCBST has the right to audit Provider’s records to assure compliance with this provision.

Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Diem payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member during each day of an Inpatient Stay including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, nursing care, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.HHPDN_Medical_Supplies_Section_3.2: Medical Supplies. BCBST will reimburse Provider for supplies when they are: 1) used in conjunction with services reimbursable under the above section; and 2) shown on the BCBST Home Health Agency Non-Routine Supply List located in the Provider Manual. Reimbursement for such supplies will be at <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HHPDN_Percent_of_Medicare_Region_C_DMEPOS_Fee_Schedule" Title="HHPDN_Percent_of_Medicare_Region_C_DMEPOS_Fee_Schedule" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>75%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Medicare Region C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee (“DMEPOS Schedule”). BCBST implements updates to the DMEPOS Schedule on April 1 of each year. Services provided between January 1 and March 31 will be reimbursed based on the previous year's DMEPOS Schedule.
MasterClauseData.HITMA_Home_Infusion_Therapy_Section_3.1_: Home Infusion Therapy.  Payment for home infusion therapy Covered Services will be reimbursable at a per diem of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Home_Infusion_Therapy_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Home_Infusion_Therapy_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>$57.59<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>. Maintenance or infusion catheter care will be reimbursable at a per diem of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Maintenance_or_infusion_catheter_care_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Maintenance_or_infusion_catheter_care_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>$6.47<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>. Billing guidelines for these services are published in the Provider Manual. This payment is all-inclusive, including, without limitation, all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services. Notwithstanding the foregoing, when multiple Covered Services reimbursable at a per diem under this Attachment are provided on the same day, the primary therapy will be reimbursed at 100% of the per diem rate, the secondary therapy will be reimbursed at 50% of the per diem rate, and all subsequent therapies will be reimbursed at 25% of the per diem rate. All second and subsequent home infusion therapy Covered Services must be from separate infusion classes as defined in the BCBST Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CAU_Chiropractic_Services_Section_3.1: Chiropractic Services. Payment for chiropractic Covered Services, excluding DME, during a single office visit is the Global Rate of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAU_Chiropractic_Services_Per_Visit" Title="CAU_Chiropractic_Services_Per_Visit" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>$150.00<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> per visit. Except for chiropractic Covered Services provided to FEP Members which will be paid in accordance with the attached FEP Chiropractic Rate Attachment. The Maximum Allowable for chiropractic Covered Services provided to FEP Members will be the lesser of Provider's billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate fee amount in the FEP Chiropractic Rate Attachment. All payment or fee amounts listed in the FEP Chiropractic Rate Attachment are subject to payment of lesser billed charges. "FEP Members" shall mean those individuals who receive Covered Services through the Federal Employee Health Benefit Plan. Except as otherwise provided herein, the Global Rate in this section shall be all-inclusive and shall, in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligations due by the applicable Member to the chiropractic Provider, compensate Provider in full for all services and supplies provided in association with Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_BCBST_Immediate_Termination_Section_: Cannot be paid via EFT in accordance with the “EFT” provision in this Agreement; or

MasterClauseData.IOBH_Per_Diem_Section_1.3: “Per Diem(s)” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to Member for each day of an Inpatient Stay. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Diem payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member during each day of an Inpatient Stay including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay, nursing care, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Home_Infusion_Therapy_Section_3.1: Notwithstanding the foregoing, when multiple services reimbursable at a per diem under this Attachment are provided on the same day, the primary therapy will be reimbursed at the lesser of billed charges or <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Primary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Primary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the per diem rate, the secondary therapy will be reimbursed at the lesser of billed charges or <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Secondary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Secondary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>50%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the per diem rate, and all subsequent therapies will be reimbursed at the lesser of billed charges or <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Subsequent_Therapies_Percent_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Subsequent_Therapies_Percent_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>25%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the per diem rate. All second and subsequent home infusion therapy Covered Services must be from separate infusion classes as defined in the Provider Manual.

MasterClauseData.ASU_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: Outpatient Surgery Procedures. Surgical Covered Services provided in an outpatient setting will use the Per Case Payment Methodology. Surgical procedures will be paid according to the Outpatient Surgery Group to which BCBST assigns the procedure contained in Attachment 2-A.
