Generally. Reimbursement for DME Covered Services as described in this Attachment constitutes full reimbursement for the item, including all labor charges involved in the assembly and support services, such as emergency services, delivery, set-up, education, and ongoing assistance with the item. Reimbursement for supplies used in conjunction with DME will be determined by the Medicare Region C DME Regional Carrier ("DMERC") guidelines.

MasterClauseData.BFS_Chiropractic_Payment_p2: BCBST shall only pay for chiropractic Covered Services when billed with the appropriate CPT codes as listed herein or described in the Provider Manual. All chiropractic Covered Services furnished by a licensed chiropractor, as defined in Tennessee Code Annotated Section 63-4-101, (“Chiropractor”) shall be paid as follows: chiropractic Covered Services billed with CPT code range 99202-99205, excluding DME, during a single office visit will be paid at a Global Rate of $150 per visit. Payment for chiropractic Covered Services, excluding DME, for procedure codes other than CPT code range 99202-99205, during a single office visit, will be paid at a Global Rate of $60 per visit.  Except when otherwise provided herein, the global rate in this section shall be all-inclusive and shall, in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligation(s) due by the applicable Member to the Provider, compensate Provider in full for all services and supplies provided in association with Covered Services provided by a Chiropractor.  All durable medical equipment (“DME”) Covered Services, furnished by Chiropractor, shall be paid at 75% of the current Medicare Region C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee.  The rates for the DME Covered Services shall be in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligation(s) due by the applicable Member to the Provider.

MasterClauseData.ACR_Against_Medical_Advice_Discharges_Se: Against Medical Advice Discharges. Inpatient Stays during which the Member left the Provider against medical advice will be reimbursable as referenced in the Inpatient Stay Payment Category Table or an Outlier payment, whichever is applicable.
MasterClauseData.ASU_Covered_Services_for_Outpatient_Sect: Covered Services for Outpatient. Outpatient Covered Services must be filed with the appropriate Revenue Code and/or CPT®/HCPCS on the institutional claim in order to be considered for payment.
MasterClauseData.DME_Fee_Source_Section_2.4_p2: For CPT® Codes and HCPCS Codes without a published fee or methodology, reimbursement will be based on a reasonable allowable determined by BCBST, as described in the Provider Manual. Newly published CPT® Codes and HCPCS Codes will be added to the DMEPOS Schedule with the effective date of the applicable CPT® Code or HCPCS Code. If CMS establishes multiple payment amounts for a new code, the highest CMS rate will be added and locked based on the contract percentage and the first published Medicare fee. If CMS establishes a single payment amount for a new code, the new code will be added with the rate locked at 100% of the first published Medicare fee.
MasterClauseData.CPA_BCBST_Immediate_Termination_Section_: Through any other behavior or circumstance, demonstrates deficiencies in competence or dedication to providing a level of care that meets prevailing recognized community standards of practice, standards established under law, or standards established by BCBST; or
MasterClauseData.CAC_Outpatient_Surgery_Group_Section_1.6: “Outpatient Surgery Group” means the group to which an outpatient surgical procedure code is assigned based on expected use of resources. This does not include any outpatient surgical procedures specifically carved out in this Attachment.
MasterClauseData.ACA_HCPCS_Code_Section_1.9: “HCPCS Code” means Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System based on the AMA's Current Procedural Terminology (“CPT®”) and updated by CMS.
MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use of Codes. The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.CAU_Rate_Sources_Updates_Section_2.4_p2: The rates for chiropractic DME Covered Services described in this Attachment are based on the current Medicare Region C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee (“DMEPOS Fee Schedule”).
MasterClauseData.DIA_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2ma_p: Billing Requirements. All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a CMS 1450 form or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Inpatient_Respite_Care_Section_1.3: “Inpatient Respite Care” means short-term care provided in an inpatient setting to a Member receiving hospice services so that the Member's family or other persons caring for the Member can rest or take time off.  Inpatient Respite Care is limited to five (5) consecutive days per episode.
MasterClauseData.ACAM_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.HHPDN_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Expired_Patients_Section_3.2_c: Expired Patients. An Inpatient Stay during which the Member expires will be treated as a normal discharge and reimbursable as referenced in the Inpatient Stay Payment Category Table or an Outlier payment, whichever is applicable.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_BMAT_Services_Section_3.1_p2: The payments set out in the chart above are all inclusive, including without limitation, all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.HHPDNMA_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use of Codes. The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. MasterClauseData.FRWAA_Reimbursement_Fixed_Section_3.1_p1: Air Ambulance Fixed Wing Services. Payment for air ambulance fixed wing Covered Services is:
MasterClauseData.BFS_Chiropractic_Payment_p1: BCBST shall only pay for chiropractic Covered Services when billed with the appropriate CPT codes as listed herein or described in the Provider Manual. Except for chiropractic Covered Services provided to FEP Members which will be paid in accordance with the pricing as set forth in the Network P FEP Chiropractic Network Attachment, all chiropractic Covered Services for non-FEP Members furnished by a licensed chiropractor, as defined in Tennessee Code Annotated Section 63-4-101, (“Chiropractor”) shall be paid as follows: chiropractic Covered Services billed with CPT code range 99202-99205, excluding DME,  during a single office visit will be paid at a Global Rate of $150 per visit. Payment for chiropractic Covered Services, excluding DME, for procedure codes other than CPT code range 99202-99205, during a single office visit, will be paid at a Global Rate of $60 per visit.  Except when otherwise provided herein, the global rate in this section shall be all-inclusive and shall, in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligation(s) due by the applicable Member to the Provider, compensate Provider in full for all services and supplies provided in association with Covered Services provided by a Chiropractor.  All durable medical equipment (“DME”) Covered Services, furnished by Chiropractor, shall be paid at 75% of the current Medicare Region C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee.  The rates for the DME Covered Services shall be in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligation(s) due by the applicable Member to the Provider.
MasterClauseData.DME_Fee_Source_Section_2.4_p1: Fee source. Fee amounts set forth in this Attachment are based on the Medicare Region C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee (the "DMEPOS Schedule"). BCBST implements updates to the DMEPOS Schedule on April 1 of each year. Services provided between January 1 and March 31 will be reimbursed based on the previous year’s DMEPOS Schedule.
MasterClauseData.CPA_BCBST_Immediate_Termination_Section_: Receives a judgment in malpractice actions or settlement of malpractice claims (whether or not such claims related to care of Members) of sufficient number or seriousness to suggest deficiencies in patient care and causes Provider to no longer meet BCBST's Network Participation Criteria; or
MasterClauseData.CAC_Implants_Section_1.5: “Implant(s)” means a Surgical Implant or a Surgical Appliance.
MasterClauseData.HITMA_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual. Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services. Reimbursement under this Attachment is limited to the services listed herein. Provider will only be reimbursed for days on which medications (drugs), total parenteral nutrition solutions, hydration solutions or infusion catheter care services are actually administered. Provider agrees that the billing of qualified drugs shall be limited to those administered for intravenous infusion. Drugs classified as oral or self-administered are excluded and will be denied under the terms of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.ASU_Audit_Section_2.5: Audit. BCBST may recover from Provider any amounts identified during an audit, pursuant to BCBSTs standard audit policy.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Ambulance_Services_Section_3.2_b: Ambulance Services. Appropriate hospital-based ambulance services provided prior to an Inpatient Stay will be paid in addition to the applicable Payment Rate set forth in the Inpatient Payment Category Table and should be billed by the Provider as an outpatient service. Ambulance charges incurred while the patient is an inpatient are included in the applicable Payment Rate regardless of whether the ambulance provider is owned/operated by Provider or an Affiliate or an independent ambulance contractor. In instances where the ambulance provider is an independent ambulance contractor, ambulance services will be considered Covered Services furnished under arrangement.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_BMAT_Services_Section_3.1_p1: Buprenorphine Medication Assisted Treatment Services. Payment for BMAT Covered Services is:
Reimbursement under this Attachment is limited to the services listed herein. Provider will only be reimbursed for days on which medications (drugs), total parenteral nutrition solutions, hydration solutions or infusion catheter care services are actually administered. Provider agrees that the billing of qualified drugs shall be limited to those administered for intravenous infusion. Drugs classified as oral or self-administered are excluded and will be denied under the terms of this Agreement.

MasterClauseData.HOS_General_Inpatient_Care_Section_1.2: “General Inpatient Care” means short-term inpatient hospice care for pain control or management of acute and severe clinical problems which cannot be managed in other settings.

MasterClauseData.HOS_Continuous_Home_Care_Section_1.1: “Continuous Home Care” means hospice care provided for a brief period of crisis to a Member who is not in an inpatient facility and who receives hospice care consisting predominantly of nursing care on a continuous basis. Care must include eight (8) hours of nursing care in a twenty-four (24) hour period to be considered Continuous Home Care

MasterClauseData.ACR_Chargemaster_Protection_Section_2.5: Chargemaster Protection. For those services paid at a POC, BCBST acknowledges that Provider may increase the charge values within its Chargemaster. MasterClauseData.HHPDN_Per_Visit_Section_1.4: “Per Visit” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member on a 1 calendar day period, for each type of service for which a Per Visit payment is indicated in this Attachment. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Visit payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and institution and ancillary services. Provider is required to identify each date of service when submitting claims that span multiple dates of service.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Material_Breach_Section_11.3: Material Breach.  This Agreement or participation in a specific Network may be terminated by either Party by giving <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_MaterialBreachTerminationNotice" Title="CPA_MaterialBreachTerminationNotice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 days'<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> prior Notice to the other Party if the Party to whom notice is given is in material breach of any provisions of this Agreement. The Party claiming the right to terminate will set forth in the notice, the facts underlying the claim that the other is in breach of this Agreement. Remedy of the breach to the satisfaction of the Party giving notice, within 30 days of notice, will nullify the intended termination notice. However, if BCBST becomes aware, in its reasonable judgment, of a pattern of activity or practice of Provider that constitutes multiple material breaches under this Agreement, BCBST may terminate this Agreement and Provider's participation in all Networks pursuant to this Agreement immediately by providing Provider with written notice of such termination.

MasterClauseData.BFS_Calculation_of_Established_Fee_p1: For those procedure codes that fall into bands with a fee source of 2021 CMS RBRVS, the established fee will be calculated based on the Relative Value Units (RVUs), conversion factors and Geographic Practice Cost Indices (GPCIs) in effect as of October 31, 2021.  No updates will be made to these fee components, except: (1) any new procedure code added after October 31, 2021 will be added as noted above; or (2) in the event that the AMA modifies the code description, the underlying use of the code or the components that make up the code, BCBST will treat the code as a new code in order to remain consistent with recognized coding guidelines.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Termination_or_Exclusion_of_Associat: Termination or Exclusion of Associated Provider. In the event that BCBST excludes an Associated Provider from participation under this Agreement for cause or terminates a direct contract between BCBST and an Associated Provider for cause, such Associated Provider will no longer be permitted to participate under this Agreement. Provider will be responsible for notifying Members who present to Provider for treatment that the affected Associated Provider is not participating with BCBST. Provider will submit any claims for such Associated Provider with the Associated Provider's NPI number. If BCBST determines that Provider has been submitting claims for services rendered by the terminated or excluded Associated Provider in such a way that it appears such services were rendered by a Network Provider, BCBST may terminate this Agreement for cause.

MasterClauseData.BCE_The_PPV_Reversible_LAC_fee_schedule_: The Post-Partum Voluntary Reversible Long-Acting Contraceptives fee schedule (“VRLAC Fee Schedule”) is available to State of Tennessee Health Plan (“SEHP”) participants.  Provider will be reimbursed at 100% of the VRLAC Fee Schedule for Covered Services provided to SEHP participants in addition to the Inpatient Stay Payment Rate.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Percent_of_Charge_Payments_Section_1: “Percent of Charge Payment(s)” (“POC”) means the percentage applied to the Provider's detail line item covered charge to determine the payment rates for those services for which the payment rate is calculated as a percentage of covered charges.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_ElectronicMedicalRecordAccess_b: Professional Provider will provide access to Professional Provider’s Medical Records by providing BCBST electronic medical records (“EMR”) access and electronic file transfer.  Medical Records provided by EMR access will be available to BCBST on a 24 hour/7 day a week basis.  Medical Records provided by electronic file transfer will be available to BCBST within 24 hours of BCBST’s request for those Medical Records or a shorter time as may be required for urgent requests for Medical Records.  Urgent requests are those requests for Professional Provider’s Medical Records to address allegations of fraud or abuse, matters related to the health and safety of a Member, or related to an expedited appeal or grievance.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_ElectronicMedicalRecordAccess_a: Professional Provider will provide BCBST or its designees access to Professional Provider’s Medical Records for purposes of BCBST’s health care operations and other administrative obligations, including without limitation, utilization management, quality assurance and improvement, claims payment, and review or audit of Professional Provider’s compliance with the provisions of this Addendum and appropriate billing practices.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Term_Termination_Section_5_a: Unless otherwise terminated as provided for in subsection b. below, the term for this Addendum will begin in the first quarter of 2025, and shall continue through the end of 2026.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Term_Termination_Section_5_b: Notwithstanding any provision in the Agreement to the contrary, either party may sever this Addendum from the Agreement by providing not less than sixty (60) days’ advance written notice of its intent to do so; provided, however, that no such termination will be effective prior to December 31st of the then current calendar year.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, this Addendum may be terminated in the event that the parties enter into a new agreement for Professional Provider’s participation in BCBST’s Medicare Advantage networks, at which time this Addendum will be replaced with an addendum to such new agreement that reflects the same terms as are contained herein.  Termination of this Addendum as provided for above does not terminate the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures: Quality Measures.   Payment of the Care Management Fee is contingent on Professional Provider’s performance on the Quality Measures included in this section.  A sample calculation, including 2025 HEDIS Thresholds, is included as Exhibit 2 for illustrative purposes only.
MasterClauseData.DME_CPT_Code_Section_1.2: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Eligibility_Requirements_Section_4.7: Eligibility Requirements.  Provider acknowledges and agrees that each of its Associated Providers who is subject to credentialing requirements (i.e., physicians, physician assistants and nurse practitioners) must be credentialed to provide services as a BCBST provider at all times throughout the Term of this Agreement, and must maintain all credentialing requirements in accordance with the applicable Provider Manual. Provider shall routinely monitor said Associated Providers to ensure adherence to applicable Provider and Provider Manual rules.
MasterClauseData.UCAP_Urgent_Care_Services_Section_3.1p2: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies, used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.UCAP_Urgent_Care_Services_Section_3.1: Urgent Care Services. Payment for Urgent Care Covered Services is set out below:
MasterClauseData.UCAP_Presence_of_a_Fee_Section_2.5: Presence of a Fee. Presence of a fee is not a guarantee the service will be eligible for reimbursement.  Final reimbursement determinations include, but are not limited to, Member eligibility on the date of service, Medical Necessity, Medical Appropriateness, applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, benefit plan exclusions/limitations, authorization/referral requirement, and applicable medical policies and guidelines.
MasterClauseData.UCAP_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use of Codes. The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.

MasterClauseData.CAU_Global_Rate_Section_1.4: “Global Rate” means the per-visit rate paid for chiropractic Covered Services. The Global Rate does not include DME Covered Services provided by Provider.
MasterClauseData.UCAP_Urgent_Care_Section_1.3: “Urgent Care” means Medically Necessary services and supplies delivered in an ambulatory setting and used to diagnose and treat acute symptoms that are non-life threatening but should be treated promptly.
MasterClauseData.UCAP_CPT_Code_Section_1.2: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.UCAP_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_TermAndTermination_b: Notwithstanding any provision in the Agreement to the contrary, either party may sever this Addendum from the Agreement by providing not less than sixty (60) days’ advance written notice of its intent to do so; provided, however, that no such termination will be effective prior to December 31st of the then current calendar year.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, this Addendum may be terminated in the event that the parties enter into a new agreement for Professional Provider’s participation in BCBST’s Medicare Advantage networks, at which time this Addendum will be replaced with an addendum to such new agreement that reflects the same terms as are contained herein.  Termination of this Addendum as provided for above does not terminate the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_TermAndTermination_a: Unless otherwise terminated as provided for in subsection b. below, the term for this Addendum will begin in the first quarter of 2025, and shall continue through the end of 2026.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_PhysicianIncentivePlans: Physician Incentive Plans.  The parties agree that the provisions in this Addendum and/or any payment of Care Management Fees hereunder are not intended to: (a) be in exchange for referrals of federal health care business; (b) influence Covered Members or eligible individuals to do business with any party; or (c) reduce or limit Medically Necessary services to Covered Members.  Notwithstanding any provision in this Addendum or the Agreement to the contrary, Care Management Fee payments from BCBST to Professional Provider, and any downstream payments from Professional Provider to individual primary care practitioners employed and/or contracted with Professional Provider and who are participating under this Addendum, will be limited so as not to exceed the threshold for the transfer of ‘substantial financial risk’ as defined in 42 C.F.R. §422.208(a).
MasterClauseData.MACMA_ProviderAssessmentForms: Provider Assessment Forms.  BCBST will pay Professional Provider a one-time per Member per calendar year fee of $225 for each Covered Member for whom Professional Provider completes and submits BCBST’s PAF.  In order to receive payment for submission of the PAF, the Professional Provider must also submit a claim with CPT Code 96161.  BCBST may discontinue or change its use of and payment for PAF in subsequent years, with written notice of such discontinuation or change from BCBST to Professional Provider, publication in the Provider Manual, and/or publication in a BCBST BlueAlert.
MasterClauseData.DIA_HCPCS_Code_Section_1.3: “HCPCS Code” means Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System based on the AMA’s Current Procedural Terminology (“CPT®”) and updated by CMS.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_AdditionalDiagnoses: Additional Diagnoses.  Professional Provider should utilize CPT Code 99499 to submit claim forms that include only additional diagnosis codes for Covered Members as determined by the Professional Provider beyond the twelve (12) diagnoses currently allowed on a single claim per the United States Department of Health and Human Services Regulations. The parties understand that no payment is expected or due following submission of these additional diagnoses only claims by Professional Provider.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_Timing: Timing.  Payment of the earned Care Management Fees will be made 120 days after the close of each quarter based upon Professional Provider’s projected performance as determined by BCBST.  Within one hundred and twenty (120) days after the close of the  Performance Period, BCBST shall reconcile the quarterly Care Management Fees paid to Professional Provider against the actual Care Management Fees earned by Professional Provider in such Performance Period .  If the quarterly Care Management Fees paid to Professional Provider are less than the actual Care Management Fees earned by Professional Provider, BCBST will pay Professional Provider the difference within one hundred and twenty (120) days after the close of the Performance Period.  If the quarterly Care Management Fees paid to Professional Provider are greater than the actual Care Management Fees earned by Professional Provider, BCBST will recoup the difference through a reduction from any future payment(s) made by BCBST under this Agreement.  In order for Professional Provider to receive credit for performance on a Quality Measure, the claim and any required supporting data must be received by BCBST no later than sixty (60) days following the close of the calendar quarter in which the claim was incurred.  Claims and data received more than sixty (60) days after the end of the quarter in which the claim was incurred will be credited towards Professional Provider’s performance for the next quarter, so long as the claim is filed timely.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, Professional Provider will not receive credit for any claim or data not received by BCBST on or before March 1st of the calendar year following the calendar year in which it was incurred.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_d_i: HCC Evaluation. Professional Provider may earn up to twenty-five percent (25%) of the Care Management Fee for HCC evaluation based upon the percentage of completion rate of attributed Covered Members per Performance Period as set out in the chart below. This identification occurs at the member level and represent HCCs reported by all sources during the previous 4 years.  Providers are required to evaluate HCCs during a face-to-face office visit and make a determination on the presence of the condition.  If the medical condition persists: (A) the medical record corresponding with that office visit should contain the appropriate diagnosis along with other pertinent information such as signs, symptoms, assessment and treatment plan; and (B) the provider’s claim for that office visit should contain the appropriate ICD10 code corresponding to the diagnosis and pertinent information in the medical record.  Additionally, the affirmation or refutation of the condition should be appropriately marked on the Diagnosis Recapture Report and submitted to BCBST along with the medical record or PAF.  Confirming or denying the existence of a condition count equally toward its resolution.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_c: The parties: (A) recognize that the Member Experience Measure Components are based on CMS’s Five-Star Quality Program; (B) agree that BCBST may supplement the data that CMS uses for its Five-Star Quality Program with data from other sources; (C) recognize that the Member Experience Measure Components are based on measures developed by third parties; (D) agree that BCBST may adopt such changes to the Member Experience Measure Components as are adopted by such third parties; and/or (E) in instances where a given measure that makes up a Member Experience Measure Component is discontinued, BCBST will select a different measure.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_b_iii_B: The Member Experience Components for the Member Experience HOS measure are: Improving Bladder Control; and Reducing the Risk of Falling.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_b_iii_A: The Member Experience Components for the Member Experience CAHPS measure are: Getting Appointments and Care Quickly; and Care Coordination.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_b_ii_B: If Professional Provider achieves a Quality Rating of 4.0 or greater, Professional Provider will receive the full 16% of the Care Management Fee available for Member Experience Measures.  In the event that Professional Provider meets this goal for a given calendar year, BCBST will retroactively pay Professional Provider the difference between 16% of the Care Management Fee and the Member Experience Measure-based portion of the Care Management Fee paid for Professional Provider’s performance during such calendar year.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_b_ii_A: Professional Provider will earn eight percent (8%) of the Care Management Fee for each of the double weighted Member Experience Measures in Exhibit 1 for which Professional Provider’s Member Experience Measurement Overall Rating meets or exceeds 4.0; OR
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_b_ii: Education.  Professional Provider may earn Care Management Fees for completing education and training based upon the percentage of Professional Provider’s primary care providers that participate in a one-on-one training session with a member of the BCBST coding and documentation staff per Performance Period as set out in the chart below.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_b_i: HCC Evaluation. Professional Provider may earn Care Management Fee for HCC evaluation based upon the percentage of completion rate of attributed Covered Members per Performance Period as set out in the chart below. This identification occurs at the member level and represent HCCs reported by all sources during the previous 2 years.   Providers are required to evaluate HCCs during a face-to-face office visit and make a determination on the presence of the condition.   If the medical condition persists: (A) the medical record corresponding with that office visit should contain the appropriate diagnosis along with other pertinent information such as signs, symptoms, assessment and treatment plan; and (B) the provider’s claim for that office visit should contain the appropriate ICD10 code corresponding to the diagnosis and pertinent information in the medical record.  Confirming or denying the existence of a condition count equally toward its resolution.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_a_iv: The parties: (A) recognize that HEDIS measures and HEDIS Ratings are created and maintained by third parties; (B) agree that BCBST may adopt such changes to HEDIS measures as are adopted by CMS and NCQA; and/or (C) in instances where a given HEDIS measure is discontinued, BCBST will select a different HEDIS measure.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_a_iii: Notwithstanding the foregoing, in order to receive any portion of the Care Management Fee based on Professional Provider’s performance on HEDIS measures, Professional Provider must meet or exceed the HEDIS Threshold on at least two (2) of the six (6) continuous HEDIS measures identified in Exhibit 1.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_a_ii_B: If Professional Provider achieves a Quality Rating of 4.0 or greater, Professional Provider will receive the full 59% of the Care Management Fee available for HEDIS measures.  In the event that Professional Provider meets this goal for a given calendar year, BCBST will retroactively pay Professional Provider the difference between 59% of the Care Management Fee and the HEDIS-based portion of the Care Management Fee paid for Professional Provider’s performance during such calendar year.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_a_ii_A: Professional Provider may earn two and thirty-six hundredths percent (2.36%) of the Care Management Fee for each of the identified non-continuous HEDIS single weighted measures, two and thirty-six hundredths percent (2.36%) of the Care Management Fee for each of the identified continuous HEDIS single weighted measures, and seven and eight hundredths percent (7.08%) of the Care Management Fee for each of the identified continuous HEDIS triple weighted measures in Exhibit 1 for which Professional Provider’s performance meets or exceeds the HEDIS Threshold with payments as provided for in this Section 3; OR
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_a_ii: Professional Provider’s performance on these HEDIS measures will be evaluated based on information submitted to BCBST.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_a_i: Professional Provider’s performance on these HEDIS measures will be evaluated based on information submitted to BCBST.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasures_a: Aggregate Quality Ratings.  Professional Provider may earn the Care Management Fees set forth in the chart below based on Professional Provider’s aggregate performance on the HEDIS measures listed in Exhibit 1.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Definitions_Section_1: The following terms are defined for the purpose of this Attachment. All other capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Receiving_Hospital_Section_1.12: “Receiving Hospital” means the hospital that receives a Member from a Transferring Hospital.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CareManagementFee_b_iv: The parties may reevaluate the amount of the Care Management Fee for subsequent years.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CareManagementFee_b_iii: Calculation of the Care Management Fee is based upon the performance of individual physicians, advance practice nurses and physician assistants that are employed by or contracted with Professional Provider and who are contracted and credentialed with BCBST as primary care providers in the prior calendar quarter and in accordance with the timing set out in paragraph #4 (Timing); and
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CareManagementFee_b_ii: The Care Management Fee: (A) may vary each calendar year for which this Addendum is in effect based upon Professional Provider’s Quality Rating for the Performance Period for which the Quality Rate is applied; and (B) will be as set out in the chart below;
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CareManagementFee_b_i: As a condition of eligibility to earn Care Management Fees under this Addendum, Professional Provider understands and agrees that Professional Provider should have a record return rate of ninety percent (90%) for all records requested for HEDIS and risk adjustment purposes;
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CareManagementFee_a: BCBST and Professional Provider have agreed to create a care management pool through which Professional Provider is eligible to earn Care Management Fees (as defined below) based upon Professional Provider meeting the threshold performance requirements on Quality Measures set forth in paragraph #3 (Quality Measures) below.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityRating: “Quality Rating” means the overall rating, based on a five-point scale, assigned by BCBST to Professional Provider on an annual basis, based on Professional Provider’s performance on Performance Measures in the BCBST MA Network(s) covered under the Agreement in the aggregate and relative to the performance targets set by CMS for the same Performance Measures.  Quality Ratings are calculated based on claims and data submitted for the previous calendar year through February 1st of the calendar year for which the Quality Rating is applied.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_QualityMeasure: “Quality Measure” means the quality of care measurements that Professional Provider must perform in order to be eligible for payment of the Care Management Fee. Quality Measures are divided into three categories: HEDIS measures, Member Experience Measures, and Effectiveness Measures.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1ma_p: Payments made by BCBST will be net of Member Obligations required from the Member, if any, according to the Member's BlueAdvantage benefits.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_PerformancePeriod: “Performance Period” means the calendar year period from January 1st to December 31st.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Total_Potential_Payment_Section_4_: Total Potential Payment.  Notwithstanding any provision in this Addendum, the Agreement, or the Program to the contrary, Shared Savings payments from BCBST to Professional Provider, and any downstream payments from Professional Provider to individual primary care practitioners employed and/or contracted with Professional Provider and who are participating in this Program, will be limited so as not to exceed the threshold for the transfer of ‘substantial financial risk’ as defined in 42 C.F.R. §422.208(a).
MasterClauseData.MACMA_PerformanceMeasures: “Performance Measures” means, for any given Performance Period, those quality and performance measures that are measurable at the individual primary care practitioner level and reasonably determined by BCBST to be applicable to Professional Provider.  Individual practitioners may include physicians, advance practice nurses and physician assistants that are employed by or contracted with Professional Provider and contracted and credentialed with BCBST as primary care providers. These measures are identified by CMS as the basis for CMS’s Five-Star Quality Rating Program for Medicare Advantage plans for that year. BCBST may measure performance on a Performance Measure using data used by CMS in the Five-Star Quality Rating Program, as well as additional data. The list of Performance Measures is set out in Exhibit 1, which is attached and incorporated into this Addendum; however, this list is subject to change upon written notice from BCBST, including but not limited to through amendment to this Addendum, publication in the Provider Manual, and/or publication in a BCBST BlueAlert.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_MemberExperienceComponentRating: “Member Experience Component Rating” means, for any Member Experience Component, the rating that would correspond to the Professional Provider’s rating under Five-Star Quality Program for Medicare Advantage Plans, except that such rating can be based on data from sources not used by CMS.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Physician_Incentive_Plans_Section_: Physician Incentive Plans.  The parties agree that neither the Program nor the provisions in this Addendum are an inducement for Professional Provider or the individual primary care practitioners employed by and/or contracted with Professional Provider to reduce or limit Medically Necessary services to Members.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_MemberExperienceComponent: “Member Experience Component” means any of the individual member experience measures that are part of a Member Experience Measure listed on Exhibit 1.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Calculations_Section_3_c: Example. The following table shows a sample Shared Savings calculation for illustration purposes only:
MasterClauseData.MACMA_MemberExperienceMeasures: “Member Experience Measures” mean the member experience measures made up of certain Member Experience Components.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_MemberExperienceMeasurementOverall: “Member Experience Measurement Overall Rating” means, for any Member Experience Measure, the average of all relevant Member Experience Measure Component Ratings.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Calculations_Section_3_b_iii: Notwithstanding any provision in this Addendum to the contrary, if Professional Provider terminates the Agreement and/or the MA PPO Network Attachment(s) to the Agreement prior to the end of a Performance Period, with or without cause, no Shared Savings will be paid or due to Professional Provider or any individual primary care practitioner.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_HEIDISThreshold: “HEDIS Threshold” means, for any HEDIS measure, the minimum score that would correspond to a HEDIS Rating of 4.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Calculations_Section_3_b_ii: BCBST will issue the Final Calculation and make any associated payment to Professional Provider not later than two hundred and seventy (270) days following the close of the Performance Period.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_HEIDISRating: “HEDIS Rating” means the rating that would be assigned to Professional Provider’s performance on an individual HEDIS measure under the Five-Star Quality Program for Medicare Advantage Plans administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_HEIDIS: “HEDIS®” means the Healthcare Effectiveness Data and Information Set developed and maintained by the National Committee for Quality Assurance (“NCQA”). HEDIS® is a registered trademark of NCQA. See www.ncqa.org.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Calculations_Section_3_b_i: The parties agree that the calculations described herein will be made for each Performance Period. Claims incurred during the Performance Period and paid within one hundred and eighty (180) days after the close of the Performance Period will be included in the Final Calculation for that Performance Period.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_EffectivenessMeasures: “Effectiveness Measures” means those Professional Provider operational activities including record keeping, assessment forms and the compliance with HEDIS (as defined below) and risk adjustment record requests.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_Definitions_Section_1: Definitions.  The following terms are defined for purposes of this Addendum.  All other capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CPTCode: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CoveredMembers_iv: Members who have no medical or pharmacy claims in the previous two (2) year period but who have indicated to a BCBST vendor that Professional Provider is the Member’s primary care practice.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CoveredMembers_iii: Members who have had no medical claims in the previous two (2) year period but have had pharmacy claims for which Professional Provider was the prescribing provider.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CoveredMembers_ii: Members for whom Professional Provider has submitted more medical claims than any other primary care provider over the previous two (2) year period. In the event that Professional Provider and another primary care provider have submitted an equal number of claims for a Member, which is more than any other primary care provider, BCBST will attribute the Member to Professional Provider in instances where Professional Provider has submitted the most recent claim.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Calculations_Section_3_a: Generally. The potential Shared Savings payable to Professional Provider will be calculated in the following manner:
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CoveredMembers_i: Members who have indicated to BCBST that Professional Provider is their primary care practice.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CoveredMembers: “Covered Members”  means for purposes of this Addendum, those BCBST Members who are eligible for and enrolled in a BCBST MA PPO plan covered under the Agreement during the applicable performance calendar year, and who are attributed to Professional Provider under one of the following criteria, which are applied in the order listed below.  Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary below, a BCBST Member may only be attributed to one Network Provider at a time and in no event may an individual primary care practitioner participate in more than one (1) care management incentive arrangement with BCBST. Any care management incentive arrangements applicable to a BlueCare Plus D-SNP HMO are exempted from this limitation of one care management incentive arrangement with BCBST.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable. The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACR_Maximum_Allowable" Title="ACR_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Quality_Threshold_Section_2: Quality Threshold. Notwithstanding any provision in this Addendum or the Agreement to the contrary, Professional Provider will receive no Shared Savings for any Performance Period in which Professional Provider did not meet a Quality Rating of at least 4.0.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CMS: CMS”  means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Target_MLR_Section_1_q: “Target MLR” means the MLR below which Professional Provider will be eligible to receive payment of the Shared Savings. The Target MLR for the Program is [____] percent ([XX]%) for 2025 and [____] percent ([XX]%) for 2026.
MasterClauseData.MACMA_CareManagementFee: “Care Management Fee”  means a per member per month (“PMPM”) fee paid to Professional Provider as described herein for the provision of care management and care coordination activities, as evidenced by performance of Quality Measures (as defined below).
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Shared_Savings_Section_1_p: “Shared Savings” means, subject to the provisions of this Addendum and the CMS regulations regarding physician incentive plans, [____] percent ([XX]%) of Savings, to be paid to Provider.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Savings_Section_1_o: “Savings” means the MLR Savings multiplied by MA Premiums.  Savings must be greater than $0 in order for Professional Provider to receive a Shared Savings payment.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Quality_Rating_Section_1_n: “Quality Rating” means the rating, based on a five-point scale, assigned by BCBST to Professional Provider on an annual basis, based on Professional Provider’s performance on Performance Measures in the BCBST MA Network(s) covered under the Agreement in the aggregate and relative to the performance targets set by CMS for the same Performance Measures. Quality Ratings are calculated based on claims and data submitted for the previous calendar year through February 1 of the year for which the Quality Rating is applied. New Quality Ratings are effective on April 1 of each year.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Performance_Period_Section_1_m: “Performance Period” means the calendar year period from January 1st to December 31st, except that: (i) for the initial Performance Period: (A) if the Addendum Effective Date is a date other than January 1st and is on or before June 30th, then the initial Performance Period shall be the Addendum Effective Date until December 31st of the same calendar year; and (B) if the Addendum Effective Date is a date after June 30th, then the initial Performance Period shall be the Addendum Effective Date until December 31st of the calendar year following the Addendum Effective Date; and (ii) for the final Performance Period, the Performance Period shall end on the effective date of termination of this Addendum.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Performance_Measures_Section_1_l: “Performance Measures” means, for any given Performance Period, those quality and performance measures that are measurable at the individual primary care practitioner level and reasonably determined by BCBST to be applicable to Professional Provider. Individual practitioners may include physicians, advance practice nurses and physician assistants that are employed by or contracted with Professional Provider and contracted and credentialed with BCBST as primary care providers.  These measures are identified by CMS as the basis for CMS’s Five-Star Quality Ratings Program for MA Plans for that year. BCBST may measure performance on a Performance Measure using data used by CMS in the Five-Star Quality Rating Program, as well as additional data. The list of Performance Measures are set out in Exhibit 1, which is attached and incorporated into this Addendum; however, this list is subject to change in subsequent calendar years upon written notice from BCBST through amendment to this Addendum, publication in the Provider Manual, and/or publication in a BCBST BlueAlert.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_MLR_Savings_Section_1_k: “MLR Savings” means the Target MLR minus the Actual MLR.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Birthing_Center_Transfer_Rate_Sectio: Revenue Code 762 <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BCE_Birthing_Center_Transfer_Rate_Revenue_Code_762_per_hour" Title="BCE_Birthing_Center_Transfer_Rate_Revenue_Code_762_per_hour" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #> - $50.00<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> per hour.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_MLR_Section_1_j: “Medical Loss Ratio” or “MLR” means MA Claims divided by MA Premiums.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_MA_Premiums_Section_1_i: “MA Premiums” means the premiums earned by BCBST from Covered Members: (i) including: (A) premiums paid by Covered Members; (B) Medicare Parts A & B payments including basic rebates and supplemental rebates paid by CMS; (C) Part D direct subsidy paid by CMS; (D) Low income subsidy premiums paid by CMS; (E) Risk adjustment payments or accruals; and (F) Part D risk corridor payments received from or payable to CMS; and (ii) excluding any health insurer tax fee(s).
MasterClauseData.MASSA_MA_Claims_Section_1_h: “MA Claims” means the total amount of in-network and out-of-network medical and pharmacy claims for Covered Members, including IBNR, adjusted for: (i) Part D LICS; (ii) Part D federal reinsurance; (iii) Part D coverage gap; (iv) pharmacy rebates; (v) any quality-based payments to Professional Provider; (vi) any other administrative, management, and/or other type of fee paid to Professional Provider; and (vii) any third party medical record chart retrieval costs.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_HEDIS_Section_1_e: “HEDIS®” means the Healthcare Effectiveness Data and Information Set developed and maintained by the National Committee for Quality Assurance (“NCQA”).  HEDIS® is a registered trademark of NCQA.  See www.ncqa.org.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Definitions_Section_1: Definitions.  The following terms are defined for purposes of this Addendum.  All other capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Final_Calculation_Section_1_d: “Final Calculation” means a calculation pursuant to this Addendum adjusted specifically for Covered Members in relation to risk adjustment, other premium retroactivity, claim run-out and Part D reconciliations.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Covered_Members_Section_1_c_iv: Members who have no medical or pharmacy claims in the previous two (2) year period but who have indicated to a BCBST vendor that Professional Provider is the Member’s primary care practice.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Covered_Members_Section_1_c_iii: Members who have had no medical claims in the previous two (2) year period but have had pharmacy claims for which Professional Provider was the prescribing provider.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Covered_Members_Section_1_c_ii: Members for whom Professional Provider has submitted more medical claims than any other primary care provider over the previous two (2) year period. In the event that Professional Provider and another primary care provider have submitted an equal number of claims for a Member, which is more than any other primary care provider, BCBST will attribute the Member to Professional Provider in instances where Professional Provider has submitted the most recent claim.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Covered_Members_Section_1_c_i: Members who have indicated to BCBST that Professional Provider is their primary care practice.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Covered_Members_Section_1_c: “Covered Members” means those BCBST Members who are eligible and enrolled in a BCBST MA PPO plan covered under the Agreement during the applicable performance calendar year, and who are attributed to Professional Provider under one of the following criteria, which are applied in the order listed below.  Member attribution shall be determined by BCBST based on Member information as of the first (1st) day of each month in the Performance Period.  Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary below, a BCBST Member may only be attributed to one Network Provider at a time and in no event may an individual primary care practitioner participate in more than one (1) MA shared savings arrangement with BCBST. Any gainsharing and/or shared savings arrangements applicable to a BlueCare Plus D-SNP HMO are exempted from this limitation of one shared savings arrangement with BCBST.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_CMS_Section_1_b: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Actual_MLR_Section_1_a: “Actual MLR” means the MLR achieved by Professional Provider for a given Performance Period.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Preamble_p3: This Addendum supersedes any prior MA PPO Shared Savings Addendum to the Agreement between the parties.  Should there be a conflict between the Agreement and this Addendum, this Addendum shall control as to the specific terms and conditions for the Program.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Preamble_p2: Notwithstanding any provision in this Addendum to the contrary, references in this Addendum to Professional Provider performance measurement, fees or payments earned, and/or payments based upon performance mean the aggregate performance of all physicians, advance practice nurses and physician assistants that are employed by or contracted with the physician group or physician organization identified as signatory to the Agreement and who are contracted and credentialed with BCBST as primary care providers.
MasterClauseData.MASSA_Preamble_p1: This Medicare Advantage Shared Savings Addendum (“Addendum”) is incorporated by reference into the provider participation agreement (“Agreement”) between BCBST and Professional Provider, and contains the parties’ agreement regarding the shared savings program (the “Program”) to be effective as of January 1, 2025 (“Addendum Effective Date”). This Addendum is confidential and proprietary information of BCBST, protected under Tennessee Code Annotated § 56-7-1013.  It is not to be duplicated, distributed, or revised without the written consent of BCBST.
MasterClauseData.QCPI_Use_of_Codes: The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual.  If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.QCPI_Technical_Component_for_Professiona: For all claims with dates of service on or after January 1, 2019, and notwithstanding any other language to the contrary, Commercial DRG and outpatient case rates paid to a facility (other than free-standing ambulatory surgery centers) are all-inclusive of any technical component for professional services provided while a Member is in a facility setting.  The facility shall bill for the technical component of the services, even if these services are provided under arrangements with or subcontracted out to or otherwise subject to or governed by a relationship with another entity, such as a laboratory, pathologist, or other provider.  Payment shall not be made to Provider under this Network Attachment or otherwise under this Agreement for technical component services furnished to Members in facility settings (other than free-standing ambulatory surgery centers).  All Providers who perform the technical component for professional services for Members must coordinate with the applicable facility (other than a free-standing ambulatory surgery center) regarding the payment of claims for such services.
MasterClauseData.QCPI_Reimbursement_Policy: The table above, in conjunction with BCBST’s reimbursement policies, as fully detailed in the Provider Manual, sets forth the basis for calculating the established fee for Covered Services provided to BCBST Members who receive benefits through <# <Content Select="//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Network_Name" Optional="true"/> #>. Any updates and/or changes to BCBST’s reimbursement policies will be communicated no later than sixty (60) days prior to implementation thereof via BCBST’s standard method of notice.
MasterClauseData.QCPI_Confidentiality: This Network Attachment is confidential and proprietary information of BCBST, protected under Tennessee Code Annotated § 56-7-1013.  It is not to be duplicated, distributed, or revised without the written consent of BCBST.
MasterClauseData.QCPI_Code_Assignment_Exceptions: The fee source for most bands on this Network Attachment is the 2021 CMS RBRVS.  However, for new codes or codes for which CMS does not publish a fee or methodology (i.e., codes other than those with status code “A”) that fall into those categories, reimbursement will be based on a reasonable allowable determined by BCBST, as described in the Provider Manual.  In the event that CMS publishes a fee for a code for which it did not previously publish a fee, BCBST will implement such fee within a reasonable amount of time after publication.
MasterClauseData.QCPI_Chiropractic_Payment: BCBST shall only pay for chiropractic Covered Services when billed with the appropriate CPT codes as listed herein or described in the Provider Manual. Except for chiropractic Covered Services provided to FEP Members, all chiropractic Covered Services, excluding DME, furnished by a licensed chiropractor, as defined in Tennessee Code Annotated Section 63-4-101, (“Chiropractor”) during a single office visit shall be paid at the global rate of $60.00 per visit.  Except when otherwise provided herein, the global rate in this section shall be all-inclusive and shall, in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligation(s) due by the applicable Member to the Provider, compensate Provider in full for all services and supplies provided in association with Covered Services provided by a Chiropractor.  All durable medical equipment (“DME”) Covered Services, furnished by Chiropractor, shall be paid at 75% of the current Medicare Region C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee.  The rates for the DME Covered Services shall be in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligation(s) due by the applicable Member to the Provider. Chiropractic Covered Services provided to FEP Members shall be paid in accordance with the appropriate FEP Network pricing as set forth in the attached FEP Chiropractic Network Attachment.  The Maximum Allowable for chiropractic Covered Services provided to FEP Members will be the lesser of Provider’s billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate fee amount in the FEP Chiropractic Rate Attachment.  All payment or fee amounts listed in the FEP Chiropractic Rate Attachment are subject to payment of lesser billed charges.
MasterClauseData.QCPI_Calculation_of_Established_Fee_p3: Notwithstanding any other provision in the Agreement, Network Attachment, or Provider Manual, as of April 1, 2021, BCBST reserves the right at its sole discretion not to implement one or more CMS changes to RBRVS, RVUs, GPCI, conversion factors, or other elements of the reimbursement methodology. BCBST will provide notice within sixty (60) days of its decision not to implement such changes.
MasterClauseData.QCPI_Calculation_of_Established_Fee_p2: Other fee components, which are listed in the Guidelines for Resource Based Relative Value Scale (RBRVS) Reimbursement Methodology in the Provider Manual, may be updated to ensure that reimbursement is consistent with current usage of the code.  Updates to these components may result in increases or decreases to the established fee at the individual code level.
MasterClauseData.QCPI_Calculation_of_Established_Fee_p1: For those procedure codes that fall into bands with a fee source of 2021 CMS RBRVS, the established fee will be calculated based on the Relative Value Units (RVUs), conversion factors and Geographic Practice Cost Indices (GPCIs) in effect as of October 31, 2021.  No updates will be made to these fee components, except: (1) any new procedure code added after October 31, 2021 will be added as noted above; or (2) in the event that the AMA modifies the code description, the underlying use of the code or the components that make up the code, BCBST will treat the code as a new code in order to remain consistent with recognized coding guidelines.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_Section_11.1: Term. This Agreement will be in effect for a fixed period (the “Fixed Period”) of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_AgreementInitialPeriod" Title="CPA_AgreementInitialPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>3 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>, beginning on the Effective Date; thereafter, this Agreement will continue in effect, unless and until terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. The Fixed Period and any renewal period may be referred to as the “Term” of this Agreement. Provider’s participation in specific Networks will become effective as of the date noted for the applicable Network, and will remain in effect until terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. In the event this Agreement terminates, participation in all Networks pursuant to this Agreement will also terminate. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, if Providers are not properly credentialed by BCBST within 90 days of the date this Agreement is signed by the Provider, this Agreement and participation in all Networks pursuant to this Agreement will automatically terminate and become null and void.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Surgical_Implant_Section_1.24: “Surgical Implant” means a device that is Medically Necessary that is surgically placed internally for therapeutic or reconstructive purposes and not considered a prosthetic or orthotic device.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Outpatient_Surgery_Group_Section_1.1: “Outpatient Surgery Group” means the group to which an outpatient surgical procedure code is assigned based on expected use of resources. This does not include any outpatient surgical procedures specifically carved out in this attachment.
MasterClauseData.ASU_Revenue_Code_Section_1.8: “Revenue Code” means a hospital Revenue Code as adopted by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Per_Unit_Section_1.11: “Per Unit” means a Payment Methodology based on CPT® Code/HCPCS Code in the applicable fee schedules for each unit of service. Provider must bill the appropriate Revenue Code and CPT® Code/HCPCS Code to receive payment.
MasterClauseData.DIA_CPT_Code_Section_1.2: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Original_Medicare_Section_1.7: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1ma_p: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable" Title="BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Per_Diems_Section_1.9: “Per Diem(s)” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member for each day of an Inpatient Stay. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Diem payment is payment in full for all services provided to the Member during each day of an Inpatient Stay.
MasterClauseData.DME_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Indemnification_Section_10.2_p2: The Parties acknowledge that a governmental entity, as the same is defined in the Tennessee Code Annotated Section 29-20-102, may be protected by the limitation of liability imposed by the Tennessee Governmental Tort Liability Act, as defined in Tennessee Code Annotated Section 29-20-101 et seq. The Parties also acknowledge that any non-Tennessee governmental entity may be protected by a similar limitation of liability.
MasterClauseData.ASUM_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Birthing_Center_Transfer_Rate_Sectio: Birthing Center Transfer Rate. In cases where the Member is transferred to an acute care facility prior to delivery, Provider will receive the transfer rate described below:
MasterClauseData.BHABA_Lab_Services_Section_3.2_p2: <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BHABA_Lab_Services_Medicare_Percent" Title="BHABA_Lab_Services_Medicare_Percent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>52%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the 2021 CMS Clinical Laboratory or 2021 CMS RBRVS.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Per_Diems_Section_1.10: “Per Diem(s)” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member for each day of an Inpatient Stay. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Diem payment is payment in full for all services provided to the Member during each day of an Inpatient Stay.
MasterClauseData.DIA_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Exclusions_PPO_Section_3.2_p2: Services that are not covered by CMS under Original Medicare for long term acute care services.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Exclusions_Section_3.2_PPO_p1: Exclusions.  The following are specifically excluded from payment under this Attachment:
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Long_Term_Acute_Care_Services_Secti: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.

<# <TrackedContent TrackName="LTAC_Medicare_Fee_Schedule_Percentage" Title="LTAC_Medicare_Fee_Schedule_Percentage" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule.
Long Term Acute Care Services. Payment for long term acute care Covered Services is:
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Rate_Updates_MAPPO_p2_Section_2.4: BCBST will not conduct any settlement or retroactive pricing or payment adjustments with Provider based on any changes, rebasing, adjustments, or outcomes of appeals related to Medicare cost reports that impact or would have impacted the rates set by CMS.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Rate_Updates_MAPPO_p1_Section_2.4: Rate Updates. Rates under the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule are equivalent to amounts that would have been payable under Original Medicare for the same services; provided however, that BCBST updates the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule in the timeframes described in the Provider Manual.  No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS’s release of a rate and BCBST’s implementation of such rate or due to CMS’s retroactive implementation of an amended rate.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Reimbursement_Policies_PPO_2_Sectio: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program.  Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Reimbursement_Policies_PPO_1_Sectio: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Birthing_Center_Case_Rates_Section_3: Birthing Center Case Rates. The Case Rates below are all-inclusive and will fully compensate Provider for all services and supplies provided in association with birthing center Covered Services. Only services billed with the CPT® Codes shown below are eligible for reimbursement under this Attachment.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Original_Medicare_PPO_Section_1.2: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Reimbursement_Policies_PPO_3_Sectio: All inpatient long-term ventilator care services are subject to Prior Authorization and case management.
MasterClauseData.TMS_Carve_Out: Payment for Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) Covered Services when billed with a 90867, 90868, or 90869 CPT® Code will be carved out of the Medicine – Behavioral Health in the table above and the pricing will be paid at 115% of 2021 CMS RBRVS.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable" Title="BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Opioid_Use_Disorder_Section_1.6:
“Opioid Use Disorder” (“OUD”) refers to what was introduced in the DSM5 as a combination of prior diagnoses of Opioid Dependence and Opioid Abuse. The diagnosis includes the opiate heroin and synthetic
painkillers such as OxyContin.
MasterClauseData.ASU_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.BHABA_Lab_Services_Section_3.2_p1: Lab Services. Payment for those laboratory services that are ancillary to behavioral health professional ABA services is:
MasterClauseData.ACAM_Exclusions_Section_3.2f: Behavioral health services and substance abuse services
MasterClauseData.CPA_Indemnification_Section_10.2_p1: Indemnification.  Each Party (the “Indemnitor”) agrees to indemnify and hold the other Party (the “Indemnitee”) harmless from any and all liability, loss, damage, claim, and expense of any kind, including costs and attorneys' fees which result from the negligent or willful acts or omissions of the Indemnitor, its agents or employees, regarding the duties and obligations of the Indemnitor under the Agreement, including, as applicable, the duty to maintain the legal standard of care applicable to the Indemnitor. Such indemnification and holding harmless will not apply to any matters resulting in whole or in part from the negligent or willful acts or omissions of the Indemnitee, its agents or employees. The indemnification provisions of this section shall not apply to the State of Tennessee.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provisions_of_Services_BlueCard_Prog: Blue Cross Blue Shield Out-of-Area Program (“BlueCard Program”).  Provider’s commitment to provide Covered Services to Members (see Section 4.1(a)) includes the commitment to provide Covered Services to Members of any BCBST Affiliate that has been licensed by BCBSA to use any of the BCBS Marks (“Out-of-Area Blue Members”).  Such Out-of-Area Blue Members may receive care pursuant to the BlueCard Program described in Section XIV of the Provider Manual.  Provider agrees to submit claims for payment related to such Out-of-Area Blue Members in accordance with Section XIV(I) of the Provider Manual and to accept, as the governing rate(s), the rates set forth in this Agreement and any applicable Network Attachment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Confidentiality_Section_9.5: Confidentiality.  Each Party, its Affiliates, and its and their respective officers, directors, and employees will hold all information received or disclosed pursuant to this Agreement in strict confidence and in accordance with applicable state and federal law. The Parties agree not to reveal financial or other terms and conditions of this Agreement to any other Person or entity, except as required by law, required by a valid court order, or mutually agreed to in a writing executed by both Parties. Further, and notwithstanding the confidentiality provisions in this section, Provider authorizes BCBST to collect, compile, compare, and disseminate information concerning, without limitation, Provider's utilization of services, fees or charges, compliance with requirements for Utilization Management and Quality Improvement Programs, BCBST Member satisfaction results, and performance within the industry. BCBST may disseminate such information to Provider, other Network Providers, Payors, customers and potential customers, BCBST Members, and regulatory or accreditation agencies. This provision will survive termination or expiration of this Agreement for any reason.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Per_Case_Section_1.8: “Per Case” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member during an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Case payment is payment in full for all services provided to the Member.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Availability_of_Records_Section_9.4: Availability of Records.  Subject to all applicable privacy and confidentiality requirements as required by law, the medical records of Members will be made available in a timely manner to Healthcare Professionals treating Members, and to BCBST, its agents and representatives, at no charge to BCBST or to Members. In the event that a Member is transferred from Provider, dis-enrolls from his or her Blue Cross Benefit Plan, or Provider no longer participates in the Member's Network, Provider will, upon Member's request and at no cost, provide a copy of such Member's medical records to BCBST, the Member and the attending Physician in a timely manner, as appropriate for the efficient provision of care to such Member.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Compliance_with_42_C.F.R._Part_2_Par: Compliance with 42 C.F.R. Part 2 (Part 2).  If BCBST does not receive patient-identifying information that is protected by Part 2 (“Part 2 Information”), the obligations in this Section will not apply. To the extent that in performing an audit or evaluation for purposes of this Agreement, BCBST receives, stores, uses, processes, discloses, maintains, transmits or otherwise deals with Part 2 Information, BCBST acknowledges and agrees to: (1) retain records in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local record retention laws; (2) maintain and destroy Part 2 Information in a manner consistent with the policies and procedures established under 42 C.F.R. § 2.16; (3) only use Part 2 Information to carry out an audit or evaluation purpose or to investigate or prosecute criminal or other activities, as authorized by a court order entered under 42 C.F.R. § 2.66; and (4) only disclose Part 2 Information as permitted under Part 2, including to Provider.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Audits_and_Inspections_of_Records_Se: Audits and Inspections of Records.  Provider agrees that BCBST, or a representative designated by BCBST, is allowed to perform audits and inspections of records related to the performance of services under this Agreement, including but not limited to financial and medical records, and Utilization Management and Quality Improvement Programs covering the provision of services to any Member, pursuant to the guidelines as set forth in the Provider Manual. Such audits and inspections will be permitted without charge to BCBST or its designated representative, who will be provided copies of records involving the audit or inspection without charge. Except in the event of suspected fraud, waste and abuse, or other illegal activity, such inspection, audit and duplication will occur only after reasonable notice and during regular working hours. Provider will use its best efforts to furnish records requested by BCBST promptly and in an electronic format. Audits and inspections are conducted as part of BCBST's healthcare operations in accordance with applicable federal law.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Maintenance_of_Records_Section_9.2: Maintenance of Records.  Provider will prepare and maintain all appropriate records on Members receiving services. The records will be maintained (i) in accordance with prudent record-keeping procedures , (ii) in a form and manner as described in the Provider Manual, and (iii) as required by law. Notwithstanding the foregoing, BCBST is not defining or prescribing the medical and clinical information and content of the records, so long as such records comply with applicable law.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Definitions_Section_1: The following terms are defined for the purpose of this Attachment. All other capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Processing_of_Claims_Section_9.1: Processing of Claims.  Provider will furnish to BCBST, without charge, all information reasonably required by BCBST for the proper processing and adjudication of claims, including complete and accurate descriptions of the services performed and charges made. Provider will furnish such data in an electronic format and provide all encounter data as requested by BCBST.
