MasterClauseData.CPA_Use_of_BCBSTs_Name_Section_8.3: Use of BCBST's Name.  Provider will not use BCBST's name, symbols, trademarks, or service marks in advertising or promotional materials, or in any other way, without the prior written consent of BCBST and will cease any such permitted usage immediately upon Notice from BCBST to do so, or upon termination of this Agreement, whichever occurs first.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provider_Information_Section_8.2: Provider Information.  BCBST will be permitted to collect, compile, compare, and disseminate information regarding Provider pursuant to, and in accordance with, Tennessee law.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Use_of_Providers_Name_Section_8.1: Use of Provider's Name.  BCBST will have the right to use the name of Provider for purposes of informing Members of the identity of Provider through written (e.g., directories) or oral means, and otherwise to carry out the terms of the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Disputes_Section_7.1: Disputes.  Provider acknowledges and agrees to abide by the Dispute Resolution Process, including the mandatory arbitration requirement, set forth in the Provider Manual. Unless specified in the Provider Manual, Provider agrees that the Dispute Resolution Process is the exclusive method for addressing or resolving any and all controversies, disputes, or claims between Provider and BCBST and its Affiliates. Provider further agrees that BCBST may amend the Dispute Resolution Process from time to time by providing <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_DisputeResolutionNotice" Title="CPA_DisputeResolutionNotice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>thirty (30) days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> prior written notice in advance of the changes becoming effective. The Dispute Resolution Process is incorporated by reference into this Agreement and shall survive the termination of this Agreement. Entities shall not have a right to independently bring a claim relating to a dispute under this Agreement; rather, Provider must bring any claim on behalf of Entities.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Quality_Improvement_and_Utilization_: Quality Improvement and Utilization Management Programs.  BCBST, or an entity designated by BCBST, will maintain Quality Improvement Programs and Utilization Management Programs and will monitor the delivery of healthcare services to Members. For the purposes of providing Covered Services to Members, Provider agrees to comply with BCBST's Quality Improvement Programs and Utilization Management Programs. BCBST may monitor Provider's quality improvement activities and compliance with Quality Improvement Programs and Utilization Management Programs.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use of Codes. The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Additional_Obligations_of_Provider_S: Additional Obligations of Provider.  Provider agrees to notify BCBST promptly, but no later than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_SubrogationNotificationDays" Title="CPA_SubrogationNotificationDays" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> after treatment, if it renders Covered Services to a Member to treat an illness or injury that may have been caused by the Member or by a third party. Further, Provider agrees to cooperate with BCBST and to provide any information, documentation, and assistance reasonably requested to permit BCBST to protect and enforce its rights under this section.
Provider's Obligation.  Provider acknowledges and agrees that it will have no right of subrogation or recovery from the Member or a third party for Covered Services rendered to a Member pursuant to this Agreement. Payment of the applicable Maximum Allowable will be payment in full for such Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_BCBSTs_Right_to_Subrogation_and_Reco: BCBST's Right to Subrogation and Recovery.  Provider acknowledges and agrees that BCBST will be subrogated to and have the right to recover amounts paid for Covered Services whenever a Member receives such Covered Services to treat illnesses or injuries caused by the Member or a third party. In such circumstances, BCBST will have the right to recover amounts paid for Covered Services for the Member's illness or injury on a first-dollar basis, regardless of whether the Member has been made whole for his or her injuries. Provider agrees that BCBST's right to reimbursement or subrogation are net of reasonable costs and attorney's fees, such costs and fees not to exceed <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_SubrogationCosts" Title="CPA_SubrogationCosts" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the gross amount owed to BCBST.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Maintenance_of_Benefits_Section_5.8: Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits.  When a Member is eligible for benefits under more than one health insurance program, policy, or other form of governmental or non-governmental health insurance coverage, the determination of primary and secondary liability (“Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits”) will be made in accordance with applicable rules and established guidelines. Provider will make a good faith effort to determine if a Member is eligible for Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits. If Provider becomes aware of the availability of other health insurance coverage, it will promptly notify BCBST of that fact. Provider may seek payment for the provision of services rendered by Provider from multiple health benefit plans when a Member is eligible to receive benefits from other health insurers. If BCBST is the secondary Payor, then BCBST will coordinate with the primary insurance carrier or Payor and pay up to the Maximum Allowable or will pay as set forth in the Member's Blue Cross Benefit Plan. When Provider seeks payment from another insurer, Provider is not obligated to seek payment from such insurer based on the rates in the applicable Network Attachment. BCBST and Provider will cooperate and exchange information regarding alternative health coverage of Members and other information relative to Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits.
Pass-Through Charges Exception.  For an Inpatient Stay or where otherwise permitted by BCBST in writing, if Provider provides services under arrangement with another healthcare provider, Provider is permitted to submit claims to BCBST or charges to a Member for those services. BCBST and the Member shall have no liability to that other healthcare provider, and Provider shall be financially liable to the other healthcare provider for those services. Provider shall advise the other healthcare provider of Provider's responsibility to pay for such services and shall not permit the other healthcare provider to bill, charge or otherwise attempt to collect from BCBST, the Member or any third party for the services. In the event that BCBST pays the other healthcare provider for such services, BCBST shall have the right to recover the amount of such payment from Provider or withhold future payments from Provider equaling the amount of the payment to the other healthcare provider as set forth in the “Overpayments and Underpayments” provision in this Agreement. Any obligation by BCBST to make payment for services is further subject to the additional terms of this Agreement, the Provider Manual, and the Member's underlying Blue Cross Benefit Plan.

Pass-Through Charges Exception.  Unless otherwise permitted by BCBST in writing, if Provider provides services under arrangement with another healthcare provider, Provider is permitted to submit claims to BCBST or charges to a Member for those services. BCBST and the Member shall have no liability to that other healthcare provider, and Provider shall be financially liable to the other healthcare provider for those services. Provider shall advise the other healthcare provider of Provider's responsibility to pay for such services and shall not permit the other healthcare provider to bill, charge or otherwise attempt to collect from BCBST, the Member or any third party for the services. In the event that BCBST pays the other healthcare provider for such services, BCBST shall have the right to recover the amount of such payment from Provider or withhold future payments from Provider equaling the amount of the payment to the other healthcare provider as set forth in the “Overpayments and Underpayments” provision in this Agreement. Any obligation by BCBST to make payment for services is further subject to the additional terms of this Agreement, the Provider Manual, and the Member's underlying Blue Cross Benefit Plan.
MasterClauseData.CPA_General_Rule_Section_5.7.a_prov: General Rule.  Provider is not permitted to submit claims to BCBST for services performed, in whole or in part, by another provider unless permitted by BCBST in writing or the services are performed as part of an Inpatient Stay.
MasterClauseData.CPA_General_Rule_Section_5.7.a_prof: General Rule.  Provider is not permitted to submit claims to BCBST for services performed, in whole or in part, by another provider unless permitted by BCBST in writing.
MasterClauseData.CPA_NonPatient_Member_Services_Section_5: Non-Patient Member Services.  Provider shall not be eligible for payment under this Agreement for any items or services provided to Non-Patient Members. In order to be eligible for payment for services provided to Non-Patient Members, Provider must enter into a separate agreement with BCBST that applies to services for Non-Patient Members or receive prior written approval from BCBST to bill for such services under this Agreement. Items and services provided to Non-Patient Members are Non-Reimbursable Services under this Agreement, so Provider may not charge, collect a deposit from, seek compensation from, or have any recourse against Members for Non-Patient Member items or services under this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Administrative_Clinical_and_Support_: Administrative, Clinical, and Support Services.  Provider agrees to provide all administrative, clinical and support services necessary to deliver the services it is licensed, credentialed and qualified to provide. Provider also agrees that it will not engage in the unbundling of such services or permit other providers to bill for such administrative, clinical and support services.
Submission Requirements.  Provider warrants that all charges submitted for Covered Services are legitimate. Provider agrees to submit all charges for services to BCBST for adjudication in accordance with the applicable Provider Manual. Provider will submit charges for Covered Services on Clean Claims within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_SubmissionOfChargesRenderedServicePeriod" Title="CPA_SubmissionOfChargesRenderedServicePeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>6 months<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> from the date Covered Services have been rendered to the Member or, for facilities, within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_SubmissionOfChargesRenderedServicePeriod" Title="CPA_SubmissionOfChargesRenderedServicePeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>6 months<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> from the date of discharge of the Member. If BCBST is the secondary Payor to another commercial insurer or Medicare, claims must be submitted within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_SubmissionsOfChargesSecondPayorPeriod" Title="CPA_SubmissionsOfChargesSecondPayorPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>60 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> from the date indicated on the primary insurer's remittance advice or explanation of benefits. Failure to submit claims within the proper time period will result in denial of claims. Provider agrees to abide by recognized standards of coding, as determined by BCBST, and will not engage in any unbundling, upcoding or any similar activities. In addition, BCBST will have the authority, where BCBST determines that such activity has occurred, to rebundle, down code and otherwise address and correct such activities.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Review_of_Records_Section_5.4.e: Review of Records.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, BCBST's review of relevant financial and/or medical records will not be limited to such 18-month time period, nor will BCBST be prohibited from pursuing any other remedy available either at law or in equity
MasterClauseData.CPA_Payment_Correction_Section_5.4.d: Payment Correction.  Provider agrees that BCBST will not be required to correct a payment error to Provider if the request for payment correction is made more than 18 months from the date Provider received payment or notice of non-payment for the specific claim in issue.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Recoupment_Limitations_Section_5.4.c: Recoupment Limitations.  For all Networks, other than those requiring a longer period by regulation or statute, BCBST's request for recoupments will be made no later than 18 months after the date that BCBST paid the claim submitted by Provider that has been paid in error, except in the case of Provider's fraud, in which case no time limit will apply.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Overpayment_Recovery_Section_5.4.b: Overpayment Recovery.  If BCBST determines, in its sole discretion, that it has made an overpayment to Provider, Provider is obligated to and agrees to reimburse BCBST for such overpayment, subject to Provider's right to appeal in accordance with the procedures set forth in this Agreement and the Provider Manual. BCBST may recover the amount of such overpayment by offsetting the overpayment against what is owed or may become due to Provider for other claims, or at its discretion, BCBST may permit direct repayment of the overpayment by Provider.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Overpayments_and_Underpayments_Secti: Overpayments and Underpayments.  Claim payments made by BCBST are contingent upon the accuracy of diagnostic and other information provided by Provider to BCBST. If BCBST determines that it has made erroneous overpayments or underpayments to Provider, BCBST may recover or make additional payments to correct such errors. Reasons for overpayments include, without limitation, payments made for Non-Covered Services or Non-Reimbursable Services, duplicate payments, payment made for services rendered to ineligible individuals, payments made as the primary Payor when BCBST should be the secondary Payor, or payments for bundled or Non-Reimbursable Services in accordance with BCBST's claim coding protocols, as specified in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Deduction_of_Certain_Payments_Sectio: Deduction of Certain Payments.  BCBST will have the right to deduct any Member Cost Sharing Obligations from payments due Provider. Deductions for the Member Cost Sharing Obligations will be determined on the basis of the applicable contracted reimbursement amounts, as set forth in applicable Network Attachments.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Cost_Sharing_Obligation_Secti: Member Cost Sharing Obligation.  Provider will not waive any applicable Member Obligation without BCBST's prior written approval. Provider must bill and make a good faith effort to collect all applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations from Members as a condition to receiving reimbursement from BCBST for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Payment_Dispute_Resolution_Section_5: Payment Dispute Resolution.  Both Parties agree that it is the intent of this Agreement that all payments and dispute resolutions will be resolved pursuant to the terms of this Agreement and the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Administrative_Services_Section_5.1_: Administrative Services.  If a Payor that has contracted with BCBST to perform administrative services for a group is responsible for reimbursing Provider for services rendered to Members covered by that Payor, BCBST's obligation pursuant to the “Reimbursement” provision in this Agreement will be limited to making a good faith effort to arrange to have the responsible Payor reimburse Provider for such services. Such services will be deemed to be Non-Covered Services if the responsible Payor fails to reimburse Provider for otherwise Covered Services and BCBST shall have no financial liability or payment obligation to Provider for such services.
Ineligible Member.  Notwithstanding Provider's agreement to not seek compensation from a Member for Covered Services, if a Member is subsequently determined to have been ineligible at the time Covered Services were rendered, BCBST will recover payments made to Provider for Covered Services in accordance with the terms of the Provider Manual.
Member Hold Harmless.  Provider agrees that in no event, including, but not limited to, non-payment by BCBST including non-payment as a result of Provider's failure to submit claims in accordance with the “Submission of Charges”  provision in this Agreement, rebundling or downcoding of charges by BCBST as described in the “Submission of Charges” provision in this Agreement, or breach of this Agreement, will Provider bill, charge, collect a deposit from, seek compensation from, or have any recourse against Members for Covered Services provided pursuant to this Agreement. This provision will not prevent Provider from charging Members for applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations or for Non-Covered Services in accordance with the “Reimbursement” provision in this Agreement. Provider agrees that it will not seek payment from a Member for a Non-Reimbursable Service.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Chargemaster_Section_1.1: “Chargemaster” means Provider's comprehensive listing of items and services billable by Provider and Provider's associated charges for such items and services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Non_Covered_Services_or_Not_Medicall: Non-Covered Services or Not Medically Necessary.  BCBST is not obligated to pay for services provided by Provider that are not Medically Necessary (including Investigational services) or that are Non-Covered Services. However, the Parties recognize that Members might request services that are not Medically Necessary or are Non-Covered Services. Provider may bill the Member for such services, but only if, prior to performing such services, Provider notifies the Member in writing that the services will not be Covered Services and obtains the Member's informed, written consent in the form of a procedure-specific financial responsibility agreement requiring the Member to acknowledge his or her payment responsibility for such services. Any such procedure-specific acknowledgment of financial responsibility must be the same or substantially similar to the form provided in the applicable Provider Manual and must contain the terms provided for therein.
Maximum Allowable.  Payment to Provider of the Maximum Allowable, less Member Cost Sharing Obligations, for Covered Services rendered to a Member will constitute payment in full for such Covered Services. Provider agrees to accept 98% of billed charges as a payment in full for services rendered to Members not enrolled in a Network. Provider will not bill any Member for any difference between the Maximum Allowable Covered Service and Provider's billed charges for such Covered Service.
EFT and Payment.  BCBST agrees to pay Provider, via Electronic Funds Transfer (“EFT”), for Covered Services in accordance with (i) state or federal laws or regulations applicable to the Blue Cross Benefit Plan covering the Member receiving Covered Services from Provider, (ii) the terms of this Agreement, and (iii) the terms of the applicable Network Attachment. BCBST will process all Clean Claims submitted to BCBST. In the event Provider is unable to receive payment via EFT, BCBST may, in its discretion, terminate this Agreement in accordance with “BCBST Immediate Termination” provision in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Notice_of_Sanctions_or_Other_Quality: Notice of Sanctions or Other Quality of Care Adverse Actions.
Notice at Recredentialing. Provider shall notify BCBST at the time of recredentialing of all final determinations of any action or lawsuit brought against Provider relating to a quality of care complaint.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Immediate_Notice_Section_4.9_a.iii: sanctions or limitations of Provider's ability to participate in any state or federal program.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Immediate_Notice_Section_4.9_a.ii: sanctions or limitations upon any license or certificate issued pursuant to state or federal law, or
MasterClauseData.CPA_Immediate_Notice_Section_4.9_a.i: sanctions issued against the Provider by any government entity,
Immediate Notice.  Provider shall immediately provide Notice to BCBST of any:
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provider_Network_Participation_Confi: Provider Network Participation Confirmation.  Provider agrees that it will not represent itself as a Network Provider until it has received written confirmation from BCBST that Provider is a Network Provider.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Eligibility_Requirements_Section_4.7: Eligibility Requirements.  Provider acknowledges and agrees that each Healthcare Professional with staff privileges at Provider must be credentialed at all times throughout the Term of this Agreement, and must maintain all credentialing requirements in accordance with Provider's policies and procedures. Furthermore, Provider shall ensure that each Healthcare Professional who provides Covered Services to Members at Provider shall be credentialed to be a BCBST provider, to the extent BCBST requires credentialing of Healthcare Professionals of that type, in accordance with the applicable Provider Manual. Provider shall routinely monitor said Healthcare Professionals to ensure adherence to applicable Provider and Provider Manual requirements.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Insurance_Requirements_Section_4.6_a: Requirements.  BCBST will maintain such insurance coverage that BCBST reasonably believes to be appropriate. Provider will maintain general liability and professional liability insurance coverages, in accordance with BCBST's credentialing and re-credentialing requirements and Network Participation Criteria, as specified in the Provider Manual. Provider's insurance coverage will provide coverage against claims for damages caused, in whole or in part, by any act or omission by Provider, and Provider's other employees, agents, or Affiliates. Provider will provide evidence of any of the aforementioned insurance coverage to BCBST upon BCBST's request, and will inform BCBST immediately of any change in such coverage.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Percent_of_Charge_Payments_POC_Secti: “Percent of Charge Payment(s)” (“POC”) means the percentage applied to the Provider's detail line item covered charge to determine the payment rates for those services for which the payment rate is calculated as a percentage of covered charges.
MasterClauseData.CPA_License_Requirement_Section_4.5: License Requirement.  Provider represents to BCBST that Provider possesses and will maintain all published certificates and licenses required by BCBST and state and federal law to perform its obligations pursuant to this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Exclusivity_Section_4.4: Exclusivity.  This Agreement is not intended, and will not be construed, to grant Provider an exclusive or preferential right to provide Covered Services to Members, except as expressly provided in this Agreement or a Network Attachment. Provider acknowledges that BCBST may enter into arrangements with other providers to render specified Covered Services to Members on an exclusive or preferential basis. In such circumstances, Provider will refer Members to such providers to receive those Covered Services in accordance with the applicable Quality Improvement Program and Utilization Management Program requirements.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prior_Authorization_Section_4.3: Prior Authorization.  A Prior Authorization may be retroactively denied by BCBST if BCBST subsequently determines that (i.) the healthcare services sought were not included as Covered Services under the applicable Blue Cross Benefit Plan; (ii) such services were not Medically Necessary; (iii) the Member was ineligible for such services at the time the services were rendered; or (iv) the information submitted with the Prior Authorization request was not accurate and complete. If BCBST does not authorize a service that requires a Prior Authorization, Provider will not receive payment for such service.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Protections_Maximization_of_B: Maximization of Benefits.  Provider acknowledges that BCBST may assist Members from time to time in maximizing their benefits, including through the use of care coordination activities, transparency tools and Member education.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Protections_Disputes_Section_: Disputes.  Both Parties will avoid involving Members in disputes between BCBST and Provider.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Protections_Member_Relations_: Member Relations.  Each Party to this Agreement, their staff, personnel, and agents will treat Members promptly, fairly and courteously, whether by phone, in person, or in writing. Both Parties, and their respective employees, will endeavor to maintain a high level of customer service and satisfaction.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Protections_Open_Communicatio: Open Communication.  BCBST encourages open provider-patient communication regarding appropriate treatment alternatives. BCBST will not penalize Provider for discussing Medically Necessary care with Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Protections_Nondiscrimination: Nondiscrimination.  Provider will provide healthcare services to Members in accordance with recognized standards and within the same time frame as those services provided by Provider to Provider's patients that are not Members. Provider agrees not to differentiate or discriminate in the treatment of Members on the basis of race, sex, age, handicap, religion, national origin, or network reimbursement, and to observe, protect, and promote the rights of Members as patients. BCBST recognizes Provider's right to refuse to treat any Member for appropriate medical or professional reasons, in accordance with applicable state or federal law, provided that the reason for such refusal is not that the patient is a Member in a participating Blue Cross Benefit Plan.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Identification_Card_Section_4.14: Identification Cards.  BCBST agrees to provide appropriate identification cards for BCBST Members, which may be in electronic, digital, or physical form. In order to ensure proper identification of each Member, Provider agrees to use reasonable efforts to verify the identity of the BCBST identification card-holder, including, but not necessarily limited to, checking a valid state-issued identification card, a validly-issued driver's license, or any other appropriate picture ID.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_HCPCS_Code_Section_1.5: “HCPCS Code” means Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System based on the AMA's Current Procedural Technology (“CPT®”) and updated by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Compliance_Section_4.13: Compliance.  The Parties agree to comply with all applicable federal and state laws, rules, and regulations related to this Agreement and the services to be provided hereunder, including, but not limited to, laws and regulations related to fraud, abuse, discrimination, disabilities, confidentiality, privacy, self-referral, false claims, and prohibition of kickbacks. Provider represents, warrants, and agrees that Provider has the requisite right and authority to submit Member-identifying information to BCBST for treatment, payment, and health care operations purposes and has obtained, if required by applicable law, the appropriate consent or authorization to share Member-identifying information with BCBST for all these purposes.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prevention_of_Surprise_Billing_to_Me: Prevention of Surprise Billing to Members.  In the event that Provider determines that it is necessary to refer any Member to another healthcare provider for the provision of Covered Services, Provider will ensure that such other healthcare provider is a Network Provider. Except as otherwise stated in writing between the Parties, Provider will guarantee that providers who are (i) employed or (ii) otherwise have a contractual relationship with Provider will participate in the same Networks as Provider. In the event that Provider fails to meet the above guarantee, BCBST, at its discretion and upon <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_OverallPaymentReductionDaysNotice" Title="CPA_OverallPaymentReductionDaysNotice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>30 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> prior written Notice to Provider, may reduce overall payment rates to Provider by up to <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PaymentReductionPercent" Title="CPA_PaymentReductionPercent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>2%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> for all Networks. Any such adjustment will apply on a prospective basis and will continue for any dates of service when one or more of the providers referenced above in (i) or (ii) are not in a particular Network in which Provider participates.
Acceptance of Assignments. Provider will accept assignments for the payment of services provided to Members. Provider will acquire and maintain all necessary evidence of assignments.
Accessibility of Provider.  Provider will be available to provide Covered Services to Members at all appropriate times in accordance with applicable BCBST policies and procedures and the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provisions_of_Services_Eligibility_a: Eligibility and Coverage Determinations.  Either BCBST or the responsible Payor will have full discretionary authority to make eligibility and coverage determinations concerning services rendered to Members, in accordance with ERISA, and the terms of a Member's Blue Cross Benefit Plan. Provider will accept and abide by all such determinations, subject to its right to dispute such determinations pursuant to the “Resolution of Disputes” provision in this Agreement. Provider acknowledges that it has the right to request expedited reconsideration of an adverse benefit determination if Provider reasonably believes that determination will preclude a Member from receiving urgently needed services. Provider further acknowledges that such eligibility and coverage determinations are solely benefit determinations that will not limit or affect Provider's rights or responsibilities related to the care and treatment of its patients.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provisions_of_Services_Standards_Sec: Standards.  Provider will be responsible for the medical care and treatment and the maintenance of a patient relationship with each Member that Provider treats. Provider will provide only those services that it is licensed, credentialed, and qualified to provide, and will otherwise abide by the terms of this Agreement, the applicable Network Attachments, and the applicable Provider Manual. Provider acknowledges and agrees that any determinations made by BCBST pursuant to BCBST's Quality Improvement Program and Utilization Management Program are benefits and not treatment determinations. Provider is solely responsible for making treatment recommendations and decisions in consultation with its patients. Provider will only provide Covered Services that are: (i) Medically Necessary; and (ii) ordered by an appropriate Healthcare Professional.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provisions_of_Services_General_Secti: General.  Under the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Provider will provide Covered Services to Members in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement, Blue Cross Benefit Plans, and any applicable Network Attachments attached to this Agreement. Provider acknowledges and agrees that BCBST does not promise, warrant, or guarantee that Provider will be permitted to participate in any particular Network, or that Provider will render any type or volume of Covered Services to Members. Provider acknowledges that BCBST does not warrant that Members will choose to utilize Provider's services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Third_Party_Acts_and_Omissions_Secti: Third Party Acts and Omissions.  Neither BCBST, Provider, nor any of their respective agents or employees will be liable to third parties for any act or omission of the other Party.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Associated_Providers_and_Entities_PR: Associated Providers and Entities.  If Provider desires to provide professional services at a new practice location or add a new Associated Provider to this Agreement, then such a change requires only advance notice and does not require an amendment signed by both parties. If Provider provides or arranges for Covered Services through Associated Providers and/or Entities, then any obligations under this Agreement applicable to Provider shall apply equally to such Associated Providers and Entities, as applicable. Provider shall bind all Associated Providers and Entities to the terms of this Agreement and Provider is responsible for ensuring Associated Providers' and Entities' compliance with this Agreement. In the event an Associated Provider or Entity is not credentialed until after the Effective Date, such Associated Provider or Entity shall not be a Participating Provider and shall not be permitted to perform services under this Agreement until they are credentialed. Provider represents that they have obtained each Associated Provider's acknowledgement and consent that this Agreement supersedes the terms of any individual agreement such Associated Provider has with BCBST for purposes of such Associated Provider's participation with Provider under this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Limitation_on_Provider_and_Third_Par: Limitation on Provider and Third Parties.  Provider is entering into this Agreement for itself and on behalf of the Entities listed on Exhibit 1A. This Agreement is entered into by Provider with the understanding that this Agreement will not constitute an agreement between Provider and other third parties that are parties to similar agreements or contracts. Provider agrees that this Agreement does not constitute an agreement that Provider may act as agent for any third party that becomes party to a similar agreement or impose any liability upon any third party by reason of any act or acts of omission or commission on its part. If Provider desires to add a new Entity to this Agreement, both Parties agree that Exhibit 1A must be amended in a writing signed by both Parties.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Independence_of_the_Parties_Section_: Independence of the Parties.  Provider expressly acknowledges its understanding that this Agreement constitutes a legally binding agreement between Provider and BCBST. BCBST and Provider are independent legal entities contracting with each other solely to carry out the terms of this Agreement for the purposes stated herein. Nothing in this Agreement will be construed or be deemed to create a relationship other than that of independent parties. BCBST is an independent corporation operating under a license from the BCBSA, permitting BCBST to use the BCBS Marks, and that BCBST is not contracting as the agent of the BCBSA. Provider acknowledges and agrees that it has not entered into this Agreement based upon representations by any Person other than BCBST, and that no Person other than BCBST will be held accountable or liable to Provider for any of BCBST's obligations to Provider created under this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_23.4_p3: Termination of Provider's participation in Network L does not terminate this Agreement or participation in any other BCBST Network.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_23.4_p2: During the Network L Fixed Term, neither party may terminate Provider's participation in Network L without cause pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision in this Agreement but may terminate Provider's participation pursuant to any other applicable termination provision of this Agreement. Either Party may terminate Provider's participation in Network L effective after the Network L Fixed Term pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision or any other applicable termination provisions in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_23.4_p1: Term and Termination.  Provider's participation in Network L will be effective through the Network L Fixed Term and, thereafter, will renew automatically unless and until terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_23.3_p3: BCBST will revise Network Attachment L pursuant to the methods and time frames established in Network Attachment L or in the applicable Provider Manual. In the event that a prior agreement established a different payment method, the date of service, or the admission date in the case of inpatient services, controls the payment method to be applied.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_23.3_p2: The Maximum Allowable set forth in Network Attachment L will represent the maximum amount payable to Provider for Covered Services rendered to Network L Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_23.3_p1: Reimbursement.  For Covered Services provided to Network L Members, BCBST will pay Provider the Maximum Allowable in accordance with the attached Network Attachment L, which is incorporated by reference into this Agreement, at the time of service, less any applicable Member Obligation.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Surgical_Appliance_Section_1.23: “Surgical Appliance” means a surgical device that is Medically Necessary that is externally placed as a part of a surgical procedure and is integral to the surgical procedure and not considered a prosthetic or orthotic device.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Participation_Section_23.2: Participation.  Provider agrees to participate in BCBST's Blue Network L for the purpose of providing health care Covered Services to Network L Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_L_Members_Section_23.1.b: “Network L Member(s)” means those BCBST Members whose health benefits are delivered through BCBST's Blue Network L.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_L_Fixed_Term_Section_23.1.a: “Network L Fixed Term” means <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Title="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>3 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> beginning on the Effective Date.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Payment_Rates_Section_1.7: “Payment Rate(s)” means Maximum Allowable as defined in the Billing and Reimbursement Guidelines section below.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_22.4_p3: Termination of Provider's participation in the MA Behavioral Health Network does not terminate this Agreement or participation in any other BCBST Network.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_22.4_p2: During the MA Behavioral Health Network Fixed Term, neither party may terminate Provider's participation in the MA Behavioral Health Network without cause pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision in this Agreement but may terminate Provider's participation pursuant to any other applicable termination provision of this Agreement. Either Party may terminate Provider's participation in the MA Behavioral Health Network effective after the MA Behavioral Health Network Fixed Term pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision or any other applicable termination provisions in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_22.4_p1: Term and Termination.  Provider's participation in the MA Behavioral Health Network will be effective through the MA Behavioral Health Network Fixed Term and, thereafter, will renew automatically unless and until terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_22.3_p3: BCBST will revise the MA Behavioral Health Network pursuant to the methods and time frames established in the MA Behavioral Health Network or in the applicable Provider Manual. In the event that a prior agreement established a different payment method, the date of service, or the admission date in the case of inpatient services, controls the payment method to be applied.
MasterClauseData.ASU_Per_Case_Section_1.7: “Per Case” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to member during an Outpatient Encounter. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Case payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member including, but not limited to, Implants, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Outpatient Encounter, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies) and medication.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_22.3_p2: The Maximum Allowable set forth in the MA Behavioral Health Network will represent the maximum amount payable to Provider for Covered Services rendered to Medicare Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_22.3_p1: Reimbursement.  For Covered Services provided to Medicare Members, BCBST will pay Provider the Maximum Allowable in accordance with the attached MA Behavioral Health Network Attachment, which is incorporated by reference into this Agreement, at the time of service, less any applicable Member Obligation.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Participation_Section_22.2: Participation.  Provider agrees to participate in BCBST's MA Behavioral Health Network for the purpose of providing health care Covered Services to Medicare Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_MA_Behavioral_Health_Fixed_T: “MA Behavioral Health Fixed Term” means <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Title="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>3 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> beginning on the Effective Date.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_21.4_p4: Termination of Provider's participation in the MA HMO does not terminate this Agreement or participation in any other BCBST Network.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_21.4_p3: MA HMO effective after the MA HMO Fixed Term pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision or any other applicable termination provisions of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_21.4_p2: During the MA HMO Fixed Term, neither party may terminate Provider's participation in the MA HMO without cause pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision in this Agreement but may terminate Provider's participation pursuant to any other applicable termination provision of this Agreement. Either Party may terminate Provider's participation in MA HMO effective after the MA HMO Fixed Term pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision or any other applicable termination provisions in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_21.4_p1: Term and Termination.  Provider's participation in MA HMO will be effective through the MA HMO Fixed Term and, thereafter, will renew automatically unless and until terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described herein, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_21.3_p3: BCBST will revise the MA HMO Network pursuant to the methods and time frames established in the MA HMO Network Attachment or in the applicable Provider Manual. In the event that a prior agreement established a different payment method, the date of service, or the admission date in the case of inpatient services, controls the payment method to be applied.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_21.3_p2: The Maximum Allowable set forth in the MA HMO Network Attachment will represent the maximum amount payable to Provider for Covered Services rendered to MA HMO Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_21.3_p1: Reimbursement.  For Covered Services provided to MA HMO Members, BCBST will pay Provider the Maximum Allowable in accordance with the attached MA HMO Network Attachment, which is incorporated by reference into this Agreement, at the time of service, less any applicable Member Obligation.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Participation_Section_21.2: Participation.  Provider agrees to participate in BCBST's MA HMO for the purpose of providing health care Covered Services to MA HMO Members.
“MA HMO Members” means those BCBST Members whose health benefits are delivered through BCBST's BlueEssential HMO Network.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_MA_HMO_Fixed_Term_Section_21: “MA HMO Fixed Term” means <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Title="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>3 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> beginning on the Effective Date.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_20.4_p3: Termination of Provider's participation in the MA PPO does not terminate this Agreement or participation in any other BCBST Network.
MasterClauseData.BHABA_Professional_ABA_Services_Section_: <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BHABA_ABA_Services_Percent" Title="BHABA_ABA_Services_Percent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the amount shown on Schedule 1A for the relevant CPT® code and provider type.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_20.4_p2: During the MA PPO Fixed Term, neither party may terminate Provider's participation in the MA PPO without cause pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision in this Agreement but may terminate Provider's participation pursuant to any other applicable termination provision of this Agreement. Either Party may terminate Provider's participation in MA PPO effective after the MA PPO Fixed Term pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision or any other applicable termination provisions in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_20.4_p1: Term and Termination.  Provider's participation in MA PPO will be effective through the MA PPO Fixed Term and, thereafter, will renew automatically unless and until terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_20.3_p3: BCBST will revise the MA PPO Network pursuant to the methods and time frames established in the MA PPO Network Attachment or in the applicable Provider Manual. In the event that a prior agreement established a different payment method, the date of service, or the admission date in the case of inpatient services, controls the payment method to be applied.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_20.3_p2: The Maximum Allowable set forth in the MA PPO Network Attachment will represent the maximum amount payable to Provider for Covered Services rendered to MA PPO Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_20.3_p1: Reimbursement.  For Covered Services provided to MA PPO Members, BCBST will pay Provider the Maximum Allowable in accordance with the attached MA PPO Network Attachment, which is incorporated by reference into this Agreement, at the time of service, less any applicable Member Obligation.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Participation_Section_20.2: Participation.  Provider agrees to participate in BCBST's MA PPO for the purpose of providing health care Covered Services to MA PPO Members.
“MA PPO Members” means those BCBST Members whose health benefits are delivered through BCBST's BlueAdvantage PPO Network.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_MA_PPO_Fixed_Term_Section_20: “MA PPO Fixed Term” means <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Title="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>3 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> beginning on the Effective Date.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Covered_Services_f_Section_2.9: the opinions of any Person that contracts with BCBST to assess and coordinate the treatment of Members requiring non-experimental or Investigational services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Covered_Services_e_Section_2.9: regulations and other official publications issued by the Food & Drug Administration (“FDA”) and the United States Department of Health and Human Services (“HHS”); or
MasterClauseData.CPA_Covered_Services_d_Section_2.9: the published authoritative medical or scientific literature regarding the proposed service or supply in connection with the treatment of injuries or illnesses; or
MasterClauseData.CPA_Covered_Services_c_Section_2.9: any consent document that a Member will be asked to execute, in order to receive the proposed service or supply; or
MasterClauseData.CPA_Covered_Services_b_Section_2.9: the protocol(s) under which a proposed service or supply is to be delivered; or
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Original_Medicare_Section_1.7: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Covered_Services_Section_2.9: “Covered Service(s)” means those Medically Necessary healthcare services and supplies delivered or provided to a Member and for which benefits are available under the terms of the Member's Blue Cross Benefit Plans. In determining whether a service is a Covered Service, without limitation, BCBST may rely upon any or all of the following, in its sole discretion:
MasterClauseData.CPA_Contract_Addresses_Section_2.8: “Contract Address(es)” means the current email address(es) specified for notifications between the Parties related to this Agreement. The Parties acknowledge that BCBST may specify different email address(es) for different purposes under this Agreement. Please see the Provider Manual for details on the current BCBST Contract Addresses and where to create and update your Contract Addresses.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Clean_Claim_Section_2.7: “Clean Claim” means a claim for payment of Covered Services provided to a Member by a Network Provider that requires no further information, adjustment, or alteration in order to be processed and paid by BCBST or the responsible Payor.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Change_of_Control_Section_2.6: “Change of Control” means the occurrence of any of the following: (a) direct or indirect sale, transfer, conveyance or other disposition (other than by way of merger, consolidation, reorganization or conversion), in one or a series of related transactions, of all or a majority of the properties or assets of Provider; (b) the consummation of any transaction (including, without limitation, any merger, consolidation, reorganization or conversion) the result of which is that a Person that is not an Affiliate prior to the transaction becomes the beneficial owner, directly or indirectly, of more than 25% of the then-outstanding number of units, interests, or shares of the Provider's voting stock (or membership interests or other equity); (c) a Person that is not an Affiliate prior to the transaction assumes substantial operational control of Provider or one or more service lines, departments, or ancillary services provided by Provider, including but not limited to operational control exercised through the entry into, or change in, an agreement for a Person that is not an Affiliate prior to the transaction to provide management or outsourcing services to Provider; or (d) there is a change to a Person that has the authority to appoint individuals to Provider's Board of Directors or equivalent governing board.
MasterClauseData.CAU_CPT_Code_Section_1.2: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Blue_Cross_Benefit_Plan_Section_2.5: “Blue Cross Benefit Plan” means an agreement entered into by BCBST or any of its Affiliates with a Person for the purpose of insuring or administering Covered Services by BCBST or one of its Affiliates.
MasterClauseData.CPA_BCBS_Marks_Section_2.4: “BCBS Marks” means the trademarks, names, logos, symbols and service marks owned by the BCBSA.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Utilization_Management_Program_Secti: “Utilization Management Program” means the BCBST program which focuses on the medical review of healthcare services provided to Members, as described in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Quality_Improvement_Program_Section_: “Quality Improvement Program” means the BCBST program which focuses on monitoring and enhancing the quality of healthcare services rendered to Members, as described in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provider_Manual_Section_2.34: “Provider Manual” means the applicable manual(s) set forth on the BCBST website(s) that contain information, including, but not limited to, medical and operating policies and procedures established by BCBST for Network Providers.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Now_Therefore_Section_1.3: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants hereinafter contained, the Parties agree as follows:
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prior_Authorization_Section_2.33: “Prior Authorization” means an authorization obtained from BCBST for the provision of Covered Services prior to the delivery of that service or period of confinement, as described in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Physician_Section_2.32: “Physician” means an individual licensed to practice medicine or osteopathy by the state(s) in which he or she practices such profession.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Person_Section_2.31: “Person” means any natural person, corporation, general partnership, limited partnership, limited liability company, proprietorship, other business organization, trust, union, association, or governmental or regulatory authority, whether domiciled in the United States or one of its territories.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Payor_Section_2.30: “Payor” means a person or entity that is responsible for paying for Covered Services in accordance with the terms of the Blue Cross Benefit Plan under which the Member being treated is covered.
MasterClauseData.CPA_BCBSA_Section_2.3: “BCBSA” means the BlueCross BlueShield Association, an association of independent BlueCross BlueShield licensees.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Outpatient_Encounter_Section_2.29_pr: “Outpatient Encounter” means services provided by the Provider to a Member who (i) has not been admitted to Provider for an Inpatient Stay, (ii) is registered on the Provider records as an outpatient, and (iii) is physically present at the Provider while receiving the services. The Outpatient Encounter lasts from the time the Member is registered until the Member is discharged from the Provider or is admitted for an Inpatient Stay.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Notice_Section_2.28: “Notice” means notice provided in accordance with the “Notice” provision in this Agreement. For purposes of Notice under this Agreement, electronic notification, i.e. DocuSign®, or other method of email, satisfies the requirements of written notification.
MasterClauseData.CPA_NonReimbursable_Services_Section_2.2: “Non-Reimbursable Services” means those services and supplies that would have been Covered Services but for the fact that the Provider (i) rendered services or supplies that were not Medically Necessary; (ii) failed to comply with applicable Quality Improvement Program or Utilization Management Program requirements; or (iii) failed to submit a claim for such services or supplies within the submission deadlines established in the “Submission of Charges” provision in this Agreement. “Non-Reimbursable Services” also include Non-Contracted Services as set forth in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_NonPatient_Member_PROV_Section_2.26: “Non-Patient Member” means a Member who is not at Provider as part of an Inpatient Stay or Outpatient Encounter but who (i) has a specimen, scan, screening, or any other result (collectively and generally, “Test”) that is submitted for analysis or billing by Provider and the Member is not physically present at Provider at the time of the Test or (ii) receives durable medical equipment that is submitted for billing by Provider and the Member is not physically present at Provider.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Length_of_Stay_Section_1.11: “Length of Stay” (“LOS”) means the number of approved days in an Inpatient Stay.
MasterClauseData.ACA_ALOS_Section_1.1: “Average Length of Stay” (“ALOS”) means the average number of days of an Inpatient Stay for each DRG, as set forth in Schedule 1-A.
MasterClauseData.CPA_NonCovered_Services_Section_2.25: “Non-Covered Services” means those services and supplies that are not included in Covered Services, or are specifically excluded from, or subject to a limitation of, coverage pursuant to the terms of the Provider Manual or the Member's Blue Cross Benefit Plan. Non-Covered Services are not the same as Non-Reimbursable Services, the definition of which is set forth below.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_Provider_Section_2.24: “Network Provider” means a healthcare provider contracted to provide Covered Services to Members enrolled in a Blue Cross Benefit Plan
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_Participation_Criteria_Secti: “Network Participation Criteria” means the minimum qualifications and standards required in order to be considered and selected to participate in a Network, as described in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_Attachment_Section_2.22: “Network Attachment” means an attachment or exhibit to this Agreement that describes the rates to be paid to Provider for provision of certain services to BCBST Members accessing a particular Network. Network Attachments may also include specific terms or conditions applicable only to Provider's participation in that Network.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_Section_2.21: “Network” means a group of providers that has agreed to accept a pre-determined method or rate of payment for Covered Services provided to select Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Obligations_Section_2.20: “Member Obligation(s)” means any and all charges that a Network Provider may collect directly from a Member as the Member's portion of payment for Covered Services, including the copayments, deductibles and coinsurance amounts described in the Member's Blue Cross Benefit Plan.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Associated_Provider_Section_2.2_prof: “Associated Provider” means the Healthcare Professional(s) that serve as partners, associates, employees, etc., of the Provider. Without limiting the foregoing, in the event that Provider is a group practice, management services organization, clinically integrated network, accountable care organization, or independent physician association (“IPA”) or similar entity that contracts on behalf of Healthcare Professionals, “Associated Provider” includes any Healthcare Professional that contracts with BCBST through this Agreement
MasterClauseData.CPA_Members_Section_2.19: “Member(s)” means an individual eligible to receive Covered Services under a Blue Cross Benefit Plan.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Medically_Necessary_Section_2.18: “Medically Necessary” means the definition of the term “medically necessary” as set forth in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_CPT_Code_Section_1.4: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.17: “Maximum Allowable” means the amount that the Payor has determined to be the maximum amount payable for a Covered Service, which will be the lesser of billed charges or the established fee for the services performed as set forth in the applicable Network Attachment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Investigational_Section_2.16: “Investigational” means the definition of the term “investigational” as set forth in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Inpatient_Stay_Section_2.15_prov: “Inpatient Stay(s)” means a Member (i) is admitted to Provider in an inpatient setting, (ii) is physically present at Provider, (iii) and the admitting physician has documented that the member's condition, safety, or health supports providing care in an inpatient setting rather than a less intensive setting.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Healthcare_Professional_Section_2.14: “Healthcare Professional(s)” means a physician, doctor of osteopathy, podiatrist, dentist, chiropractor, midwife, nurse, optometrist, or other individual licensed or certified to practice a healthcare profession by the state or states in which he or she practices such profession.
MasterClauseData.CPA_ERISA_Section_2.13: “ERISA” means the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended, and the rules and regulations promulgated pursuant thereto.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Entity_or_Entities_Section_2.12: “Entity or Entities” means a provider, including a healthcare facility or Healthcare Professional, with a unique Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN), National Provider Identifier (NPI), location, or taxonomy.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Emergency_Section_2.11: “Emergency” means the definition of the term “emergency” as set forth in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Dispute_Resolution_Process_Section_2: “Dispute Resolution Process” means the process set forth in the Provider Manual to resolve disputes between the Parties, including the applicable Provider Dispute Resolution Procedure and the Medical Management Corrective Action Plan (each as defined in the applicable Provider Manual).
MasterClauseData.CPA_Affilate_Section_2.1: “Affiliate(s)” means (i) any Person that directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls or is controlled by, or is under common control with, the Person specified (for purposes of this definition, “control” of a Person means the power, direct or indirect, to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of such Person whether by contract or otherwise, and, in any event, and without limitation of the previous sentence, any Person owning <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_AffiliateOwnershipPercent" Title="CPA_AffiliateOwnershipPercent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>50%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or more of the voting securities of another Person will be deemed to control that Person); or (ii) any Person that has been licensed by the BCBSA to use any of the BCBS Marks, regardless of any common control requirements or lack of control.  For the avoidance of doubt, any licensed Person is related to BCBST as a separate and distinct licensee of BCBSA.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_19.6: Term and Termination.  The following termination provisions apply to the MA Networks in addition to those contained in the “Term; Termination” provision of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provisions_Surviving_Termination_Sec: Provisions Surviving Termination.  The following provisions of the “Medicare   Advantage Networks” provision shall survive any termination of this Agreement: “Confidentiality”, “Compliance”, “Record Maintenance”, and “Continuation of Services after Termination” provisions in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Immediate_Termination_Upon_Exclusion: Immediate Termination Upon Exclusion.  Provider's participation in the MA Networks will immediately terminate upon Provider's exclusion from participating in federal health programs.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Termination_of_Medicare_Benefit_Prog: Termination of Medicare Benefit Program.  Provider's participation in the MA Networks will terminate immediately upon the official cancellation of BCBST's contract with CMS or on the official date of discontinuance of BCBST's Medicare Benefit Program, whichever is later.
MasterClauseData.ASUM_Exclusions_Section_3.2_p2: Services not covered by CMS under Original Medicare for ambulatory surgery services
MasterClauseData.CPA_Hold_Harmless_DualEligible_Members_S: Hold Harmless; Dual-Eligible Members.  Provider will not hold Medicare Members liable for payment of any fees that are the legal obligation of BCBST. Provider further agrees that, for all Medicare Members eligible for both Medicare and Medicaid, such Medicare Members will not be held liable for Medicare Part A and B cost sharing when the State is responsible for paying such amounts. Provider agrees to: (1) accept BCBST payment as payment in full, or (2) bill the appropriate State source. Provider will be informed of Medicare and Medicaid benefits and rules for Medicare Members eligible for Medicare and Medicaid. Provider and BCBST may not impose cost-sharing that exceeds the amount of cost-sharing that would be permitted with respect to the individual under title XIX if the individual were not enrolled in BCBST.
MasterClauseData.CPA_PlanDirected_Care_Section_19.5.d_p2: For services that require Prior Authorization or predetermination, BCBST's authorization procedures must be followed. If a Medicare Member proceeds to receive care at the direction of Provider, believing that such care was verbally or otherwise authorized by Provider, the Medicare Member cannot be held financially responsible. In such cases where Provider failed to follow BCBST's authorization protocols, BCBST may decline to pay the claim, in which case Provider will be held financially liable for the services received by the Medicare Member. CMS prohibits holding the Medicare Member liable in such cases.
MasterClauseData.CPA_PlanDirected_Care_Section_19.5.d_p1: Plan-Directed Care.  CMS considers plan-directed care to be the financial responsibility of the health plan and/or its contracted network, but in either case, not the responsibility of the Medicare Member. Plan-directed care is care the Member believes they were instructed to obtain, or authorized to receive and such instruction and/or authorization was provided by a health plan representative. Under CMS's guidance, a representative of the health plan includes plan-contracted providers. Therefore, Provider must obtain authorization from BCBST prior to referring a Medicare Member to an out-of-network provider.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prohibition_on_Balance_Billing_Secti: In addition, Provider will not charge Medicare Members any fees, surcharges or sales, use or other applicable tax for Covered Services. If BCBST receives notice of any additional charges or balance billing, Provider will fully cooperate with BCBST to investigate such allegations and will promptly refund any improper payments collected.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Whereas_the_Parties_Section_1.2: WHEREAS, the Parties desire to enter into this Agreement for the Provider to provide healthcare services to the Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prohibition_on_Balance_Billing_Secti: Prohibition on Balance Billing.  Provider may not bill or collect from the Medicare Member or any third party for services, procedures, drugs, supplies or home medical equipment that are not Medically Necessary or that are denied in a Medicare coverage determination issued by BCBST as explained in the Provider Manual and/or as set forth in the Medicare Benefit Contract. Provider may collect, however, for a specific service, procedure, drug, supply or item of home medical equipment where services are not Medically Necessary or benefits are not payable pursuant to a Medicare coverage determination, if, prior to the service being provided, Provider requested a pre-determination on the Member's behalf and BCBST has issued a CMS-10003 Notice of Denial of Medical Coverage.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prompt_Payment_Section_19.5.b: Prompt Payment.  Unless a claim for payment is disputed, BCBST will promptly make payment on each Clean Claim, timely submitted by Provider, for Covered Services rendered to a Medicare Member, within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_CleanClaimPromptPayment" Title="CPA_CleanClaimPromptPayment" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 calendar days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>. All payments will be made in accordance with BCBST policies.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Timely_Submission_of_Claims_Section_: Timely Submission of Claims.  Provider will file claims within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_TimelySubmissionofClaims" Title="CPA_TimelySubmissionofClaims" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>365 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> from the date of service. Claims that are not filed, including the submission of any revisions or adjustments, within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_TimelySubmissionofClaims" Title="CPA_TimelySubmissionofClaims" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>365 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the date of service will be denied. Provider will not bill Medicare Members for claims that are denied due to Provider's failure to timely submit the claim.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Coverage_Determinations_Section_19.4: Coverage Determinations. In addition to the guidelines set forth in the “Provision of Services” provision in this Agreement, BCBST will make determinations of whether services provided to Medicare Members are Covered Services in accordance with the coverage guidelines established by the Medicare Benefit Program.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Delegation_Section_19.4.b._p2: To the extent Provider renders Covered Services to Members under arrangements with another healthcare provider, BCBST hereby delegates to Provider responsibility under BCBST's Medicare Advantage contract with CMS to provide such services as set forth in this Agreement. Provider agrees that BCBST may only delegate such responsibilities in a manner consistent with the standards set forth under 42 C.F.R. §422.504(i)(3) and (4). Provider agrees that BCBST or CMS, consistent with obligations under the Medicare Advantage program, may revoke this delegation and terminate Provider's participation in MA Networks if Provider does not perform satisfactorily or if any of Provider's reporting and disclosure obligations are not fully met in a timely manner. In the event of such delegation, Provider acknowledges that BCBST will oversee and monitor Provider's performance on an ongoing basis. Provider further acknowledges that BCBST is accountable to CMS for the functions and responsibilities described in its Medicare Advantage contract with CMS and applicable regulatory standards.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Delegation_Section_19.4.b._p1: Delegation.  To the extent that BCBST delegates to Provider any of its administrative responsibilities (e.g. credentialing) such delegation will be specified in a separate agreement that is compliant with CMS regulations and BCBST policies and procedures. No administrative delegation is presumed under this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Administrative_and_Compliance_Respon: Administrative and Compliance Responsibilities.  BCBST will perform or arrange for the performance of all administrative responsibilities necessary under this Agreement for the provision of Covered Services to Medicare Members except as otherwise specified herein. BCBST will have the sole responsibility for filing reports, obtaining approval from, and complying with, the applicable laws and regulations of federal, state and local governmental agencies having jurisdiction over BCBST. Such compliance accountability includes monitoring of Provider's compliance with applicable regulations. BCBST will perform all the necessary administrative, accounting, enrollment and other functions appropriate for the marketing and administration of its Medicare Benefit Program. BCBST may elect to contract with persons and/or entities to perform such responsibilities and functions on behalf of BCBST.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Opioid_Use_Disorder_Section_1.6:
“Opioid Use Disorder” (“OUD”) refers to what was introduced in the DSM5 as a combination of prior diagnoses of Opioid Dependence and Opioid Abuse. The diagnosis includes the opiate heroin and synthetic
painkillers such as OxyContin.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provider_Representations_and_Warrant: Provider Representations and Warranties.  Provider warrants that Provider is duly qualified and approved to act as a provider of health care services to Medicare Beneficiaries under Title XVIII of the Social Security Act (whether considered "participating" in Medicare or not). Further, Provider represents and warrants to BCBST that (a) neither Provider nor any of its Affiliates are excluded from participation in any federal health care program, as defined under 42 U.S.C. §1320a-7b (f); (b) Provider has not arranged or contracted (by employment or otherwise) with any employee, contractor, Downstream Entity, or agent that Provider or its Affiliates know or should know are excluded from participation in any federal health care program to provide items or services hereunder; and (c) no final adverse action, as such term is defined under 42 U.S.C. §1320a-7e (g), has occurred or is pending or threatened against Provider or its Affiliates or to Provider's knowledge against any employee, contractor or agent engaged to provide items or services under this Agreement (collectively "Exclusions/Adverse Actions"). Provider, during the term of this Agreement, will notify BCBST of any Exclusions/Adverse Actions or any basis therefore within two (2) business days of Provider's learning of any such Exclusions/Adverse Actions or any basis therefore.
Provider's Notices.  Provider will notify BCBST, in writing, within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_NoticeMEDIMEDSuspExcl" Title="CPA_NoticeMEDIMEDSuspExcl" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of: (a) any termination, suspension, limitation, voluntary surrender or restriction of Provider's license, accreditation, certification, or other governmental authorization; (b) failure to maintain any insurance as required herein; (c) Provider's conviction of a felony or any other criminal charge relating to Provider; (d) any disciplinary action taken by a state licensing board, or other governmental agency; (e) Provider's suspension or exclusion from participation in the Medicare or Medicaid programs; or (f) any other legal, governmental or other action or event which may materially impair the Provider's ability to perform any duties and obligations under this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Subcontracted_Providers_Section_19.3: Subcontracted Providers.  To the extent Provider provides any Covered Services for Medicare Members through a subcontract with another healthcare provider, the following will apply: (i) Provider acknowledges that the subcontracted provider will be considered a Downstream Entity; (ii) Provider agrees to pay the Downstream Entity promptly in accordance with CMS rules and regulations and to comply with any other laws and regulations related to payment, administration or oversight of Covered Services rendered to a Medicare Member; (iii) Provider will provide a copy of this Agreement to the Downstream Entity; (iv) Provider agrees and acknowledges that BCBST retains the right to approve, suspend, or terminate any delegation/subcontract by Provider to furnish Covered Services; (v) Provider agrees that any such delegation or subcontract, will be performed by the Downstream Entity in accordance with BCBST's contractual obligations to CMS, Provider's contractual obligations hereunder, and all applicable Medicare laws, regulations and CMS instructions; and (vi) Provider agrees that any agreements of Provider with respect to any subcontract/delegation will be in writing, signed by the Parties, and will specifically obligate the Downstream Entity to comply with all of the provisions of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Continuation_of_Services_after_Termi: Continuation of Services after Termination.  After termination of Provider's participation in BCBST's MA Networks, BCBST will be liable for payment for Covered Services rendered by Provider to a Medicare Member who retains eligibility or is under the care of Provider at the time of termination, other than for applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, until the services being rendered to the Medicare Member by Provider are completed, unless BCBST makes reasonable and medically appropriate provision for the assumption of such services by another Network Provider. BCBST will reimburse Provider for all services rendered pursuant to this Section at Medicare allowable assignment rates, and Provider will accept such payment, together with any authorized Member Obligation, as payment in full. This continuation of Covered Services and hold harmless obligation will be for the period for which the Medicare Member's premium has been paid to BCBST by CMS, not to exceed a period of 30 days, except for those Medicare Members who are hospitalized on an inpatient basis. Provider will continue to arrange for Covered Services for those Medicare Members who are hospitalized on an inpatient basis as of the date of termination of Provider's participation in the MA Networks until the Medicare Member is discharged from the hospital.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reports_and_Administration_Section_1: Reports and Administration.  Provider agrees to provide BCBST with encounter data, risk adjustment data, and other informational data sufficient to meet BCBST's reporting obligations to CMS. BCBST will perform all the necessary administrative, accounting, enrollment and other functions appropriate for the administration of its Medicare Benefit Program.
Record Maintenance.  Provider will maintain adequate medical, financial and administrative records related to Covered Services rendered to Medicare Members. Unless a longer time period is required by applicable statutes or regulations, Provider will maintain, and BCBST, the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), the Comptroller General, the General Accounting Office, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), or the designees of any of the foregoing, and, as applicable, the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) or its designee will have the right to audit, inspect, review and make copies of, any books, contracts, computer or other electronic systems, including medical records and documentation, and other records maintained by Provider, its subcontractors or related entities, related to CMS's contract with BCBST or to Covered Services provided to Medicare Members under this Agreement, through ten (10) years from the final date of the contract period or from the date of the completion of any audit, whichever is later.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements. All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BCE_Billing_Requirements" Title="BCE_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1450 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
