MasterClauseData.CPA_Prohibition_on_Removal_of_Medicare_M: Prohibition on Removal of Medicare Members.  Neither Provider, Provider's employees nor Provider's subcontractors will request, demand, require or otherwise seek, directly or indirectly, the termination from the Medicare Benefit Plan of any Medicare Member based upon the Medicare Member's need for or use of medically required services, or in order to gain financially or otherwise from such termination. Provider may request that BCBST terminate coverage of a Medicare Member for reasons of fraud, disruption of medical services, or failure to follow a physician's orders, or for any of the reasons specified by CMS for mandatory disenrollment. However, Provider agrees that BCBST will have sole and ultimate authority to terminate a Medicare Member's coverage, and Provider understands that any requested termination is subject to prior approval by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Advice_to_Medicare_Members_Section_1: Advice to Medicare Members.  Nothing in this Agreement is intended to prohibit or restrict Provider from advising or advocating on behalf of a Medicare Member regarding (1) the Medicare Member's health status, medical care, or treatment options (including alternative treatments that may be self-administered), including providing sufficient information to the Medicare Member to provide an opportunity to decide among all relevant treatment options, (2) the risks, benefits and consequences of treatment or non-treatment, and (3) the opportunity for the Medicare Member to refuse treatment and express preferences about future treatment decisions. Provider must provide information regarding treatment options in a culturally competent manner, including the option of no treatment. Provider must assure that individuals with disabilities are furnished with effective communications in making decisions regarding treatment options. Provider will have procedures to inform Medicare Members of follow-up care and provide training in self-care as necessary.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Compliance_Section_19.3.c._p2: Provider further agrees that any Covered Services provided to Medicare Members will be consistent with and comply with BCBST's contractual obligations to CMS, as required by 42 C.F.R. §422.504(i)(3)(iii).
MasterClauseData.CPA_Compliance_Section_19.3.c._p1: Compliance.  Provider agrees to comply with BCBST's policies and procedures and all applicable federal and state laws, rules and regulations, including Medicare laws and regulations and CMS instructions, now or hereafter in effect regarding the performance of Provider's obligations hereunder, including without limitation, laws or regulations governing record timeliness, adequacy and accuracy, the regulations promulgated in 42 C.F.R. §422 et. seq., and the appeal and dispute resolution procedures related to Covered Services provided to Medicare Members. Provider agrees to comply with all federal laws on fraud, waste and abuse, as well as the HIPAA Implication Rules at 45 C.F.R. §160, 162 and 164.
MasterClauseData.ACAM_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACAM_Maximum_Allowable" Title="ACAM_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>, as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
Availability.  Provider will have hours of operation that are generally convenient to Medicare Members and do not discriminate against Medicare enrollees. Provider will make services available on a 24 hours a day/7 days a week basis.
Confidentiality.  Provider agrees to abide by all federal and state laws regarding confidentiality and disclosure of medical records, or other health and enrollment information, including the confidentiality requirements established by BCBST and the Medicare Advantage program as set forth at 42 C.F.R. §422.118. Provider will ensure that medical information is only released in accordance with applicable federal or state law, or pursuant to court orders and subpoenas. Provider will maintain records in an accurate and timely manner and will ensure timely access by Medicare Members to the records and information that pertain to them.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_19.2: Definitions.  The following terms are defined for the purposes of this Section:
MasterClauseData.CPA_Medicare_Member_Section_19.2.e: “Medicare Member” means a Beneficiary who has elected to enroll in the Medicare Benefit Program through a Blue Cross Benefit Plan offered by BCBST and whose enrollment with BCBST has been confirmed by CMS. For purposes of this Section, all references in this Agreement to “Members” will be interpreted as referring to Medicare Members.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Payment_Methodology_Section_1.6: “Payment Methodology” means a methodology for determining Payment Rates in this attachment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Medicare_Benefit_Programs_Section_19: “Medicare Benefit Program(s)” are the program(s) providing services to Medicare Beneficiaries under a contract with CMS, authorized by the Balanced Budget Act of 1997 and the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement and Modernization Act of 2003, specifically a Medicare Advantage program under which BCBST or its wholly-owned Affiliate SecurityCare of Tennessee, Inc., is the payor for Covered Services provided to Medicare Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Downstream_Entity_Section_19.2.c: “Downstream Entity” means any party that enters into a written arrangement, acceptable to CMS, with persons or entities involved with the Medicare Advantage benefit, below the level of the arrangement between a Medicare Advantage Organization (or applicant) and a first tier entity. These written arrangements continue down to the level of the ultimate provider of both health and administrative services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_CMS_Section_19.2.b: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Beneficiary_Section_19.2.a: “Beneficiary” means an individual eligible to receive Medicare benefits.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Application_of_this_Section_Section_: Applicability of this Section.  The provisions of this Section apply to Provider's participation in BCBST's Medicare Advantage (“MA”) Networks. To the extent of a conflict between the terms of this Section and any other section of the Agreement, this Section will prevail with regard to the MA Networks.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_18.4_p3: Termination of Provider's participation in the Behavioral Health Network does not terminate this Agreement or participation in any other BCBST Network.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_18.4_p2: During the Behavioral Health Network Fixed Term, neither party may terminate Provider's participation in the Behavioral Health Network without cause pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision in this Agreement but may terminate Provider's participation pursuant to any other applicable termination provision of this Agreement. Either Party may terminate Provider's participation in the Behavioral Health Network effective after the Behavioral Health Network Fixed Term pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision or any other applicable termination provisions in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_18.4_p1: Term and Termination.  Provider's participation in the Behavioral Health Network will be effective through the Behavioral Health Network Fixed Term and, thereafter, will renew automatically unless and until terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.ASU_Payment_Rates_Section_1.6: “Payment Rate(s)” means Maximum Allowable as defined in the Billing and Reimbursement Guidelines section below.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_18.3_p3: BCBST will revise the Behavioral Health Network pursuant to the methods and time frames established in the Behavioral Health Network or in the applicable Provider Manual. In the event that a prior agreement established a different payment method, the date of service, or the admission date in the case of inpatient services, controls the payment method to be applied.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_18.3_p2: The Maximum Allowable set forth in the Behavioral Health Network will represent the maximum amount payable to Provider for Covered Services rendered to Behavioral Health Network Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_18.3_p1: Reimbursement.  For Covered Services provided to Behavioral Health Network Members, BCBST will pay Provider the Maximum Allowable in accordance with the attached Behavioral Health Network Attachment, which is incorporated by reference into this Agreement, at the time of service, less any applicable Member Obligation.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Participation_Section_18.2: Participation.  Provider agrees to participate in BCBST's Behavioral Health Network for the purpose of providing health care Covered Services to Behavioral Health Network Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_Behavioral_Health_Members_Se: “Behavioral Health Network Member(s)” means those BCBST Members whose health benefits are delivered through Network P, Network S, Network L, Network E, or any other BCBST Network that is not tied to a federal or state healthcare program (other than programs giving health benefits to current government employees) and whose benefits include coverage for behavioral health services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_Behavioral_Health_Fixed_Term: “Behavioral Health Network Fixed Term” means <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Title="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>3 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> beginning on the Effective Date.
MasterClauseData.BHABA_Professional_ABA_Services_Section_: Behavioral Health Professional ABA Services.  Payment for behavioral health professional ABA Covered Services is:
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_17.4_p3: Termination of Provider's participation in Network E does not terminate this Agreement or participation in any other BCBST Network.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_17.4_p2: During the Network E Fixed Term, neither party may terminate Provider's participation in Network E without cause pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision in this Agreement but may terminate Provider's participation pursuant to any other applicable termination provision of this Agreement. Either Party may terminate Provider's participation in Network E effective after the Network E Fixed Term pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision or any other applicable termination provisions in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_17.4_p1: Term and Termination.  Provider's participation in Network E will be effective through the Network E Fixed Term and, thereafter, will renew automatically unless and until terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_17.3_p3: BCBST will revise Network Attachment E pursuant to the methods and time frames established in Network Attachment E or in the applicable Provider Manual. In the event that a prior agreement established a different payment method, the date of service, or the admission date in the case of inpatient services, controls the payment method to be applied.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_17.3_p2: The Maximum Allowable set forth in Network Attachment E will represent the maximum amount payable to Provider for Covered Services rendered to Network E Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_17.3_p1: Reimbursement.  For Covered Services provided to Network E Members, BCBST will pay Provider the Maximum Allowable in accordance with the attached Network Attachment E, which is incorporated by reference into this Agreement, at the time of service, less any applicable Member Obligation.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Participation_Section_17.2: Participation.  Provider agrees to participate in BCBST's Blue Network E for the purpose of providing health care Covered Services to Network E Members.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_E_Members_Section_17.1.b: “Network E Member(s)” means those BCBST Members whose health benefits are delivered through BCBST's Blue Network E.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_E_Fixed_Term_Section_17.1.a: “Network E Fixed Term” means <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Title="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>3 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> beginning on the Effective Date.

Either Party may terminate Provider's participation in Network S effective after the Network S Fixed Term pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision or any other applicable termination provisions in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_16.4_p1: Term and Termination.  Provider's participation in Network S will be effective through the Network S Fixed Term and, thereafter, will renew automatically unless and until terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Participation_Section_16.2: Participation.  Provider agrees to participate in BCBST's Blue Network S for the purpose of providing health care Covered Services to Network S Members.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_S_Members_Section_16.1.b: “Network S Member(s)” means those BCBST Members whose health benefits are delivered through BCBST's Blue Network S.

Either Party may terminate Provider's participation in Network P effective after the Network P Fixed Term pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision or any other applicable termination provisions in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_15.4_p1: Term and Termination.  Provider's participation in Network P will be effective through the Network P Fixed Term and, thereafter, will renew automatically unless and until terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

In the event that a prior agreement established a different payment method, the date of service, or the admission date in the case of inpatient services, controls the payment method to be applied.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Participation_Section_15.2: Participation.  Provider agrees to participate in BCBST's Blue Network P for the purpose of providing health care Covered Services to Network P Members.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Short_Term_Stay_Section_1.22: “Short Term Stay” means an Inpatient Stay that is three days or less and reimbursed with the Short Term Stay Per Case payment in place of the DRG Base Rate payment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_P_Members_Section_15.1.b: “Network P Member(s)” means those BCBST Members whose health benefits are delivered through BCBST's Blue Network P.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_P_Fixed_Term_Section_15.1.a: “Network P Fixed Term” means <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Title="CPA_FixedTermPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>3 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> beginning on the Effective Date.
Data Collection.  Each section contains multiple measures, which are further described herein. Unless otherwise stated, all data will be collected from the Hospital Compare website. For all measures herein, BCBST uses the CMS Hospital Compare definitions and specifications in effect at the time of data submission. Measurement will be collected by BCBST using Hospital Compare data available as of the reporting date specified in the hospital's P4P Addendum. Where there are not at least two measures within a section with available data to score, BCBST reserves the right to redistribute the weight for that section proportionally (according to the weights) to the other sections. For hospitals participating in the P4P Program, additional information, including timelines and any provider-specific information, is detailed in an addendum to the hospital's BCBST Provider Agreement (“P4P Addendum”).
MasterClauseData.CPA_Scoring_Section_14.6.h._p6: Patient and Caregiver-Centered Experience of Care/Care Coordination (10%)
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_HCPCS_Code_Section_1.5: “HCPCS Code” means Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System based on the AMA's Current Procedural Technology (“CPT®”) and updated by CMS.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_CMS_Section_1.3: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Scoring_Section_14.6.h._p1: Scoring.  The P4P Program is divided into three sections, with scoring weighted as follows:
MasterClauseData.CPA_Substitution_of_Quality_Measures_Sec: Substitution of Quality Measures.  The Parties recognize that the Quality Measures are all based on programs created and administered by third parties. On an annual basis, BCBST will evaluate the Quality Measures to ensure that the Quality Measures are still aligned with VBP and will provide written notice to Provider of changes to Quality Measures due to changes to VBP, which notice may be through a change to the Program Guide. In the event that any Quality Measure is no longer available or is no longer part of VBP, BCBST will, upon notice to Provider and in BCBST's reasonable discretion, substitute a different Quality Measure from those in use by VBP at that time, which will become a standard part of the P4P Program.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Relationship_to_ValueBased_Purchasin: Relationship to Value-Based Purchasing Program.  While the P4P Program does not apply to Provider's participation in Medicare Advantage networks, it is the Parties' intent that the Quality Measures in the P4P Program will be aligned with those in VBP. Each Quality Measure has been adopted by CMS as part of VBP; however, BCBST is under no obligation to adopt any particular portion of VBP as a Quality Measure. In the event that CMS discontinues VBP, BCBST will, upon notice to Provider and in BCBST's reasonable discretion, implement a substitute quality program that will apply to all hospitals that participate in the P4P Program and that will be based on objective, third-party measures. BCBST will use commercially reasonable efforts to select a substitute program that is similar in form and intent to VBP.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Effect_on_Reimbursement_Section_14.6: If Provider reaches the maximum score under the P4P Program for the escalator to be implemented on June 1, 2020, Provider will receive an additional <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncrease" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncrease" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>1%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> escalator on June 1, <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncreaseeYear" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncreaseeYear" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XX<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>.

On June 1 in each of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncreaseeYear" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncreaseeYear" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XX<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> and <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncreaseeYear" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncreaseeYear" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XX<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>, all facilities under this Agreement will be eligible for an escalator of up to <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncrease" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncrease" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>four percent (4%)<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> based on performance under the P4P Program.
On [Insert Date], all facilities under this Agreement will be eligible for an escalator of up to three percent (3%) based on performance under the P4P Program.

On <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceReimbursementEffectiveDate" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceReimbursementEffectiveDate" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XX<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>, all facilities under this Agreement, with the exception of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceFacilityExceptions" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceFacilityExceptions" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XX<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>, will be eligible for an escalator of up to <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncrease" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncrease" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>two percent (2%)<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> based on performance under the P4P Program.
Effect on Reimbursement.  In addition to any fixed escalators agreed to by the Parties, Provider will be eligible to earn escalators based on its performance in the P4P Program as follows:
Aggregation of Measures.  Tennessee owned facilities will be measured in aggregate and will receive the same escalator.
Reporting Date.  The Reporting Date will be from January 1st through December 31st for each year that Provider participates in the P4P Program. For each Quality Measure, BCBST will collect the data that is available from the appropriate source as of the Reporting Date for use in calculating Provider's score under the P4P Program or otherwise described in this attachment. Parties agree to meet in good faith to discuss and/or resolve any reconciliation of data issues before rates are adjusted. If the parties are unable to resolve any reconciliation issues, then the parties will follow the dispute resolution provisions as set forth in Section 7 of the Agreement.
P4P Program Guide.  Unless otherwise stated herein, the P4P Program Guide contains the Quality Measures and scoring information for the P4P Program. The P4P Program Guide is hereby incorporated by reference in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.6.a._p5: “Value-Based Purchasing Program” or “VBP” means a Centers of Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) initiative that provides quality-based incentive payments to hospitals.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.6.a._p4: “Reporting Date” means the date on which Quality Measure data must be available in order to be included in the scoring for P4P.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.6.a._p3: “Quality Measure” means an objective measurement of hospital quality that is used to score the P4P Program. The Quality Measures are described in the P4P Program Guide are divided into three categories: Patient Safety, Clinical Care, and Patient Experience of Clinical Care.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.6.a._p2: “P4P Program Guide” means the program document titled “BlueCross BlueShield of Tennessee Hospital Pay-for-Performance Program Guide” that provides information on the P4P Program which is attached as an addendum to the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.6.a._p1: Definitions.  The following additional terms are defined for the purposes of this Section:
Verification.  Verification of the rate provisions set forth in this section shall be made annually utilizing mutually agreed upon procedures through an independent third party mutually agreed upon by the Parties.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable. The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BCE_Maximum_Allowable" Title="BCE_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
Compliance.  Provider shall work in good faith to take appropriate actions regarding its contracts with other Carriers to ensure that rates therein are in compliance with this section. If BCBST's rates are not Competitive Rates by January 1, 2016 Institution agrees to amend its rates with BCBST such that BCBST receives Competitive Rates.
Deletion.  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, BCBST, in its sole discretion, may amend this Agreement or the New Agreement to delete this section in its entirety with regard to any affected network upon written notice to Provider of such amendment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Competitive_Rate_Participation_Secti: Competitive Rate Participation.  Provider agrees that, during the Initial Term, its facilities' participation in Network S and Network P shall be at Competitive Rates. Furthermore, throughout the Initial Partnership Term, Provider agrees that it will not enter into any new agreements, or amend existing agreements, with any Carrier where such agreement would prevent BCBST from receiving Competitive Rates for one of these business segments unless Provider shall first notify BCBST prior to entering into such agreement or amendment, and BCBST shall have the opportunity to receive the same benefit as the new agreement or amendment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.5.a._p4: “New Entrant” means an insurance carrier that covers less than 5% of the covered lives for a particular business segment (e.g., ASO, fully-insured) in the GSA and has been licensed to sell health insurance products in the State of Tennessee for less than 3 years. New Entrants shall not include insurance carriers that are owned, controlled by, or under common ownership or control with any Carrier that does not fit within this definition.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.5.a._p3: “Carrier” means any insurer, producer, third-party administrator, HMO, hospital medical service corporation, etc. selling in the State of Tennessee. As used herein, “Carrier” shall not include: (i) self-pay patients; (ii) any Federal health care program, as defined at 42 U.S.C. § 1320a-7b(f); and (iii) any New Entrants (defined below) operating within the GSA; provided, however, that New Entrants may be reassessed every year and included in the definition of “Carrier” if at any time they no longer meet both criteria of the definition of New Entrant.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.5.a._p2: “Competitive Rates” means the reimbursement rates paid by BCBST in effect on the Effective Date or at any time during the Initial Partnership Term, that are no more than zero to three percent (0-3%) higher than the lowest rates Provider accepts on an aggregate, allowable basis for comparable networks from any other Carrier (defined below) with whom Provider contracts.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.5.a._p1: Definitions. The following additional terms are defined for the purposes of this Section:
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reprocessing_Claims_Section_14.4: Reprocessing Claims.  If any Network participation start date as set forth in this Agreement is prior to the Effective Date of the Agreement, the Parties agree that BCBST will reprocess all claims with dates of service on or after the Network participation start date in accordance with the most current rates in the corresponding Network Attachment that are part of this Agreement. If Provider has signed a new agreement with BCBST and claims are received prior to the new agreement being loaded into the BCBST system for processing, BCBST will reprocess those claims received using the new payment terms from the effective date of the new agreement.
MasterClauseData.SNF_Exclusions_Section_3.2_p4: Services for which payment is included in payments to Provider, which are the same payments included in PPS payments under original Medicare.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Third_Party_Acts_and_Omissions_Secti: Third Party. If, after good faith negotiations, the Parties cannot agree what the appropriate fee schedule adjustment should be, they shall mutually select an independent third party experienced in health care analytics to review an expanded sample of records and determine what adjustment should be made in the TRNM Amendment. The Parties further agree that the cost of any independent audit only will be split equally by both Parties. Each Party shall be solely responsible for their own costs and attorneys' fees associated with the independent audit.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Services_Rendered_by_NonPhysician_P: Services Rendered by Non-Physician Practitioners.  Compensation shall be paid only to those non-physician practitioners that are authorized under Original Medicare to provide services to Medicare beneficiaries. To the extent that the rendering practitioner is a non-physician (e.g. CRNA, NP, PA, Ph.D., MA, etc.), payment shall be adjusted by that percentage currently published and used by CMS to adjust Medicare payments for non-physician practitioners.
MasterClauseData.SNF_Exclusions_Section_3.2_p3: Services provided while the Member was not a resident in the Medicare-certified SNF part of Provider and swing-bed services; and/or
Implementation. The implementation of the rates in the TRNM Amendment shall occur no sooner than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_ImplementationNoSoonerThan" Title="CPA_ImplementationNoSoonerThan" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>thirty (30) days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> and no later than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_ImplementationNoLaterThan" Title="CPA_ImplementationNoLaterThan" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>sixty (60) days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> after the Parties have executed the TRNM Amendment.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_PNL_with_Relative_Values_Not_Establ: Procedures Not Listed and/or with Relative Values Not Established.  Services not covered by Original Medicare, but are covered by BCBST, will be reimbursed on a reasonable allowable as determined by BCBST.
Adjustments. The TRNM Amendment shall include such rate adjustments as are necessary to provide TRNM transition related budget neutrality (the “TRNM Budget Neutral Adjustments”) but shall not provide budget neutrality for any other reason, such as case mix or volume changes, easonal adjustments, additional facility acquisitions or employer group changes. In addition to the TRNM Budget Neutral Adjustments, the TRNM Amendment shall include a further temporary adjustment to neutralize the effect of TRNM transition not being neutral from the Transition Date until the date the TRNM Budget Neutral Adjustments are implemented.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Provider_Assessment_Forms_Section_3: BCBST agrees to pay Provider for PAFs at the rate set forth in the Provider Manual in Year One. Thereafter, BCBST may discontinue or change its use of and payment for PAFs. Notice of such discontinuation or change will be published in BCBST's Blue Alert newsletter and updated in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Surgery_Group_Section_1.5: “Outpatient Surgery Group” means the group to which an outpatient surgical procedure code is assigned based on expected use of resources. This does not include any outpatient surgical procedures specifically carved out in this attachment.
MasterClauseData.SNF_Exclusions_Section_3.2_p2: Services not covered by CMS under Original Medicare under the Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF) Prospective Payment System (PPS), including but not limited to physician and other professional services, renal dialysis, and hospital services;
Notice. If either Party believes that TNRM transition has not been Budget Neutral, it shall notify the other Party no sooner than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_NoticeNoSoonerThan" Title="CPA_NoticeNoSoonerThan" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>twelve (12) months<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> and no later than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_NoticeNoLaterThan" Title="CPA_NoticeNoLaterThan" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>eighteen (18) months<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> after the Transition Date. The Parties shall work together in good faith to determine the financial impact of TRNM transition, and, if they agree the transition has not been Budget Neutral, shall make a one-time amendment (“TRNM Amendment”) to the affected Network Attachments for the sole purpose of adjusting the fees associated with the affected Networks to ensure budget neutrality on a going-forward basis. No retroactive claim adjustments will occur solely as a result of the TRNM Amendment. Without limiting the foregoing, good faith shall require the notifying Party to disclose to the other Party the data and process it used to determine that TRNM transition was not Budget Neutral.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Provider_Assessment_Forms_Section_3: Provider Assessment Forms.  BCBST will pay Provider a one-time per Member per year fee for each Member for whom Provider completes and submits BCBST's PAF. The current fee for PAFs is set forth in the current Provider Manual. In order to receive payment for submission of the PAF, the Provider must also submit a claim with E&M code 96161.
MasterClauseData.SNF_Exclusions_Section_3.2_p1: Exclusions.  The following are specifically excluded from payment under this Attachment:
Difference. The Parties agree that Budget Neutrality will be achieved if the difference between (a) and (b) is within a range of plus or minus <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_BudgetNeutralAggregateRange" Title="CPA_BudgetNeutralAggregateRange" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000.00)<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> in aggregate across all acute care facilities as set forth on Exhibit 1A contracted under this Agreement for both Network P and Network S combined as of the Transition Date.

The amendment replacing Table 2 will be provided no later than April 1st of the previous contract year.

MasterClauseData.DME_Enteral_Formulae_and_Supplies_Sectio: The established fee for enteral formulae and supplies is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="DME_Enteral_Formulae_and_Supplies_Percentage" Title="DME_Enteral_Formulae_and_Supplies_Percentage" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>75%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the DMEPOS Schedule as set forth in the Fee source section of this Attachment.

MasterClauseData.SNF_Skilled_Nursing_Facility_Services_Se: Skilled Nursing Facility Services.   Payment for skilled nursing facility Covered Services is:
MasterClauseData.ACA_Separtely_Reimbursed_Drug_Fee_Schedu: Drug codes submitted for consideration, but not shown on the Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule are not eligible for payment and will be denied as non-contracted.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Primary_Care_QIP_Services_Section_3: Provider may earn the medical record upload bonus by providing 95% of all medical records requested by BCBST.
MasterClauseData.BHABA_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4_p2: The CPT® Codes eligible for reimbursement under this Attachment are those listed in the attached Schedule 1A Applied Behavioral Analysis Fee Schedule.  BCBST will assign a reasonable fee to new or revised codes.  Provider may periodically request an updated version of Schedule 1A.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Separately_Reimbursed_Drug_Fee_Sched: Drug codes submitted for consideration, but not shown on the Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule are not eligible for payment and will be denied as non-contracted.
MasterClauseData.SCE_Exclusions_Section_3.2_p2: Services that are not covered by CMS under Original Medicare for sleep disorders.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Separtely_Reimbursed_Drug_Fee_Schedu: Drugs shown on the Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule and associated with Not Otherwise Classified ("NOC") or Unlisted/Miscellaneous/Non-Specific HCPCS Codes or with no established fee shown will be manually priced in accordance with BCBST's policy for Unlisted, Miscellaneous, Non-Specific and Not Otherwise Classified Procedures/Services, but may not be eligible for payment. Such drugs must be billed with a unit of one (1) and require submission of: (i) drug name; (ii) National Drug Code ("NDC") in field 43 "Revenue Description/ IDE/ Medicaid Drug Rebate" on the CMS-1450 claim form; and (iii) dosage administered. Failure to submit this information will result in delay of reimbursement.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Primary_Care_QIP_Services_Section_3: The amount of the quality escalator shall correspond to the Provider's Quality Rating in effect at the time of services, as shown in the table below. BCBST will determine Provider's Quality Rating based on all Members who are attributed to Provider for all BCBST Medicare Advantage Networks in which Provider participates (except for and excluding the BlueCare Plus MA HMO DSNP Network).
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_CPT_Code_Section_1.4: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.DME_Enteral_Formulae_and_Supplies_Sectio: The established fee for enteral formulae and supplies is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="DME_Enteral_Formulae_and_Supplies_Percentage" Title="DME_Enteral_Formulae_and_Supplies_Percentage" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Separately_Reimbursed_Drug_Fee_Sched: Drugs shown on the Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule and associated with Not Otherwise Classified (“NOC”) or Unlisted/Miscellaneous/Non-Specific HCPCS Codes or with no established fee shown will be manually priced in accordance with BCBST’s policy for Unlisted, Miscellaneous, Non-Specific and Not Otherwise Classified Procedures/Services, but may not be eligible for payment. Such drugs must be billed with a unit of one (1) and require submission of: (i) drug name; (ii) National Drug Code (“NDC”) in field 43 “Revenue Description/ IDE/ Medicaid Drug Rebate” on the CMS-1450 claim form; and (iii) dosage administered. Failure to submit this information will result in delay of reimbursement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Headings_Section_13.9: Headings.  The headings of articles and sections contained in this Agreement are for reference purposes only, will not be deemed to be a part of this Agreement for any purpose, and will not in any way define or affect the meaning, interpretation, construction, or scope of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.DME_Power_Wheelchair_Section_3.8_p5: BCBST rental rate = BCBST purchase rate/10 months
MasterClauseData.SCE_Exclusions_Section_3.2_p1: Exclusions.  The following are specifically excluded under this Attachment:
MasterClauseData.ACA_All_Other_Outpatient_Services_Sectio: All Other Outpatient Services. All other Outpatient Services are those services that cannot otherwise be appropriately categorized for reimbursement in this Schedule 2 and that are approved for reimbursement by BCBST. The Revenue Codes listed in the All Other Outpatient Services Section of the Provider Manual will be considered for reimbursement unless performed in connection with an all-inclusive service.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Primary_Care_QIP_Services_Section_3: Year Two and After Quality-Based Reimbursement.  Subject to the Billing and Reimbursement Guidelines section above and beginning April 1st of Year Two, payment for Covered Services provided to Members, with the exceptions of Clinical Laboratory Services and Durable Medical Equipment & Medical Supply Covered Services, shall consist of a base rate, quality escalator, and medical record upload bonus. Clinical Laboratory Covered Services shall continue to be reimbursed at <# <TrackedContent TrackName="PPCA_Year_Two_and_After_Lab_Percent" Title="PPCA_Year_Two_and_After_Lab_Percent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>52%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule. Durable Medical Equipment & Medical Supply Covered Services shall continue to be reimbursed at <# <TrackedContent TrackName="PPCA_Year_Two_and_After_DME_Percent" Title="PPCA_Year_Two_and_After_DME_Percent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>75%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule.
MasterClauseData.SNF_Skilled_Nursing_Facility_Services_Se: Skilled Nursing Facility Services.  Payment for skilled nursing facility Covered Services is:
MasterClauseData.CAC_Separately_Reimbursed_Drug_Fee_Sched: Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule.  BCBST will reimburse acute care hospitals for outpatient drugs listed in the Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule, in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for BCBST Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule contained in the Provider Manual. Eligible drugs will be reimbursed in addition to other outpatient services filed on the CMS-1450 (UB-04 or successor) claim form.
MasterClauseData.DME_Power_Wheelchair_Section_3.8_p4: BCBST purchase rate = Medicare purchase rate x 75 %
MasterClauseData.ACA_Services_under_the_BCBST_Base_Fee_Sc: Services under the BCBST Base Fee Schedules. Services listed in the BCBST Base Fee Schedule (2-G) are derived from the technical component of the Medicare RBRVS Fee Schedule in effect as of January 1, 2024. Updates and deletions of codes on the BCBST Base Fee Schedule will be made in accordance with BCBST policies and procedures related to the addition/deletion of CPT® Codes as found in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Primary_Care_QIP_Services_Section_3: Year One Fee-for-Service.  Subject to the Billing and Reimbursement Guidelines section above and for dates of service through March 31st of Year Two, the payment rate for Covered Services rendered to Member will be as set out in Table 1 below.
Written Amendments.  Except as otherwise provided in this Section, this Agreement, or any part, article, section, exhibit, or Network Attachment(s) hereto, may be amended, altered, or modified only in a writing duly executed by both Parties.
MasterClauseData.SCE_Sleep_Center_Services_Section_3.1ma_: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Payment_Hierarchy_Section_4.5_d: Payment Hierarchy. BCBST will adhere to the following payment hierarchy for outpatient Covered Services: (1) Per Case services (2) Per Visit services (3) all other. Except as otherwise set forth in this Attachment, BCBST will pay only the highest service type in the hierarchy. All other services are considered included in the highest ranked service.
If Provider notifies BCBST in writing within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_ProviderManualDeemerPeriod" Title="CPA_ProviderManualDeemerPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> after notice of the amendment that Provider does not accept the proposed amendment, such amendment will not take effect and BCBST will have the right to elect either (i) to have this Agreement remain in effect in accordance with its terms without the proposed amendment or (ii) to terminate this Agreement by giving written notice not less than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_ProviderManualTermNotice" Title="CPA_ProviderManualTermNotice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>15 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> prior to the effective date of termination.
MasterClauseData.CAU_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.DME_Power_Wheelchair_Section_3.8_p3: Published Medicare monthly rental rate x 3 months x 150% + Published Medicare monthly rental rate x 10 months x 60% = Medicare purchase rate

MasterClauseData.CAC_Payment_Hierarchy_Section_4.5_e: Payment Hierarchy. BCBST will adhere to the following payment hierarchy for outpatient Covered Services: (1) Per Case services, (2) Per Visit services, (3) all other. Except as otherwise set forth in this Attachment, BCBST will pay only the highest service in the hierarchy. All other services are considered included in the highest ranked service.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Emergency_Services_Section_4.5_c: Emergency Services. In instances where a Member is admitted into an inpatient setting after treatment in the emergency room within 72 hours for related conditions, separate payment will not be made for the Emergency Services, and payment for the Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Rate Table will also represent payment for the Emergency Services.
MasterClauseData.ASUM_Ambulatory_Surgery_Services_Section: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Primary_Care_QIP_Services_Section_3: Professional - Primary Care: QIP Services.  In order to better meet the needs of Members in MA plans and the expectations of CMS, BCBST is implementing a QIP applicable to primary care physician reimbursement. The QIP shall be phased in, beginning with a reporting period in Year One, with full implementation in Year Two. As further detailed herein, the QIP shall consist of quality-based reimbursement for Covered Services rendered to BlueAdvantage MA PPO Members utilizing the BlueAdvantage MA PPO Network for Year Two and beyond.
MasterClauseData.DME_Power_Wheelchair_Section_3.8_p2: Power wheelchairs follow the Medicare methodology for DME classified as power-driven wheelchairs which is based on a13-month rental period where the Medicare allowable for the first 3 months is at 150% and the Medicare allowable for the remaining 10 months is at 60%. Since BCBST considers DME purchased after the equipment has been rented for a period of 10 months, the published Medicare fees for power-driven wheelchairs will be adjusted as follows:

If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.CAC_All_Other_Outpatient_Services_Sectio: All Other Outpatient Services. All other Outpatient Services are those services that cannot otherwise be appropriately categorized for reimbursement in this Schedule 2 and that are approved for reimbursement by BCBST. The Revenue Codes listed in the Outpatient Payment Category Table will be considered for reimbursement unless performed in connection with an all-inclusive service.

MasterClauseData.ACA_Laboratory_and_Radiology_Services_Se: Laboratory and Radiology Services. The fee schedules (2-B, 2-C, 2D) referenced in this section are derived from the technical component of the Medicare RBRVS and the Medicare Clinical Laboratory Fee Schedule in effect as of January 1, 2024. Updates and deletions of codes will be in accordance with BCBST policies and procedures related to the addition/deletion of CPT® Codes as found in the Provider Manual. Codes in these categories that are not listed on the fee schedules are considered not contracted and are not reimbursable.
“Buprenorphine Medication Assisted Treatment (BMAT) Program Description” refers to the BCBST guidance document, which by this reference is incorporated herein, and is also available at www.bcbst.com.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Primary_Care_QIP_Services_Section_3: Pharmacy Claims.  Members who have had no medical claims in the previous two-year period but have had pharmacy claims for which Provider was the prescribing provider.

MasterClauseData.ACA_Observation_Services_Section_4.5_a: Observation Services. Provider must obtain Prior Authorization in order to receive payment for Observation Services. In instances where a Member is admitted into an inpatient setting from observation status within 72 hours for related conditions, separate payment will not be made for the Observation Services, and payment for the Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Rate Table will also represent payment for the Observation Services.
MasterClauseData.SCE_Sleep_Center_Services_Section_3.1_p3: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation, all services, equipment, and/or supplies, used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Primary_Care_QIP_Services_Section_3: Medical Claims.  Members for whom Provider has submitted more medical claims than any other primary care provider over the previous two-year period. In the event that Provider and another provider have submitted an equal number of medical claims for a Member, which is more than any other primary care provider, BCBST shall attribute the Member to Provider in those instances where Provider has submitted the most recent medical claim.
MasterClauseData.SNF_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p2: BCBST will not conduct any settlement or retroactive pricing or payment adjustments with Provider based on any changes, rebasing, adjustments, or outcomes of appeals related to any of Provider's Medicare cost reports that impact or would have impacted the rates set by CMS for Provider.

MasterClauseData.PPCA_Primary_Care_QIP_Services_Section_3: Member Selection.  Members who have indicated to BCBST that Provider is their primary care practice.
MasterClauseData.DME_Labor_Section_3.7: Labor. The established fee for labor Covered Services is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="DME_Labor_Services_Percentage" Title="DME_Labor_Services_Percentage" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>75%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the DMEPOS Schedule as set forth in the Fee source section of this Attachment.
MasterClauseData.SNF_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p1: Rate Updates.  Rates under the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule are equivalent to amounts that would have been payable under Original Medicare to Provider for the same services; provided however, that BCBST updates the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule in the timeframes described in the Provider Manual. No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS's release of a rate and BCBST's implementation of such rate in accordance with the Provider Manual or due to CMS's retroactive implementation of an amended rate.
MasterClauseData.SCE_Sleep_Center_Services_Section_3.1_p2: <# <TrackedContent TrackName="SCE_Percent_Reimbursement_BCBST_Base_Sleep_Center_Fee_Schedule" Title="SCE_Percent_Reimbursement_BCBST_Base_Sleep_Center_Fee_Schedule" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Base Sleep Study Fee Schedule, which is attached as Schedule 1 to this Attachment. BCBST implements updates to the Base Sleep Study Fee Schedule on April 1 of each year, based on the reimbursement in use by Medicare for like services as of January 1. Services provided between January 1 and March 31 will be reimbursed based on the previous year's Medicare reimbursement. Codes that are not listed in the BCBST Base Sleep Study Fee Schedule are not reimbursable when billed with Provider's sleep center provider identification number or NPI.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Incorporation_of_Certain_Changes_Sec: Incorporation of Certain Changes.  The removal of a Network Provider from a Network, or a change (i) to a Blue Cross Benefit Plan, (ii) to BCBST policies or procedures, or (iii) required by state or federal laws and regulations, will be automatically incorporated herein to the extent the services rendered by Provider pursuant to this Agreement are affected by such removal or change.
Reimbursement for repairs, adjustments, replacements, routine periodic servicing (e.g. testing, cleaning, and checking), and maintenance including that which is necessary under manufacturer's recommendations or for the construction of prosthetics and prosthetic components, including labor, will be determined by the Medicare Region C DMERC guidelines.

MasterClauseData.UCH_Urgent_Care_at_Home_Services_Section: BCBST will have the right to audit claims. If Provider treats the <# <Content Select="//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Network_Name" optional="true"/> #> Member at home and the <# <Content Select="//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Network_Name" optional="true"/> #> Member has an emergency room visit for the same or similar diagnosis on the same day or next day that Provider treated the <# <Content Select="//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Network_Name" optional="true"/> #> Member at home, BCBST will have the right to recoup any payments paid to Provider in accordance with the Agreement, after peer-to-peer review and discussion of the case with Provider.

MasterClauseData.CAC_Laboratory_and_Radiology_Services_Se: Laboratory and Radiology Services. The fee schedules (2-B, 2-C, 2-D) referenced in this section are derived from the technical component of the Medicare RBRVS and the Medicare Clinical Laboratory Fee Schedule in effect as of January 1, 2024. Updates and deletions of codes will be in accordance with BCBST policies and procedures related to the addition/deletion of CPT® Codes as found in the Provider Manual. Codes in these categories that are not listed on the fee schedules are considered not contracted and are not reimbursable.
Prosthetics and Orthotics. The established fee for items classified as Prosthetics and Orthotics Covered Services is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="DME_Prosthetics_and_Orthotics_Percentage" Title="DME_Prosthetics_and_Orthotics_Percentage" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>75%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the DMEPOS Schedule as set forth in the Fee source section of this Attachment.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: When multiple surgical procedures are performed on the same day, the payment for the first procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACA_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Title="ACA_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment, the payment for the second procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACA_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Title="ACA_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>50%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment and the payment for the third procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACA_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Title="ACA_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>50%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment. No additional payments will be made for procedures beyond the third procedure. When a procedure is repeated on the same day there will be no additional payment for the second procedure. Bilateral procedures will be paid in accordance with the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Implantss_Section_1.10: “Implant(s)” means a Surgical Implant or a Surgical Appliance.
Blue Cross Benefit Plans.  BCBST retains the right to change, revise, modify, or alter the terms of any Blue Cross Benefit Plan issued or administered by BCBST without prior approval or notice to Provider.

MasterClauseData.UCH_Urgent_Care_at_Home_Services_Section: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or of supplies, used in conjunction with the services. Only one claim and code submitted for Urgent Care at Home Covered Services will be paid per Member per day. The Provider is only contracted for the specific codes as set forth in the table above. Any additions to the table will require a written amendment signed by the Parties.
MasterClauseData.MABH_Services_Rendered_by_NonPhysician_P: Services Rendered by Non-Physician Practitioners. Compensation shall be paid only to those non-physician practitioners that are authorized under Original Medicare to provide services to Medicare beneficiaries. Payment shall be adjusted by that percentage currently published and used by CMS to adjust Medicare payments for non-physician practitioners.

If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Observation_Services_Section_4.5_a: Observation Services. Provider must obtain Prior Authorization in order to receive payment for Observation Services. In instances where a Member is admitted into an inpatient setting from observation status within 72 hours for related conditions, separate payment will not be made for the Observation Services, and payment for the Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Rate Table will also represent payment for the Observation Services.
MasterClauseData.SNF_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_p: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
Prosthetics and Orthotics. The established fee for items classified as Prosthetics and Orthotics Covered Services is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="DME_Prosthetics_and_Orthotics_Percentage" Title="DME_Prosthetics_and_Orthotics_Percentage" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule.
Provider Manual. The terms and conditions of the Provider Manual are incorporated into, and made a part of, this Agreement by this reference. Unless expressly stated otherwise, if a conflict arises between this Agreement and the Provider Manual, the terms and conditions of the Provider Manual will prevail. BCBST retains the right to change, revise, modify, or alter the terms of the Provider Manual upon at least 30 days' prior written notice to Provider unless a longer notice period is required by law.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: When multiple surgical procedures are performed on the same day, the payment for the first procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAC_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Title="CAC_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #><# <Conditional Test="//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Critical Access']" /> #>100%<# <EndConditional/> #><# <Conditional Test="not(//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Critical Access'])" /> #>100%<# <EndConditional/> #><# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment, the payment for the second procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAC_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Title="CAC_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #><# <Conditional Test="//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Critical Access']" /> #>50%<# <EndConditional/> #><# <Conditional Test="not(//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Critical Access'])" /> #>50%<# <EndConditional/> #><# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment and the payment for the third procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAC_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Title="CAC_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #><# <Conditional Test="//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Critical Access']" /> #>0%<# <EndConditional/> #><# <Conditional Test="not(//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Critical Access'])" /> #>25%<# <EndConditional/> #><# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment. No additional payments will be made for procedures beyond the third procedure. When a procedure is repeated on the same day there will be no additional payment for the second procedure. Bilateral procedures will be paid in accordance with the Provider Manual.

MasterClauseData.ACA_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: Surgical Covered Services that are paid with the Outpatient Surgery Groups but that have not yet been assigned an Outpatient Surgery Group will appear on the Schedule 1-A and pay at the “Unlisted” rate until the annual recalibration process referenced in the Billing and Reimbursement Section of the Provider Manual, at which time the code will be moved to the appropriate Outpatient Surgery Group. These new assignments will automatically be made a part of Schedule 2-A without any formal amendments thereto.

MasterClauseData.UCH_Escalator_Section_2.6: Escalator.  Provider will receive a one-time 3% increase on the Rate listed in the table below on the one-year (first) Anniversary Date of the Agreement. Any additional escalator in subsequent years will require an amendment signed by the parties.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Entire_Agreement_Section_13.7: Entire Agreement.  This Agreement, together with the applicable Provider Manual, other manuals provided to Provider via the BCBST website or in hard copy format, and exhibits, schedules, and attachments, constitutes the entire Agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements and undertakings, whether oral or written. In the event that an earlier executed agreement exists between the Parties regarding Provider's participation in the Networks included in this Agreement for the items and services eligible for payment under this Agreement, this Agreement will supersede such earlier agreement with regard to such Networks and such items and services as of the first day of the Fixed Term, or, if different, the first day of the Network-specific Fixed Term. This Agreement will remain in full force and effect with respect to all Members, unless otherwise expressly stated.

MasterClauseData.PPCA_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p1: Rate Updates.  Rates under the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule are equivalent to amounts that would have been payable under Original Medicare for the same services; provided, however, that BCBST updates the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule in the timeframes described in the Provider Manual. No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS's release of a rate and BCBST's implementation of such rate in accordance with the Provider Manual or due to CMS's retroactive implementation of an amended rate.

MasterClauseData.DME_Rentals_Section_3.3_p3: DME that is classified by CMS as a capped rental will be considered purchased after the equipment has been rented for a period of 10 months. If the Member changes to different but similar piece of equipment or DME (e.g. from a non-heated humidifier to a heated humidifier) when the equipment is medically needed (i.e. the Member's medical needs have substantially changed and the new equipment is necessary), a new 10-month rental period begins with the new equipment or DME. Otherwise, BCBST will reimburse the least expensive piece of equipment or DME (continuing to count against the current 10-month period). If the 10-month rental period has already expired, then no additional rental payments will be made.

MasterClauseData.IOBH_Observation_Services_Section_3.5: Observation Services. Provider must obtain Prior Authorization in order to receive payment for Observation Services. In instances where a Member is admitted directly from observation status, separate payment will not be made for the Observation Services, and payment for inpatient behavioral health Covered Services in accordance with this Attachment will also represent payment for the Observation Services. Observation Service rates shown in this section are all-inclusive and will fully compensate Provider for all Covered Services provided in association with Observation Services.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Subcontracting_Section_13.3: Subcontracting.  Provider will not subcontract this Agreement, or any portion of this Agreement, without the prior written consent of BCBST, which consent may be withheld by BCBST for any reason. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, BCBST may subcontract any administrative function as it relates to this Agreement to any organization it so designates. In addition, in the absence of a separate agreement with any entity referenced in this section, the terms of this Agreement or any Network Attachment(s) will be applicable to any services provided to individuals covered under healthcare plans insured or administered by any entity or its Affiliates that is licensed by the BCBSA to use the BCBS Marks.

MasterClauseData.ACA_Adjustments_Section_3.4: Adjustments. While this Attachment is in place, the DRG relative weights outlined in Schedule 1-A will remain fixed. BCBST will adjust only Schedule 1-A, for additions, deletions and replacement of DRGs based on yearly CMS updates, which will be implemented in accordance with the Billing and Reimbursement-General Billing Information Section of the Provider Manual. Replacement of a DRG will occur when CMS retains the category number for a DRG while replacing the description related to that DRG.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Expansion_Section_13.2: Expansion.  Provider may add services, other Associated Providers, additional locations, change billing practices, or they may acquire or be acquired by, merge with, or otherwise become affiliated with another provider of health care services (Expansion).  If BCBST reasonably determines that any Expansion has or will have a detrimental financial impact to BCBST, the Parties agree to meet in good faith regarding such change within 90 days of a request by BCBST.  The purpose of such meeting will be to discuss the Expansion and negotiate in good faith to revise the rates under this Agreement to account for the detrimental financial impact to BCBST.  If the parties do not agree to revised rates within 60 days of the meeting described herein, BCBST may at its discretion terminate the Agreement with <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_ExpansionDaysNotice" Title="CPA_ExpansionDaysNotice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>60 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> days prior notice.

New Quality Ratings are effective on April 1 of each year, beginning in Year Two (as defined herein).

The list of Performance Measures is set out in the Provider Manual and is subject to change in subsequent calendar years upon written notice from BCBST through amendment to this Addendum, publication in the Provider Manual, and/or publication in a BCBST BlueAlert.
