Unforeseen Circumstances.  In the event that Provider's operations are interrupted by acts of war, fire, terrorism, insurrection, labor disputes, riots, earthquakes, or other acts of nature beyond its reasonable control, Provider will be relieved of its obligation to perform any services that are affected, such that it could not render quality healthcare to any Member.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Member_Experience_Section_1.2_p1: “Member Experience: CAHPS” means those individual member experience measures identified as: Getting Appointments and Care Quickly, and Care Coordination.
MasterClauseData.ORE_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_m: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.HITMA_Services_Section_4.1: Services.  The specific home infusion therapy Covered Services provided by Provider are indicated in the attached Exhibit A - Home Infusion Therapy Services, which is incorporated herein by reference.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Inpatient_Rehabilitation_Services_Se: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.ODI_Revenue_Code_Section_1.3: “Revenue Code” means a hospital Revenue Code as adopted by CMS.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Payment_Policies_Section_: All Other Outpatient Services. All other Outpatient Services are those services that cannot otherwise be appropriately categorized for reimbursement in this Schedule 2 and that are approved for reimbursement by BCBST. The Revenue Codes listed in the Outpatient Payment Category Table will be considered for reimbursement unless performed in connection with an all-inclusive service.
MasterClauseData.SNF_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.IRL_Indepent_Laboratory_Services_Section: The lesser of billed charges or <# <TrackedContent TrackName="IRL_Percent_of_BCBST_Base_Independent_Laboratory_Fee_Schedule" Title="IRL_Percent_of_BCBST_Base_Independent_Laboratory_Fee_Schedule" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>52%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the amount indicated in the BCBST Base Independent Laboratory Fee Schedule.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Definitions_Section_1.1s: The following terms are defined for the purposes of this Attachment. All other capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.BFS_Reimbursement_Policy_p3: Presence of a fee is not a guarantee the service will be eligible for reimbursement. Final reimbursement determinations include, but are not limited to, Member eligibility on the date of service, Medical Necessity, Medical Appropriateness, applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, benefit plan exclusions/limitations, authorization/referral requirement, and applicable medical policies and guidelines.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Other_Payment_Policies_Section_3.2_e: Other Payment Policies. For information on BCBST's DRG payment policies, including but not limited to mother and newborn payments, ungroupable DRGs, pre-admission services, private room differentials, kidney transplants, and conditions present on admission, refer to the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Against_Medical_Advice_Discharges_Se: Against Medical Advice Discharges. Inpatient Stays during which the Member left the Provider against medical advice will be reimbursable as referenced in the Inpatient Stay Payment Category Table or an Outlier payment, whichever is applicable.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Survival_Section_11.9_prov: Survival.  It is the express intention and agreement of the Parties that “Disputes”, “Payment Dispute Resolution”, “Reimbursement”, “Overpayments or Underpayments”, “Subrogation and Right to Recover”, “Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits”, “Resolution of Disputes”,  “Records, Access, Inspection and Confidentiality”, “Liability and Indemnification”, “Effects of Termination”, “Cooperation Upon Termination”, “No Interference”, and “Non-Disparagement” provisions in this Agreement and all other sections which by their terms are intended to survive termination, or which are necessary for the resolution of all matters unresolved, will survive any termination of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.DME_Capped_Rentals_Section_3.3_ma_p1: Capped Rentals. The established fee for DME classified as capped rental (including manual wheelchairs), inexpensive/routinely purchased, TENS and enteral nutrition infusion pumps (i.e., purchase and rentals) is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="DME_Capped_Rentals" Title="DME_Capped_Rentals" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule.
MasterClauseData.OTB_Use_Of_Codes_Section_2.5: Use of Codes.  The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.BHABA_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BHABA_Billing_Requirements" Title="BHABA_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1500 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.ORE_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Payment_Policies_Section_: Emergency Services. In instances where a Member is admitted into an inpatient setting after treatment in the emergency room within 72 hours for related conditions, separate payment will not be made for the Emergency Services, and payment for the Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Rate Table will also represent payment for the Emergency Services.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Inpatient_Rehabilitation_Services_Se: <# <TrackedContent TrackName="IPE_Percent_of_BCBST_Medicare_Fee_Schedule" Title="IPE_Percent_of_BCBST_Medicare_Fee_Schedule" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule
MasterClauseData.DIA_Exclusions_Section_3.2_p1: Exclusions. The following are specifically excluded from payment under this Attachment:
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Inpatient_Behavioral_Health_Service: Inpatient Behavioral Health Services. Payment for inpatient behavioral health Covered Services is the appropriate Per Diem listed below:
MasterClauseData.ACAM_Exclusions_Section_3.2: Exclusions.  The following are specifically excluded from payment under this Attachment:
MasterClauseData.ACA_Against_Medical_Advice_Discharges_Se: Against Medical Advice Discharges. Inpatient Stays during which the Member left the Provider against medical advice will be reimbursable as referenced in the Inpatient Stay Payment Category Table or an Outlier payment, whichever is applicable.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.MABH_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable. The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="MABH_Maximum_Allowable" Title="MABH_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.ASUM_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p2: BCBST will not conduct any settlement or retroactive pricing or payment adjustments with Provider based on any changes, rebasing, adjustments, or outcomes of appeals related to any of Provider's Medicare cost reports that impact or would have impacted the rates set by CMS for Provider.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Survival_Section_11.9_prof: Survival.  It is the express intention and agreement of the Parties that “Disputes”, “Payment Dispute Resolution”, “Reimbursement”, “Overpayments or Underpayments”, “Subrogation and Right to Recover”, “Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits”, “Resolution of Disputes”,  “Records, Access, Inspection and Confidentiality”, “Liability and Indemnification”, “Effects of Termination”, “Termination or Exclusion of Associated Providers”, “Cooperation Upon Termination”, “No Interference”, and “Non-Disparagement” provisions in this Agreement and all other sections which by their terms are intended to survive termination, or which are necessary for the resolution of all matters unresolved, will survive any termination of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.DME_Continuous_Rentals_Section_3.2_ma: Continuous Rentals. The established fee for DME classified as frequent/substantial servicing (i.e. continuous rentals) is 100% of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule.
MasterClauseData.HITMA_Injectables_Drugs_Section_3.3_p3: Reimbursement for medications is limited to that amount actually prescribed and administered to the Member. Provider is responsible for using the most economical packaging of medication to achieve the required dosage for the Member with the least amount of medication wastage.
MasterClauseData.OTB_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p2: BCBST will not conduct any settlement or retroactive pricing or payment adjustments with Provider based on any changes, rebasing, adjustments, or outcomes of appeals related to any of Provider's rates set by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Expired_Patients_Section_3.2_c: Expired Patients. An Inpatient Stay during which the Member expires will be treated as a normal discharge and reimbursable as referenced in the Inpatient Stay Payment Category Table or an Outlier payment, whichever is applicable.
MasterClauseData.IRL_Indepent_Laboratory_Services_Section: Independent Laboratory Services. Payment for independent laboratory services is:
MasterClauseData.ACA_Expired_Patients_Section_3.2_c: Expired Patients. An Inpatient Stay during which the Member expires will be treated as a normal discharge and reimbursable as referenced in the Inpatient Stay Payment Category Table or an Outlier payment, whichever is applicable.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Inpatient_Rehabilitation_Services_Se: Inpatient Rehabilitation Services. Payment for inpatient rehabilitation Covered Services is:
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Payment_Policies_Section_: Laboratory and Radiology Services. The fee schedules (2-B, 2-C, 2D) referenced in this section are derived from the technical component of the Medicare RBRVS and the Medicare Clinical Laboratory Fee Schedule in effect as of January 1, 2024. Updates and deletions of codes will be in accordance with BCBST policies and procedures related to the addition/deletion of CPT® Codes as found in the Provider Manual. Codes in these categories that are not listed on the fee schedules are considered not contracted and are not reimbursable.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use of Codes. The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.ORE_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ORE_Billing_Requirements" Title="ORE_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1450 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Cooperation_Upon_Termination_No_Inte: Cooperation Upon Termination; No Interference; Non-Disparagement.  The Parties agree to cooperate with each other to resolve promptly any outstanding financial, administrative, or patient care issues upon the termination of this Agreement. The Parties further agree to work together in good faith to provide timely and appropriate notice to Members of the anticipated termination date of this Agreement. Provider agrees to assist Members who are under the care of Provider or who have scheduled Covered Services to be provided after the anticipated termination date, in transitioning to another Network Provider. Provider further agrees to promptly supply all records and documents necessary for the settlement of outstanding claims for Covered Services upon the termination of the Agreement. Provider also agrees to refrain in every instance from interfering with the contractual relationship between BCBST and its Members or to discourage any person from doing business with BCBST. Finally, both Parties agree not to make any statements, written or verbal, or cause or encourage others to make any statements, written or verbal, that defame, disparage, or in any way criticize the personal or business reputation, practices, or conduct of the other party, its employees, directors, and officers. The Parties acknowledge and agree that this prohibition extends to statements, written or verbal, made to anyone, including but not limited to, the news media, investors, potential investors, any board of directors or advisory board or directors, industry analysts, competitors, strategic partners, vendors, employees (past and present), and clients.
MasterClauseData.DIA_Dialysis_Services_p2_Section_3.1_p2: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, training, maintenance, drug and lab services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.ODI_Per_Case_Section_1.2: “Per Case” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to member during an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Case payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member including, but not limited to, Implants, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.ACR_CPT_Codes_Section_1.2: “CPT® Code(s)” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.DME_Continuous_Rentals_Section_3.2: Continuous Rentals. The established fee for DME classified as frequent/substantial servicing (i.e. continuous rentals) is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="DME_Continuous_Rentals" Title="DME_Continuous_Rentals" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>75%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the DMEPOS Schedule as set forth in the Fee source section of this Attachment.
MasterClauseData.OTB_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p1: Rate Updates.  Rates under the BCBST Medicare Opioid Treatment Fee Schedule are equivalent to amounts that would have been payable under Original Medicare to Provider for the same services; provided however, that BCBST updates its BCBST Medicare Opioid Treatment Fee Schedule in the timeframes described in the Provider Manual. No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS's release of a rate and BCBST's implementation of such rate in accordance with the Provider Manual or due to CMS's retroactive implementation of an amended rate.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Long_Term_Acute_Care_Services_Secti: The Per Diem rate is all-inclusive and will cover all supplies and services provided to a Member during the inpatient stay, with the following exceptions, which will be reimbursed as set forth below:
MasterClauseData.CAC_Ambulance_Services_Section_3.2_b: Ambulance Services. Appropriate hospital-based ambulance services provided prior to an Inpatient Stay will be paid in addition to the applicable Payment Rate set forth in the Inpatient Payment Category Table and should be billed by the Provider as an outpatient service. Ambulance charges incurred while the patient is an inpatient are included in the applicable Payment Rate regardless of whether the ambulance provider is owned/operated by Provider or an Affiliate or an independent ambulance contractor. In instances where the ambulance provider is an independent ambulance contractor, ambulance services will be considered Covered Services furnished under arrangement.
MasterClauseData.IRL_Indepent_Laboratory_Services_Section: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services. All providers who perform the technical component of anatomic pathology services for patients must coordinate with the applicable facility regarding the payment of claims for such services.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Ambulance_Services_Section_3.2_b: Ambulance Services. Appropriate hospital-based ambulance services provided prior to an Inpatient Stay will be paid in addition to the DRG Base Rate or other applicable Payment Rate set forth in the Inpatient Payment Category Table and should be billed by the Provider as an outpatient service. Ambulance charges incurred while the patient is an inpatient are included in the DRG Base Rate regardless of whether the ambulance provider is owned/operated by Provider or an Affiliate or an independent ambulance contractor. In instances where the ambulance provider is an independent ambulance contractor, ambulance services will be considered Covered Services furnished under arrangement.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_BMAT_Provider_Attestation_Form_Se: “Buprenorphine Medication Assisted Treatment Provider Attestation Form” refers to the document that must be completed and signed by each prescribing Professional Provider prior to enrollment in and eligibility for reimbursement under the BMAT Program. A copy of the BMAT Program Description is available at www.bcbst.com.
MasterClauseData.ORE_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable will be the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ORE_Maximum_Allowable" Title="ORE_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Payment_Policies_Section_: Observation Services. Provider must obtain Prior Authorization in order to receive payment for Observation Services. In instances where a Member is admitted into an inpatient setting from observation status within 72 hours for related conditions, separate payment will not be made for the Observation Services, and payment for the Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Rate Table will also represent payment for the Observation Services.
MasterClauseData.MABH_Definitions_Section_1: The following terms are defined for the purpose of this Attachment. All other capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Effects_of_Termination_Section_11.7: Effects of Termination.  The termination of this Agreement will not release Provider, except as otherwise determined by BCBST, from any obligation to provide Covered Services to a Member who is being treated by Provider until the Member is transferred to the care of another Network Provider. BCBST will make payments to Provider for such Covered Services in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Upon termination of this Agreement, the Parties will cooperate with each other to affect such orderly transfer as promptly as is medically practicable and appropriate. BCBST will continue to have access to records of Members, for a period of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_TerminationRecordAccessPeriod" Title="CPA_TerminationRecordAccessPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>5 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> after termination of this Agreement, or <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_TerminationRecordAccessBenefitPlanPeriod" Title="CPA_TerminationRecordAccessBenefitPlanPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>10 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> in the case of Members whose Blue Cross Benefit Plan was purchased through the federal health insurance exchange, or as otherwise required by law and as necessary to fulfill the terms of this Agreement and any specific terms applicable to a Network. In addition, in cases of suspected fraud or abuse, BCBST will continue to have access to records until all matters relating to such fraud and abuse have been resolved. The Parties agree that money damages may not be a sufficient remedy for any breach of this Agreement. The non-breaching Party, at its option, will be entitled to terminate this Agreement, to specific performance, and to injunctive relief, in addition to any other remedies available at law or in equity, upon the breach or threatened breach of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.5: Use of Codes. The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.BCE_CMS_Section_1.2: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
